story:
Welcome to The Gedebo Project, a non-profit organization wtih the goal of raising money to build, fund, and maintain a 2000 sq ft Orphange in Ethiopia.

I would like to explain to you how it started , what it is and why we are doing it.

5 years ago my wife and I adopted 2 siblings from Ethiopia, from the first day we were brought together we knew that this was meant to be, an instant family of four. A few months into Canadian life and with her new grasp of our language our  5 year old daughter was finally able to share the news she'd be sitting on unable to explain. They had an older brother that was left behind and they worried about him desperately. With a few lucky breaks and a trip back to Africa my wife Treena was able to locate their older brother and after a few years of waiting and hard work we were able to bring him home to be reunited with his siblings. The childrens last name in Ethiopia was/is Gedebo. We have been fortunate to been gifted land in the villiage of Doyogena, Ethiopia. We are

now using that land to build a 2000sq ft orphanage in the villiage our Long term goal is $150,000 and we will continue to fundraise after its built to maintain the yearly expenses. We have a website http://thegedeboproject.com/. I have added the video of the kids reuninion to give you a look at the potential of these kids. Please help if you can, thank you for taking the time to read a bit of our story

story:
Crossbow Fund Raiser for Nonprofit Farm

We have deer damaging and eating our crops that we grow to Help Feed the Hungry during both the spring and winter crops. With your help we can cut the damage down to a minimum and feed the hungry at the same time.

  • Last year we found that we could feed 500 meals with one deer.
  • We will be able to have an extra 10 days hunting during the deer season if we can raise money for the items below in which to harvest the deer.
  • One deer will feed 500 people a meal with our very nutritious veggie & deer stew.
  • It will allow us to have more food to donate as the deer won't be eating as much of our crops.
  • Will you consider helping us get the Crossbow and Black Powder Rifle so we may have an extra 10 days of hunting during the Primitive Weapon Season for deer.

We need your help to make this happen as this year we have been given permission to harvest ten (10) deer which will feed 5,000 meals to help feed the hungry. Help if you can and please share this with anyone you think would be interested in helping us with this unique way of feeding the hungry.

Lighthouse Food Farm

Learn more about us:

  • Main site > www.jimbonham.com
  • Our Facebook fan page > www.facebook.com/Lighthouse.Food.Farm
  • My Personal Facebook page > www.facebook.com/farmer.jim.bonham

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Some people just can’t contribute money, but you can still Help Us!
  • Please Help get word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! Please! Share this fund raiser campaign Now!
  • Share this with everyone! Ask your friends to share this as well.


You Ask... Why Donate to the Lighthouse Food Farm?

When you donate to Lighthouse Food Farm, you are doing more than helping provide food. You are sending hope and joy to hard working families that are struggling with the difficult decision of whether to pay the bills or pay for groceries.

 

Items to be Purchased with Success of Campaign Funds

This is a list of the merchandise we will be purchasing. I have listed it by the item number (the IK #) at www.cabelas.com so you can look them up to read more about what you are helping purchase by contributing to the Crossbow Fund Raiser linked below:

Below are the items we will be purchasing with your help so we can help feed the hungry:

  1. Stryker StrykeZone 380 Crossbow Package > IK-419701 - $749.99
  2. CVA Accura V2 Muzzleloader Combo with Thumbhole stock >  IK- 217955 - $599.99
  3. Flambeau® Stingray Hard Crossbow Case > IK-416831 - $74.99
  4. Muzzle Loader Accessory Kit > IK-216683 - $54.99
  5. Muzzle Loader Accessory Dry Box > IK-215475 - $19.99
  6. CVA Palm Saver 27" for Accura V2 above > IK-218361 - $27.99
  7. PowerBelt™ Aero Tip and Hollow Ponit Bulk Bullets .50 - 295 gr- Per 50 > IK-216225 - $64.99
  8. 3 boxes of IMR White Hots > IK-216922 @ 24.99 each = $75.97
  9. Carbon Express® Maxima Blue Streak® 22" Bolt > IK-460411 - $64.99
  10. The Block® Black Field Logic Block® Crossbow Target > IK-419817 - $99.99
  11. Excalibur Boltcutter Crossbow Broadheads > IK-418505 - $34.99
  • Which comes to a Grand Total not including tax - $1,868.87 Total

 

Thank you for your support of the Lighthouse Food Farm

Thank you for taking time to view our campaign

~ Farmer Jim ~


Our Contact Information:

Lighthouse Food Farm

% Jim Bonham

1282 Dr. Johns Road

Westminster, SC  29693

985-640-2790

 

NOTE:

Anything raised over this Goal will be saved in a special account to be used to purchase black powder & bullets for the black powder rifle and extra bolts (arrows) for the crossbow. Also for regular maintenance for the Crossbow and Black Powder Muzzle Loader. This will be a yearly harvest for us to help feed the hungry in need.

PERKS: E-books will be delivered via email in Electronic PDF format.



 

Why Donate to the Lighthouse Food Farm?

When you donate to Lighthouse Food Farm, you are doing more than helping provide food. You are sending hope and joy to hard working families that are struggling with the difficult decision of whether to pay the bills or pay for groceries.

Have a Great Day! Thanks for Sharing our fund raiser campaign.

Thank you from:

~~ Farmer Jim and everyone at the Lighthouse Food Farm ~~

story:
Summary:

Thomas Weller is a Good Sumaritan who would simply like the world to be a better place. He traveled the highways of San Diego, in a Ghostbuster-inspired rescue vehicle, helping those in need of roadside assistance, for no price at all.

According to Steve Hartman, from CBS's "On The Road" segment, Mr. Weller offers those he helps a card reading: 'Assisting you has been my pleasure. Pass on the favor by helping someone in distress that you may encounter.'"

Furthermore, the CBS news site states:

It's the same message Tom first heard 40 years ago after he plowed his car into an Illinois snow bank.

"I probably would have froze there if this fellow hadn't stopped and helped me," Weller recalled.

Since then, Tom has paid the favor forward more than 5,000 times.

 

Recently, CBS aired another segment telling of Mr. Weller's story. However, this time, there was sad news: Mr. Weller's rescue car had been totaled after he was cut-off on the highway, and he doesn't have the money to repair it. This hinders his efforts.

This charity has been created to raise $10,000 to go toward the costs to repair his rescue vehicle. Let's lend a helping hand to a man who has helped thousands of people.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to donate money, then simply forward this to your friends and family, via Facebook, Twitter, Google+, or any other social networking platform. Please spread the word so we can reach our goal.
 

Where is your money going?

Every penny donated to this campaign will be delivered to Thomas Weller, regardless of whether we meet the $10,000 goal or not. 

If you'd rather donate to Mr. Weller personally, donations to his efforts can be made to:

San Diego Highwayman
Goose Creek Ranch, 504 Macon St.
El Cajon, Ca. 92019

story:
WOMEN OWNED AND RUN

Two women. Both passionate about Women and Family Health. Both graced with an entrepreneurial spirit and a desire to create a healing space and local shop for hard to find Ayurvedic Medicines and fresh whole food supplies.

Ahara Rasa Ayurveda is the dreamchild of Ayurvedic Health Practitioners and LMT's, Amita Magid and Andrea Shuman. We both specialize in fertility, pregnancy and postpartum care.  (Click here to see our special services). We have each been in the holistic healthcare field for over 15 years and are expanding our private practices into a community center and adding an Ayurvedic Health Supply Shop! 3% of profits will go to our "Mothering the Mothers" fund.


WHAT IS AN AYURVEDIC HEALTH SUPPLY SHOP?

We get it, it sounds abstract but it is really quite awesome. So if you bear with us, we have included photos and descriptions of the unique and hard to find products we will carry. Ayurveda is the 5000+ year old sister science to Yoga and is in charge of the physical and mental aspects of optimal health. We will carry a full herbal pharmacy that goes way beyond tinctures, teas and capsules, although we will have those too. Here is a brief list of what we will carry, to give you an idea of what makes us different from your typical herbal store.

 

Organic Ayurvedic Herbal Pharmacy:

Custom made formulas and traditional formulations. Herbally medicated oils and ghees. Herbal jams and medicinal wines. Syrups and tea blends.

 

Whole Medicinal and Culinary bulk herbs and spices:

Fresh ground at purchase, organic always and local when possible.

 

Ayurvedic Hygiene Products:

Tongue scrapers, neti pots, detox kits, fresh homemade tooth powders and mouthwashes, copper drinking cups, enema kits and sitz baths.

 

  

Basic Ayurvedic Whole Food Supplies:

In-house fresh-made Ahara Rasa ghee, dahl, fresh curry leaves, rice, breakfast grains, dried fruit and fresh grain flours gound to order.

 

Complimentary Support Products:

Therapeutic Grade essential oils, delicious herbal coffee substitutes, hand-made herbal sweets (laddu's) and much more!

 

What Your Participation will do for us:

This campaign will help us to make the leap from small private practice, to a community Ayurvedic Center and Supply Store. It has been our dream since the beginning to have a community hub, where people feel at home in our place of business as well as a one-stop-shop for all things Ayurveda, which is a brand new concept and well embraced by the yoga community (as yoga is the sister science to Ayurveda). Your contribution will change our lives! It will help us to stock our retail store and our complete Ayurvedic Herbal Pharmacy! This will HUGELY help us and give us the opportunity to THRIVE as a business, right away!  So thank you in advance for your support and participation!

What we need:

We need a minimum of $10,800 to get off the ground!  Every penny will go to the folllowing: 

Kitchen and Herb-Store Equipment: Kitchen-aid, Vitamix, cooktop, flour grinder, stainless steel prep table, sinks, etc.

Our first round of inventory: Herbs, containers and products defined above as well as additional supports as needed.

 

What happens If we beat our goal?

Up to $10,000 above the goal, we will add a greenhouse and plant/maintain a local garden of Ayurvedic herbs that can be grown sustainably and locally. Community participation is encouraged in our garden!

Anything we receive above $20,800 will go directly to our "Mothering the Mothers" fund to help medium and low income postpartum women with their recovery, which may include proper meals, herbal formulas, body therapies and healthcare, and postpartum doula care click here for this info. Depending on the need, this fund serves to drastically lower or completely eliminate the cost for postpartum care.

What you get:

Our Perks are good for you and your participation is appreciated!!

$10 Thank You for Being a Friend

You get: The knowledge that you contributed to an independent women-owned business and we'll send you a hand written thank you note to put on your fridge.  We'll also send you our e-handouts on healthy eating practices and seasonal change tips.

$25  Breathing Life into Our World

You get: The Perks above, plus a guided meditation and pranayama MP3 to aid you on your path.

$50 What a Love, You Deserve a Kiss

You get: The Perks above, plus a beautiful Copper Tongue Scraper.

NEW! $79- Straight Up Presale 60 minute massage Gift Certificate

 

$100 Om Shanti, Thank You So Much

You get: The Perks above, plus a beautiful Neti Pot to keep your head happy! 

NEW! $108- Straight Up Pre-sale 90 minute massage Gift Certificate!

NEW! $150- Straight Up Pre sale 4-handed Massage OR Ayurvedic Consult Gift Certificate!

 

 

$1000 Humbled, Full Hearted and Deeply Thankful!

You get:  Ayurvedic Health Super Pak:  Includes initial health consult, live or online plus either 4 follow-ups OR 2 follow-ups plus 4-handed massage for one (1).  Hygiene package:  Includes neti pot, tongue scraper and tooth powder. You'll also go down in history on our Wall of Gratitude as part of our "Giving Tree" mural as a Branch.**

$3000  7 day PK with 9 days lodging and food 

You Get: The chance to reset your system with Ayurvedic Pancha Karma (special detox regimine for renewed health and longevity) Pre cleanse consult and directions for preparation before you arrive. 7 days of treatments and consult, 3 hours per day. You will be fed a special diet and housed in our on-site boarding facility with private bath and kitchenette. We are located in the Beautiful woodstock neighborhood in Portland, Oregon.

This package will be $3700 when we are officially open, so if You choose to get this now, you will save $700! 

There are only a few of these available due to the time and labor. There are 2 therapists treating you. You receive 4 handed treatments when appropriate and the specific treatments are taylored to your needs. You will not believe how you feel after this. A spa-detox has nothing on PK. Give Ayurveda a try instead of the health spa this year and save a bunch!

 

 

 

**If you don't Live in Portland, and/or want to donate a larger amount, please contact us to make a "custom perk" just for you to make it worth your while!

story:
The Ulife Story

Well, hello. We are Abe Choe, Daniel Lee and Vinh Luu—three entrepreneurs who are obsessed with school spirit and being our own bosses.

We love our Ducks—so much so that we founded Ulife (while we were still in college) to make the kind of University of Oregon (UO) branded products we wanted to buy but couldn’t find in stores. Let’s just say, Puddles is proud like a papa duck.

But we need your help.

We’re ready to order UO-branded iPhone5 and iPad3 cases, and to do that, we need the moola (AKA cash money) to place the order. We already have an awesome manufacturer. We have an innovative team and a new online store. We even have shelf space in The Duck Store, Walgreens, The Mac Store and Made in Oregon. And yeah, we have our own touchdown dance too.

By making a contribution to Ulife, you'll enable us to bring you sleek, stylish technology swag that showcases your infatuation with your Ducks.

Thanks to the help of a few family members and friends who agreed to invest in the company, Ulife got the foundation it needed. We then applied for ABC’s Shark Tank season four and made it to the final video submission rounds. We barely missed making it for season 4. We'll try again next season.  Going forward, we are running this Indiegogo campaign and are hoping to prove that raising capital doesn’t have to be the hardest part of growing a startup and spreading some Duck love.

Contributor Perks

In exchange for your contribution, we've got some seriously cool stuff to give away, including Ulife products, a photo shoot with Puddles, and a pair of tickets to the Duck game on November 17, 2012 against Stanford (we're talking seats on the 45 yard line, only nine rows back). For full details, check out the perk boxes to the right.

Side Note: We Give Back to Students

Part of the Ulife culture involves giving back, specifically to students. For every UO product sold via the Ulife website, Ulife donates $2 to a UO textbook fund. Prior to the start of each college term, a Ulife contest is held. Winners receive up to $250 to purchase textbooks. This is Ulife’s way of supporting students and inspiring them to give back to their communities. Pretty sweet, right?

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t afford to help us out, we totally understand. But we hope you’ll spread the word about our fundraising campaign by talking to UO students, UO alumni, your rich uncles and other crazy, loaded Duck fans. If you happen to rub elbows with Phil Knight, don’t hesitate to send him our way. And of course, support us by liking us on Facebook and following us on Twitter. Win The Day!

Thanks to the help of a few family members and friends who agreed to invest in the company, Ulife got the foundation it needed. We then applied for ABC’s Shark Tank season four and made it to the final video submission rounds. We barely missed making it for season 4. We'll try again next season.  Going forward, we are running this Indiegogo campaign and are hoping to prove that raising capital doesn’t have to be the hardest part of growing a startup and spreading some Duck love.
Contributor Perks
In exchange for your contribution, we've got some seriously cool stuff to give away, including Ulife products, a photo shoot with Puddles, and a pair of tickets to the Duck game on November 17, 2012 against Stanford (we're talking seats on the 45 yard line, only nine rows back). For full details, check out the perk boxes to the right.
Side Note: We Give Back to Students
Part of the Ulife culture involves giving back, specifically to students. For every UO product sold via the Ulife website, Ulife donates $2 to a UO textbook fund. Prior to the start of each college term, a Ulife contest is held. Winners receive up to $250 to purchase textbooks. This is Ulife’s way of supporting students and inspiring them to give back to their communities. Pretty sweet, right?
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can’t afford to help us out, we totally understand. But we hope you’ll spread the word about our fundraising campaign by talking to UO students, UO alumni, your rich uncles and other crazy, loaded Duck fans. If you happen to rub elbows with Phil Knight, don’t hesitate to send him our way. And of course, support us by liking us on Facebook and following us on Twitter. Win The Day!

story:
In 2010, Haiti was devastated by an earthquake, killing and estimated 300,000 and leaving more than one million people homeless. I had the wonderful experience of visiting Haiti with Habitat for Humanity in 2011. Working from sun up to sun down, I helped build 2 homes in a week. We actually did not finish the homes completely but we did as much as we could. Habitat and the homeowners promised to finish and they did! Last year a part of my team returned and sent me pics. The homes even had beautiful gardens. The people of Haiti are dedicated to building a better life.

This February, I'm going back! This time with the Grace Fuller Center.

We will build a duplex home as part of the Lambi Project, which includes homes, communal bathhouses, latrines and a community center. The families selected to receive these homes are among those living in the tents that border the Lambi site. That means these people have been living in tents for 3 years! The project will complete 60 homes and include flood control measures.

To help mw with this trip, I will need $1400 to cover a donation to the build, the materials and the skilled laborers we need, food, lodging, in country transportation and health/medical insurance for the duration of your trip. 

If I don't reach my goal, the funds will still go to the Fuller Center to help with future home builds. (Each house will cost approximately $8,000 to build). 

Thank you so much for reading this and please help me share this project via the Indiegogo sharing tools!

Thank you,

Judy Guevara

story: We have a family owned business that has been in operation for over 5 years. We are a vital part of the community. We lend a hand to everyone that walks through our doors. People come and ask us for money for food instead of giving them cash we give them food at no price. All our customers are from this same neighborhood. Everyone that knows us know that they can come to our home even when they do not have enough for their groceries. We will help and give them what they need until they are able to get back on their feet. It has always been like this. We never looked at our store as an organization that just wants profit. We have been struggling for the past 7 months due to the owner of the building filing for bankruptcy. We never thought about buying the property until the bank informed us about the foreclosure that they will pursue. Unless we are able to raise enough money to purchase the property we will have to vacate soon. We have had our ups and downs along with the city of Detroit-which has also filed for bankruptcy- but our family is what has kept us motivated and ambitious. There are a lot of vacant and abandoned buildings in Detroit due to the economic struggle. We do not want to leave an empty building and be a distant memory of when there was a time of families helping families. Please consider the possibilities of helping this great city. Any questions that you may have please do not hesitate to ask.

story:
Circle of Friends' Cocoon Project is working to improve the lot of poor women and children at the Happy Home Orphanage in Puttaparthi, India. We're doing all we can do to advance women's equality and empowerment. "Pride in Productivity" is our byline - giving hope, not handouts, we're inspiring change.

 Our Happy Home Sewing Project will provide fair-wage employment, skill training, and housing for some of these women and others living in villages outside Puttaparthy. These women have been locked into the cycle of poverty and are now living in tents.  We are currently in the process of building a workshop and another building where these women can live and work on the grounds of the Happy Home Orphanage where some have placed children whom they cannot support. So besides upgrading these women's skill levels and providing them with good jobs, they will be able to spend more time with their children. They will be sewing our own designs, and we will be marketing their products both in India and in the U.S. 

We need to raise $4,500 to build the workspace, living space, purchase sewing machines and material and pay the workers a living wage until we reach profitability.  If we do not reach the entire goal, whatever we do raise will go toward this project. Even a small contribution will make a tremendous difference in the lives of these women.

A bit about Happy Home Orphanage:   the nearby Happy Home Orphanage is a non-profit organisation dedicated to improving the welfare of orphans, street children and homeless people by providing them with housing, feeding and education.  Happy Home provides a loving and nurturing environment in which children with traumatic backgrounds can start a new life. 

Most of the children are indigent street urchins who come from the lower economic section of the society and who have not had the privilege of any kind of homecare or education, which means they have no formal education what-so-ever even at the age 9 or 10. They are hungry, unkempt and scared before they enter our home. Their main focus for survival is food. We start preparing them to feel safe, secure and happy as they have security of a room, guidance, and of course nutritious food.

Not all our students are orphans though, some are brought to us by their parents who know they will have better opportunities at Happy Home. 



        Our aim is to mold the character of our children into strong and honest individuals with full confidence and courage to become good, pure and self-reliant adults.  We believe that providing a safe and loving environment will help these young people develop into kind, thoughtful, responsible and friendly people.


Our Sewing Project has already made a big difference. 

Vasantha is the first woman to work at Cocoon. She got married when she was only fifteen. She and her sister got married on the same day. After one year her husband abandoned her, leaving her in a rented room by herself.  Vasantha didn't know at the time that she was three months pregnant.  She was so sick she could not work because of her stress and emotional trauma, so she went home to stay with her parents, and then to her husband's home. Unfortunately, her mother- and father-in-law rejected her, believing that the baby wasn't their son's child. She was totally alone, frightened and emotionally fragile.



A kind lady from her neighborhood took her in to her home to help her, giving her job cleaning the house and taking care of her baby. This kind lady helped Vasantha with milk and housing after her baby was born. Soon after Vasantha gave birth to her baby girl, she became deaf in both ears. Her life was so unbearable that she thought that if she did not have her daughter she would have killed herself.

She did not want to live in this miserable state. For so long she had felt no love or compassion from the people who were supposed to love and care for her, relying solely on the kindness of strangers. She felt unloved and alone except for her own daughter. She hated her life. Her heart became like a stone. Vasantha came to the Happy Home to work in 2013. When she first came she was very sad and never smiled, but that soon changed.

When Cocoon was started this year, Vasantha was very interested in learning a skill and working to earn money for her herself and her daughter and also to help others. She said "I feel that the world is beautiful now and I don't want to leave world anymore, I want to live ever and ever after.'' Vasantha is so grateful for the help and support that Cocoon has given her, and for the love from everyone involved. She now loves everything she is doing, and has hope for the future.    

 

Perks

Roberta Anderson, one of our Cocoon members has written a book, “Thank You India,” about her 2012 experience of transformation which flowered during months of confinement after breaking her leg in Puttaparthy. Roberta is offering all the proceeds of her book sales to the Cocoon Project.    

 

We are offering a range of perks in exchange for donations including Greeting Cards that the children make, copies of "Thank You India"


And if you can't contribute money, please use the Indiegogo share tools and your own networks to get the word out to more people.

Thank you from the seamstresses of Cocoon!

story:
Récemment, la commission européenne a voté sans notre
    consentement   la mention qui permet l'introduction des OGM
                 chez nous, en Europe !  Jusqu'où ira-t-on ? (en savoir plus).

Un traité transatlantique entre les Etats-Unis et l’Europe est en train d’être négocié également sans notre consentement, avec des conséquences catastrophiques pour la planète, notre santé et nos libertés essentielles (en savoir plus).  Tout cela n'est pas suffisamment médiatisé, cela doit changer.

Il est vital de nous sensibiliser quant à l'urgence de mettre la nutrition et la consommation consciente au centre de nos préoccupations, de mettre fin au gaspillage de nos ressources naturelles et de faire respecter la Terre et tous ceux qui y vivent, les animaux y compris.

Acheter, c'est voter !


Par la manière dont nous dépensons notre argent, nous sponsorisons le monde dans lequel nos enfants vont grandir.  Avec Vidya, vous choisissez de voir les choses en blanc :),

Nous avons créé l'ASBL Vidya car nous désirons nous engager pour assurer que notre futur ne sera pas celui que les multinationales et autres lobby agroalimentaires, pharmaceutiques et industriels tentent de faire apparaître et manipulant les lois et les médias.

Vidy a pour finalité sociale d’amplifier nos efforts pour la réappropriation de notre alimentation et de notre santé.  Comment?

  • Vidya va mettre à votre disposition, si nous réalisons notre objectif, un site internet interactif qui vous permettra, après avoir répondu à quelques questions 'ayurvédiques', de créer votre fiche santé, et de générer un mois de recettes adaptées à votre type psycho-corporel, avec une liste d'ingrédients, les quantités à acheter, les prix indicatifs et où se les procurer.
  • nous organiserons des cours de cuisine santé selon l'Ayurvéda,
  • divers ateliers: faire ses courses bio pas cher, utiliser les épices pour se soigner et mieux digérer, perdre du poids lentement mais sainement,
  • des conférences de conscientisation,
  • des actions directes pour challenger les acteurs européens et faire entendre VOTRE voix, VOTRE avis, VOTRE droit à la santé.
  • via notre page Facebook déjà existante et pleine de recettes, de conseils santé, livres à télécharger, reportages, et tout cela gratuitement :)
  • et notre chaîne YouTube, riche en reportages de qualité sur l'Ayurvéda et les dessous de l'industrie.

Ensembles, reprenons notre santé en main !

Quand on dit nous, c'est Alain Minnoy et Grégory Dahan


 

"Bonjour, je suis Alain Minnoy, 42 ans, ex 'gars du système', qui travaillait dans une multinationale multi hiérarchisée.  Un jour, j'ai eu une prise de conscience fulgurante, il fallait que le travail que j'accomplis soit en accord avec mes principes et surtout utile à la planète et à l'autre.  C'est en Inde que j'ai découvert l'Ayurvéda et j'ai poursuivi ma formation à Tapovan en Normandie.
Après 8 années de pratique et 25 kg de moins, je suis prêt à partager mon expérience en diététique et nutrition holistique avec vous."

"Salut, je suis Grégory Dahan, j’ai 34 ans, j’ai travaillé pendant 10 ans en tant que consultant en stratégie d’entreprise spécialisé en ressources humaines pour diverses multinationales. Oui j’étais celui qui aidait à restructurer et à informatiser les process internes des entreprises. Il y a 1 an, j’ai décidé de tout quitter pour créer ma start’up en stratégie qui a pour but d’aider les petites entreprises à s’en sortir dans le marché actuel en pleine transformation. (Elle sera lancée en Septembre) J’ai également décidé de m’engager dans la société civile pour essayer de faire changer notre société actuelle qui ne tourne plus rond. C’est lors de ce processus de création que j’ai rencontré Alain et que j'ai décidé de me joindre à lui dans la création de Vidya qui sera je l’espère grâce à vous une plateforme de lutte contre la « malbouffe », les OGM et autres horreurs que l’on veut nous faire accepter de gré ou de force."

En Inde, Alain a fait une belle rencontre, Organic India :


Au cœur d’ORGANIC INDIA se trouve leur engagement à personnifier l’amour et la conscience en action. Ils travaillent avec milliers de petites familles de fermiers en Inde qui cultivent à l’ancienne et sans pesticides au total des dizaines de milliers d’acres de terres arable. Tous leurs produits promeuvent la santé et le bien-être, et sont réalisés avec le plus grand soin.

Organic India, depuis plus de 15 ans, lutte activement et avec succès contre les multinationales agroalimentaires en Inde, et permet peu à peu aux fermiers de reprendre possession de leur terres, de les assainir, et de cultiver des produits d’une qualité exceptionnelle.

Suivons leur exemple en important chez nous ces valeurs, en menant notre lutte à leur côté, pour éviter l’introduction des OGM dans nos assiettes.

Les valeurs de notre partenaire Organic India sont aussi celles de Vidya.

Organic India possède toutes les certifications nécessaires pour garantir la qualité de ses produits, car il contrôle toute sa chaîne: production, distribution, transformation.  Il n'y a aucun sous-traitant ni intermédiaire.


Organic India a également créé un nouveau standard dans le monde de l'économie durable, EARTHSEER pour s'assurer non seulement de la qualité des produits, mais du respect de tous les acteurs de la chaîne, de la Terre, en passant par le fermier et l'employé, jusqu'à l'utilisateur final, càd nous. 



Grâce à votre contribution, nous pourrons importer des épices, des plantes ayurvédiques sèches certifiées bio et Fairtrade ainsi que quelques autres produits de consommation courante depuis l'Inde et les mettre à votre disposition en Belgique (tous nos produits) et en Europe (épices uniquement). 

Nos produits alimentaires secs certifiés d’origine biologiques  et sans OGM sont issus du commerce équitable (épices indiennes, riz, infusions curatives, …) 

Nos produits seront acheminés depuis l'Inde par bateau, ce qui consomme au minimum dix fois moins de carburant que par voie terrestre ou aérienne. 

Quelles sont les émissions de CO2 produites par le transport maritime ?
Les navires font partie des modes de transport les moins polluants. Ils émettent entre 10 et 15 g par tonne-kilomètre, contre de 19 à 41 g/tkm pour le rail, de 51 à 91 g/tkm pour la route et de 673 à 867 g/tkm pour le transport aérien.

Nos produits seront ensuite transportés vers notre espace de stockage à Bruxelles et distribués dans divers points de vente, comme les magasins et marchés bio, les cafés, restaurants 'green' et les centres bien-être, mais seront également disponibles via notre site de e-commerce.


En résumé, voici ce que l'on vous propose en échange de votre contribution:

  • Améliorer sa santé en se faisant plaisir, tout en respectant son budget.
  • Devenir acteur et cocréateur d'une économie éthique et durable.
  • Etre personnellement impliqué dans le développement d’un mode de consommation plus responsable et respectueux de l’environnement.
  • Des moyens concrets pour améliorer votre nutrition (cours, recettes, ...)
  • Faciliter un retour à un mode de vie plus naturel.
  • Soutenir une cause qui aura un impact positif sur la planète et notre quotidien à tous et à toutes.
  • Aider indirectement un pays en difficulté, l’Inde, à reprendre le contrôle de ses terres face aux énormes multinationales agroalimentaires.




et de votre généreuse contribution, nous
vous offrons des produits et services de qualité

Si 10,000 personnes donnent environ 5 euros, notre aventure 
socio-culinaire sera couronnée de succès. 5 euros pour contribuer
à faire évoluer notre mode de consommation, améliorer notre santé ET faire des économies, tout cela en améliorant notre environnement.

!!! Les frais de port ne sont pas inclus pour toutes les options !!!
Merci de rajouter le montant des frais
d'envoi à vos dons s'il y a lieu de le faire
Les frais inclus sont indiqués par FREE 

Voici les codes pour les envois hors de Belgique:
(1) Allemagne, France (sauf Dom-Tom), Grand-Duché de Luxembourg, Pays Bas et Royaume Uni.
(2) Açores, Autriche, Bulgarie, Chypre, Danemark, Espagne, Estonie, Finlande, Grèce, Hongrie, Irlande, Italie, Lettonie, Lituanie, Madère, Malte, Man (Île), Monaco, Pologne, Portugal, Roumanie, Slovaquie, Slovénie, Suède, Tchéquie. 
(3) Albanie, Andorre, Biélorussie, Bosnie-Herzégovine, Croatie, Féroé (Iles), Géorgie, Gibraltar, Guernesey, Islande, Jersey, Liechtenstein, Macédoine, Moldavie, Monténégro, Norvège, Russie, Saint-Marin, Serbie, Suisse, Turquie, Ukraine, Vatican. 
(4) Algérie, Egypte, Israël, Jordanie, Maroc, Syrie, Tunisie, Etats-Unis 
(5) Tous les autres pays

!!! La valeur de votre don en euros est indiquée ci-dessous !!!

La recette du bonheur (1)
7$ - 5,2€

Merci infiniment de votre contribution! Votre nom sera repris sur la page 'Généreux contributeurs' de notre site et vous recevrez un cours d'ayurvéda de plus de 70 pages en pdf par mail, contenant des recettes, des conseils de nutritions et bien plus. 

Cette offre est automatiquement incluse dans toutes les offres supérieures !

L’affaire est dans le sac (2)
20$ - 14,8€

Pour ce généreux don, recevez ce superbe sac réutilisable en toile de jute Organic India entièrement fait main, édition limitée Vidya. Soyez les premiers à en avoir un pour faire votre marché. Résistants, spacieux et en fibres naturelles, un must pour faire ses courses bio.  Le sac que vous recevrez indiquera: Edition limitée et la ligne de texte mentionnera les informations de contact de Vidya.

de 0 à 30.000€ : 

  • Commander les produits en Inde et les faire venir par bateau en Belgique, les transporter à Bruxelles, assurer leur stockage, conditionnement et distribution.
  • Création et maintenance de notre site Internet de base et plate-forme de e-commerce.
  • Informer la population sur la nutrition saine, sur le danger des OGM, sur les décisions européennes prises sans notre accord et sur le danger des produits issus de l'industrie agroalimentaire.

de 30.000€ - 50.000€ : avec plus de 30.000€ nous pourrons commencer à mettre en place une structure, sous la forme d'un site internet interactif, qui aide les gens à mieux consommer (1 mois de recette saines, avec la liste et le coût des ingrédients, où les acheter, végétarien ou pas) qui leur permet de créer leur carte d'identité ayurvédique ou passeport santé :).  Une interface qui en fonction de vos réponses à quelques questions, vous donnera des conseils nutritionnels et un plan de recettes sur 1 mois.  Mais aussi, cette plateforme vous mettra en contact un praticien santé de votre choix, dans la profession de votre choix, en fonction de divers critères (géographiques, prix, horaires, ...)
Nous pourrons apporter des solutions concrètes sous la forme de conférences de sensibilisation à une nutrition saine et aux dangers des OGM et des produits alimentaires issus du secteur industriel.

de 70.000€ - 100.000€: 

  • Si nous dépassons le montant souhaité, nous pourrons faire valider auprès de l'AFSCA et importer la gamme de suppléments aux herbes ayurvédiques Organic India pour le bénéfice de nos concitoyen(nes) belges (180€/produit de la gamme) et commencer à démarcher nos clients.






1) Les épices

En plus d'aider à la digestion, les épices ont de multiples propriétés qui nous aident à rester en bonne santé ou à la retrouver.

Nos épices seront disponibles au détail et en vrac,  comme pour les grossistes et pour les particuliers.

Cliquez ici pour voir les détails sur nos épices ainsi que leurs bienfaits pour la santé 

Cumin, en graines ou moulu.
Coriandre, en graines ou moulue.
Cannelle, écorce ou moulue.
Fenouil, en graines.
Curcuma, moulu.
Clou de Girofle, entier.
Cardamome, avec la cosse.
Fenugrec, en graines.
Gingembre, séché, moulu.
Noix de Muscade, entière.
Piment Rouge, entier ou moulu.

Poivre Noir, en graines.

2) Plantes ayurvédiques

- Le Tulsi  (Basilic Sacré) -

Le Tulsi est un produit encore très peu répandu sur le marché, et le Tulsi Organic India est certifié d'origine biologique et d'une qualité incomparable.


Description du Tulsi

Depuis plus de 5000 ans, le Tulsi (aussi connu sous le nom de Basilic Sacré) est considéré en Inde comme la "Reine des Herbes" et y est révérée comme l'une des plantes les plus sacrées de l'Inde, infusée d'un pouvoir de guérison.

Les feuilles de Tulsi sont utilisées pour faire un thé délicieux et rafraîchissant aux multiples vertus curatives.

Tandis que le Tulsi voyageait le long des premières routes commerciales de l'Orient vers l'Europe, il devint connu des Chrétiens comme basilic "saint" ou "sacré", comme on peut le voir reflété dans son nom latin botanique: Ocimum sanctum.

La recherche moderne a classifié le Tulsi en tant que plante adaptogène.  Les plantes adaptogènes ont prouvé leur effet positif sur le système immunitaire tout en amoindrissant les effets négatifs du stress.

Ces plantes adaptogènes sont utilisées en médecine ayurvédique et chinoise depuis des milliers d'années afin de promouvoir et de maintenir la santé.  Bien des plantes adaptogènes ont été qualifiées par les herboristes de rajeunissantes, énergisantes et reconstituantes.  Elles aident le corps à s'adapter aux facteurs de stress environnementaux, physiques et émotionnels, assurent un bon fonctionnement du corps et restaurent l'équilibre.


Le Tulsi Organic India est certifié bio, cultivé sans pesticides et inclus des feuilles de Tulsi de 3 variétés différentes: Rama, Vana et Krishna.  Chaque variété a une apparence, un goût et une fragrance bien caractéristique, qui lorsqu'on les combine, crée une infusion parfaitement équilibrée aux multiples vertus curatives:

  • Soulagement et protection face au stress quotidien
  • Augmente l'immunité
  • Riche en antioxydants
  • Accroît l'endurance
  • Adaptogène puissant
  • Facilite la digestion
  • Anti-vieillissement
  • Équilibre le métabolisme
  • Équilibre les énergies 
  • Remonte le moral

Certifié Kosher et Halal


Notre gamme d'infusions TULSI bien-être 



Notre gamme d'infusions TULSI

Nos infusions sont conditionnées en boites de 18 sachets,


 Ou en boites métalliques contenant 100g de mélange en vrac.


  - Nos plantes en vrac pour les praticiens en Ayurvéda -

Mais aussi pour vous, si vous avez décidé de reprendre votre santé en main, ces plantes sont pour vous.

Toutes les plantes Organic India sont certifiées cultivées sans pesticides, ne contiennent pas d'OGM, et seront disponibles en vrac.

Amla, Ashwagandha, Neem, Shatavari, Gotu Kola (Centella asiatica), Triphala, Pippali (Poivre Long), Psyllium, Séné, Gokshura (Tribulus terrestris), Tulsi (les 3 variétés).
D'autres plantes sont disponibles sur demande spécifique.

  - Autres produits certifiés bio -

Voici les autres produits que nous pourrons importer également si les fonds récoltés dépassent la barre des 30.000€.

Ghee (beurre clarifié): la meilleure huile cuisson, excellente pour la santé.
Avec l'assurance que les vaches sont bien traitées et ne sont pas séparées de leurs petits.
Huile de Noix de Coco extra vierge, pressée à froid.
Chyawanprash, une délicieuse marmelade contenant près de 40 fruits, épices et herbes ayurvédiques, préparée selon une tradition multimillénaire. Rajeunissant, énergisant, booste le système immunitaire, riche source de Vitamines C.

Mais également:

Riz Basmati blanc et brun 
Lentilles (Dal): mung dal = soja vert / massoor dal = lentilles corail
Sel rose de l'Himalaya: en cristaux très fins

story_txt:
Récemment, la commission européenne a voté sans notre     consentement   la mention qui permet l'introduction des OGM                  chez nous, en Europe !  Jusqu'où ira-t-on ? (en savoir plus).Un
traité transatlantique entre les Etats-Unis et l’Europe est en train d’être
négocié également sans notre consentement, avec des conséquences
catastrophiques pour la planète, notre santé et nos libertés essentielles (en savoir plus).  Tout cela n'est pas suffisamment médiatisé, cela doit changer.Il est vital de nous sensibiliser quant à l'urgence de mettre la nutrition et la consommation consciente au centre de nos préoccupations, de mettre fin au gaspillage de nos ressources naturelles et de faire respecter la Terre et tous ceux qui y vivent, les animaux y compris.Acheter, c'est voter !

Par la manière dont nous dépensons notre argent, nous sponsorisons le monde dans lequel nos enfants vont grandir.  Avec Vidya, vous choisissez de voir les choses en blanc :),Nous avons créé l'ASBL Vidya car nous désirons nous engager pour assurer que notre futur ne sera pas celui que les multinationales et autres lobby agroalimentaires, pharmaceutiques et industriels tentent de faire apparaître et manipulant les lois et les médias.Vidy
a pour finalité sociale d’amplifier
nos efforts pour la réappropriation de notre alimentation et de notre santé.  Comment?

Vidya va mettre à votre disposition, si nous réalisons notre objectif, un site internet interactif qui vous permettra, après avoir répondu à quelques questions 'ayurvédiques', de créer votre fiche santé, et de générer un mois de recettes adaptées à votre type psycho-corporel, avec une liste d'ingrédients, les quantités à acheter, les prix indicatifs et où se les procurer.

nous organiserons des cours de cuisine santé selon l'Ayurvéda,
divers ateliers: faire ses courses bio pas cher, utiliser les épices pour se soigner et mieux digérer, perdre du poids lentement mais sainement,
des conférences de conscientisation,
des actions directes pour challenger les acteurs européens et faire entendre VOTRE voix, VOTRE avis, VOTRE droit à la santé.
via notre page Facebook déjà existante et pleine de recettes, de conseils santé, livres à télécharger, reportages, et tout cela gratuitement :)
et notre chaîne YouTube, riche en reportages de qualité sur l'Ayurvéda et les dessous de l'industrie.
Ensembles, reprenons notre santé en main !Quand on dit nous, c'est Alain Minnoy et Grégory Dahan
 "Bonjour, je suis Alain Minnoy, 42 ans, ex 'gars du système', qui travaillait dans une multinationale multi hiérarchisée.  Un jour, j'ai eu une prise de conscience fulgurante, il fallait que le travail que j'accomplis soit en accord avec mes principes et surtout utile à la planète et à l'autre.  C'est en Inde que j'ai découvert l'Ayurvéda et j'ai poursuivi ma formation à Tapovan en Normandie.Après 8 années de pratique et 25 kg de moins, je suis prêt à partager mon expérience en diététique et nutrition holistique avec vous.""Salut, je suis Grégory Dahan, j’ai 34 ans, j’ai travaillé pendant 10 ans en tant que consultant en stratégie d’entreprise spécialisé en ressources humaines pour diverses multinationales.
Oui j’étais celui qui aidait à restructurer et à informatiser les process internes des entreprises. Il y a 1 an, j’ai décidé de tout quitter pour créer ma start’up en stratégie qui a pour but d’aider les petites entreprises à s’en sortir dans le marché actuel en pleine transformation. (Elle sera lancée en Septembre)
J’ai également décidé de m’engager dans la société civile pour essayer de faire changer notre société actuelle qui ne tourne plus rond. 
C’est lors de ce processus de création que j’ai rencontré Alain et que j'ai décidé de me joindre à lui dans la création de Vidya qui sera je l’espère grâce à vous une plateforme de lutte contre la « malbouffe », les OGM et autres horreurs que l’on veut nous faire accepter de gré ou de force."En Inde, Alain a fait une belle rencontre, Organic India :Au cœur d’ORGANIC INDIA se trouve leur engagement à personnifier l’amour et la conscience en action. Ils travaillent avec milliers de petites familles de fermiers en Inde qui cultivent à l’ancienne et sans pesticides au total des dizaines de milliers d’acres de terres arable. Tous leurs produits promeuvent la santé et le bien-être, et sont réalisés avec le plus grand soin.Organic India, depuis plus de 15 ans, lutte activement et avec succès contre les multinationales agroalimentaires en Inde, et permet peu à peu aux fermiers de reprendre possession de leur terres, de les assainir, et de cultiver des produits d’une qualité exceptionnelle.Suivons leur exemple en important chez nous ces valeurs, en menant notre lutte à leur côté, pour éviter l’introduction des OGM dans nos assiettes.Les valeurs de notre partenaire Organic India sont aussi celles de Vidya.Organic India possède toutes les certifications nécessaires pour garantir la qualité de ses produits, car il contrôle toute sa chaîne: production, distribution, transformation.  Il n'y a aucun sous-traitant ni intermédiaire.Organic India a également créé un nouveau standard dans le monde de l'économie durable, EARTHSEER pour s'assurer non seulement de la qualité des produits, mais du respect de tous les acteurs de la chaîne, de la Terre, en passant par le fermier et l'employé, jusqu'à l'utilisateur final, càd nous. Grâce à votre contribution, nous pourrons importer des épices, des plantes ayurvédiques sèches certifiées bio et Fairtrade ainsi que quelques autres produits de consommation courante depuis l'Inde et les mettre à votre disposition en Belgique (tous nos produits) et en Europe (épices uniquement). Nos produits alimentaires secs certifiés d’origine biologiques  et sans OGM sont issus du commerce équitable (épices indiennes, riz, infusions curatives, …) Nos produits seront acheminés depuis l'Inde par bateau, ce qui consomme au minimum dix fois moins de carburant que par voie terrestre ou aérienne. Quelles sont les émissions de CO2 produites par le transport maritime ?Les navires font partie des modes de transport les moins polluants. Ils émettent entre 10 et 15 g par tonne-kilomètre, contre de 19 à 41 g/tkm pour le rail, de 51 à 91 g/tkm pour la route et de 673 à 867 g/tkm pour le transport aérien.Nos produits seront ensuite transportés vers notre espace de stockage à Bruxelles et distribués dans divers points de vente, comme les magasins et marchés bio, les cafés, restaurants 'green' et les centres bien-être, mais seront également disponibles via notre site de e-commerce.En résumé, voici ce que l'on vous propose en échange de votre contribution:
Améliorer sa santé en se faisant plaisir, tout en respectant son budget.
Devenir acteur et cocréateur d'une économie éthique et durable.
Etre personnellement impliqué dans le développement d’un mode de consommation plus responsable et respectueux de l’environnement.
Des moyens concrets pour améliorer votre nutrition (cours, recettes, ...)
Faciliter un retour à un mode de vie plus naturel.
Soutenir une cause qui aura un impact positif sur la planète et notre quotidien à tous et à toutes.
Aider indirectement un pays en difficulté, l’Inde, à reprendre le contrôle de ses terres face aux énormes multinationales agroalimentaires.
et de votre généreuse contribution, nous vous offrons des produits et services de qualitéSi 10,000 personnes donnent environ 5 euros, notre aventure socio-culinaire sera couronnée de succès. 5 euros pour contribuer à faire évoluer notre mode de consommation, améliorer notre santé ET faire des économies, tout cela en améliorant notre environnement.!!! Commander les produits en Inde et les faire venir par bateau en Belgique, les transporter à Bruxelles, assurer leur stockage, conditionnement et distribution.

Création et maintenance de notre site Internet de base et plate-forme de e-commerce.

Informer la population sur la nutrition saine, sur le danger des OGM, sur les décisions européennes prises sans notre accord et sur le danger des produits issus de l'industrie agroalimentaire.
de 30.000€ - 50.000€ : avec plus de 30.000€ nous pourrons commencer à mettre en place une structure, sous la forme d'un site internet interactif, qui aide les gens à mieux consommer (1 mois de recette saines, avec la liste et le coût des ingrédients, où les acheter, végétarien ou pas) qui leur permet de créer leur carte d'identité ayurvédique ou passeport santé :).  Une interface qui en fonction de vos réponses à quelques questions, vous donnera des conseils nutritionnels et un plan de recettes sur 1 mois.  Mais aussi, cette plateforme vous mettra en contact un praticien santé de votre choix, dans la profession de votre choix, en fonction de divers critères (géographiques, prix, horaires, ...)Nous pourrons apporter des solutions concrètes sous la forme de conférences de sensibilisation à une nutrition saine et aux dangers des OGM et des produits alimentaires issus du secteur industriel.de 70.000€ - 100.000€: Si nous dépassons le montant souhaité, nous pourrons faire valider auprès de l'AFSCA et importer la gamme de suppléments aux herbes ayurvédiques Organic India pour le bénéfice de nos concitoyen(nes) belges (180€/produit de la gamme) et commencer à démarcher nos clients.1) Les épicesEn plus d'aider à la digestion, les épices ont de multiples propriétés qui nous aident à rester en bonne santé ou à la retrouver.Nos épices seront disponibles au détail et en vrac,  comme pour les grossistes et pour les particuliers.Cliquez ici pour voir les détails sur nos épices ainsi que leurs bienfaits pour la santé 
Cumin, en graines ou moulu.Coriandre, en graines ou moulue.Cannelle, écorce ou moulue.Fenouil, en graines.Curcuma, moulu.Clou de Girofle, entier.Cardamome, avec la cosse.Fenugrec, en graines.Gingembre, séché, moulu.Noix de Muscade, entière.Piment Rouge, entier ou moulu.Moutarde Brune, en graines.Poivre Noir, en graines.Sel Rose de l'Himalaya, extra-fin.
2) Plantes ayurvédiques- Le Tulsi  (Basilic Sacré) -Le Tulsi est un produit encore très peu répandu sur le marché, et le Tulsi Organic India est certifié d'origine biologique et d'une qualité incomparable.Description du TulsiDepuis plus de 5000 ans, le Tulsi (aussi connu sous le nom de Basilic Sacré) est considéré en Inde comme la "Reine des Herbes" et y est révérée comme l'une des plantes les plus sacrées de l'Inde, infusée d'un pouvoir de guérison.Les feuilles de Tulsi sont utilisées pour faire un thé délicieux et rafraîchissant aux multiples vertus curatives.Tandis que le Tulsi voyageait le long des premières routes commerciales de l'Orient vers l'Europe, il devint connu des Chrétiens comme basilic "saint" ou "sacré", comme on peut le voir reflété dans son nom latin botanique: Ocimum sanctum.La recherche moderne a classifié le Tulsi en tant que plante adaptogène.  Les plantes adaptogènes ont prouvé leur effet positif sur le système immunitaire tout en amoindrissant les effets négatifs du stress.Ces plantes adaptogènes sont utilisées en médecine ayurvédique et chinoise depuis des milliers d'années afin de promouvoir et de maintenir la santé.  Bien des plantes adaptogènes ont été qualifiées par les herboristes de rajeunissantes, énergisantes et reconstituantes.  Elles aident le corps à s'adapter aux facteurs de stress environnementaux, physiques et émotionnels, assurent un bon fonctionnement du corps et restaurent l'équilibre.Le Tulsi Organic India est certifié bio, cultivé sans pesticides et inclus des feuilles de Tulsi de 3 variétés différentes: Rama, Vana et Krishna.  Chaque variété a une apparence, un goût et une fragrance bien caractéristique, qui lorsqu'on les combine, crée une infusion parfaitement équilibrée aux multiples vertus curatives:
Soulagement et protection face au stress quotidien

Augmente l'immunité

Riche en antioxydants

Accroît l'endurance

Adaptogène puissant
Facilite la digestion
Anti-vieillissement
Équilibre le métabolisme
Équilibre les énergies 
Remonte le moral
Certifié Kosher et HalalNotre gamme d'infusions TULSI bien-être Notre gamme d'infusions TULSINos infusions sont conditionnées en boites de 18 sachets, Ou en boites métalliques contenant 100g de mélange en vrac.  - Nos plantes en vrac pour les praticiens en Ayurvéda -Mais aussi pour vous, si vous avez décidé de reprendre votre santé en main, ces plantes sont pour vous.Toutes les plantes Organic India sont certifiées cultivées sans pesticides, ne contiennent pas d'OGM, et seront disponibles en vrac.Amla, Ashwagandha, Neem, Shatavari, Gotu Kola (Centella asiatica), Triphala, Pippali (Poivre Long), Psyllium, Séné, Gokshura (Tribulus terrestris), Tulsi (les 3 variétés).D'autres plantes sont disponibles sur demande spécifique.  - Autres produits certifiés bio -Voici les autres produits que nous pourrons importer également si les fonds récoltés dépassent la barre des 30.000€.Ghee (beurre clarifié): la meilleure huile cuisson, excellente pour la santé.Avec l'assurance que les vaches sont bien traitées et ne sont pas séparées de leurs petits.Huile de Noix de Coco extra vierge, pressée à froid.Chyawanprash, une délicieuse marmelade contenant près de 40 fruits, épices et herbes ayurvédiques, préparée selon une tradition multimillénaire. Rajeunissant, énergisant, booste le système immunitaire, riche source de Vitamines C.Mais également:Riz Basmati blanc et brun Lentilles (Dal): mung dal = soja vert / massoor dal = lentilles corailSel rose de l'Himalaya: en cristaux très finsGraines de sésame: avec ou sans la coque

Voici pour vous une recette santé, facile à digérer, qui vous apportera tous les acides aminés nécessaires à la construction de protéines saines et qui utilise la plupart des épices que nous avons décrites: le Kitchari élaboré.Voici le lien pour télécharger la recette si elle vous met l'eau à la bouche.

story:
Hello Indiegogo! I'm Jason Weiland, the Chief Big Head at BigHeadBoy Media. Our Elegant Minds is our first effort to bring innovation to the mental health industry.

Worldwide about 1 percent of the population is diagnosed with schizophrenia or related disorders, and approximately 1.2% of Americans (3.2 million) have the disorders. About 1.5 million people will be diagnosed with schizophrenia and schizoaffective disorder this year around the world

I recognized some opportunities to help people affected by severe mental illnesses back when I was first diagnosed with Schizoaffective Disorder over 15 years ago; where I have psychotic symptoms, alternating with severe mood symptoms. I have dealt with mental illness my whole life, but this diagnoses was completely new to me and I tried to find out as much as I could about what I could expect. I was sadly left without much information, support or guidance from the internet or the medical professionals “helping” me.

Currently, more information is available, but there are still very few places a disordered person can go for help, support and compassion where they don't feel labeled and put into a box. I know that above all we want to find a place where we feel like we matter and where we can talk and vent without fear of prejudice or stigma. We need a place to go to find out information and guidance from all points of view, from people experienced in dealing with schizophrenia and schizoaffective disorder.

Our Elegant Minds promises to fulfill these needs and more. I started this project after a very bad period in my life because I didn't want others to have to experience what I was feeling. But it has grown in scope and scale from those first days, and I know, with your help, that my team and I can bring you a wonderful, thriving community. Seeing this project to fruition has become my purpose in life and I would love nothing more than to see it helping as many people as possible for a long time to come.

By backing Our Elegant Minds, you are enabling us to bring information, resources, support and community to a group of people who really need our help. Our team will deliver articles, special reports, helpful videos, weekly features like “Ask the Doctor” and a safe and secure forum where people can interact with their peers without fear of being stigmatized or their comments being broadcast to the world like often happens in groups on other social media sites.

We want to enable our members to be successful, no matter what level they are functioning. We will be there for the person who may be making their first steps and just need help getting out of bed, to those who may be struggling to keep a career in the face of mounting symptoms and problems coping with stressors. 

We also will help those who care for someone suffering from these disorders, because we know how hard it is for those who love someone with a severe mental illness. Being a caregiver to a child or spouse can sometimes feel like a thankless job, but it is so important. Connect with other who share the same path with you.

With your help, we can offer all of this and more!

What We Need

To keep Our Elegant Minds running for 3 months, at which point we will be self-sufficient, we are pushing for $30,000. Compared to the value of what we will be bringing to our members, this probably doesn't seem like much money, but from experience we have learned to run our business lean, but still provide a superior product.

Some items that the money will fund are:

  • Marketing and Promotion

  • Hosting and Software

  • Salaries for our writers, designers and videographers

  • Video equipment and software

  • Stock photography and professional graphic design

  • Website development and maintenance

  • Taxes

  • Rewards and Perks

Whats in it For You

Beside the warm feeling you get from helping a worthy cause, we have arranged a few interesting perks you will get for your pledge. From bumper stickers to t-shirts, we have a load of fun items. Our favorite is the chance to get a 6 month, 1 year or lifetime membership to Our Elegant Minds for you or you could donate it to someone in need.

For those who want a chance to help us with the ideas and suggestions to help us build our community, become an Elegant Sustainer with a $1000 pledge and become a mentor for the Our Elegant Minds community.

If you like to write, you can become an Elegant Author with a $75 pledge and write an article that will be published on the finished community website.

Also added, is either access to our "Virtual Launch Party" or at the higher levels, the chance to be present at the event in Tucson, Arizona.

If you make a commitment of $2500 or over, you will be added to our "Virtual Board of Directors" and help us to shape and develop the Our Elegant Minds community and it's future. Be a part of something awesome!

We also will have a number of stretch goals in which we will add new and unique rewards, so keep up with the updates on this campaign page!

The Impact of Our Elegant Minds

This website will not only provide a long-awaited sense of community and purpose for our members, but it will provide much-needed resources and help for a beleaguered medical community trying to help a huge group of people with minimal money and resources. In order for we as a society to help those who most need it, we need to change the way we have been doing things and try some alternate forms of guidance and direction for the disordered and lost.

The more that private companies like BigHeadBoy Media step forward and provide help, the less that our society will have to rely on our bloated tax system to cover the costs of care.

Our goal is to reach 1000 members by the end of 2015. That is 1000 people more than are being helped today. After that realistic and attainable goal for year 1, we hope to double membership every year until we get over 100,000 members enrolled by year 8. To reach that goal of 100,000, which is approximately 3% of the schizophrenia and schizoaffective disordered population in the U.S.A., we intend to utilize a marketing campaign to showcase the site’s resources and how it can be helpful to those with these illnesses and the people who care for them. So 1000 members in the 1st year, and 100,000 in the 8th year...it adds up; it is realistic; and it is a conservative estimate.

Reaching Out to the Community

As a way to provide more help to the mental health community, and specifically those affected by schizophrenia or schizoaffective disorder, we are pledging to donate $1 from each paid monthly membership. The proceeds will go to The Johns Hopkins Schizophrenia Center for their excellent work in patient care, research, education and outreach.

We will also always be on the lookout for new opportunities to help the community and give where it is needed.

The Team at Our Elegant Minds

Besides Jason Weiland, joining our team as Medical Director is Dr. Carlo Carandang, MD, FAPA. Dr. Carandang is a psychiatrist and has over 15 years experience dealing with mental illnesses in multiple settings. Please go to the BigHeadBoy Media website for a full bio of Dr. Carandang.

We will also be teaming up with other mental health professionals as well as authors, gurus and bloggers to bring you a community of information, help and guidelines a person with schizophrenia or schizoaffective disorder can use with their doctor and therapist to help them work through the pain, uncertainty and confusion they may be feeling from dealing with these demanding illnesses.

Risks and Challenges

We are very realistic and know we will face obstacles along the way, but we have plans and contingencies for the unexpected. We know there is a slim chance of not reaching our complete funding goal of $30,000, but we have plans in place to combat this alternate reality:

  • We have different forms of marketing, that although may take longer and may not be ideal, that we can use to reach our intended audience.

  • We have several back-end models for the structure of our community that we can use until the funding becomes available for the right software and solutions.

We are no strangers to running our business lean, and even when we do reach our funding goal, will continue to operate in a way where our money is used in the best and most efficient manner possible.

Your Next Steps

We can't make the dream of Our Elegant Minds come true without everyone getting on board. Every dollar counts and we would like to ask that you join the cause. Now is the time for action! 

If you find you still can’t afford to join us at $5 there are other ways you can help. Use the buttons at the top/left of this page to share on Facebook and Twitter. Every little bit helps!

Dr. Carandang is a psychiatrist and has over 15 years experience dealing with mental illnesses in multiple settings. Please go to the BigHeadBoy Media website for a full bio of Dr. Carandang. We will also be teaming up with other mental health professionals as well as authors, gurus and bloggers to bring you a community of information, help and guidelines a person with schizophrenia or schizoaffective disorder can use with their doctor and therapist to help them work through the pain, uncertainty and confusion they may be feeling from dealing with these demanding illnesses.Risks and ChallengesWe are very realistic and know we will face obstacles along the way, but we have plans and contingencies for the unexpected. We know there is a slim chance of not reaching our complete funding goal of $30,000, but we have plans in place to combat this alternate reality:
We have different forms of marketing, that although may take longer and may not be ideal, that we can use to reach our intended audience.
We have several back-end models for the structure of our community that we can use until the funding becomes available for the right software and solutions.
We are no strangers to running our business lean, and even when we do reach our funding goal, will continue to operate in a way where our money is used in the best and most efficient manner possible.Your Next StepsWe can't make the dream of Our Elegant Minds come true without everyone getting on board. Every dollar counts and we would like to ask that you join the cause. Now is the time for action! If you find you still can’t afford to join us at $5 there are other ways you can help. Use the buttons at the top/left of this page to share on Facebook and Twitter. Every little bit helps!

story:
Back Story to Present

I moved into my small home in Colorado, hoping that I would find a place that offered a sense of safety and community. Unfortunately it was very hostile from the beginning. I was harassed in grocery stores, places were refusing my Discover Card when it clearly stated they accepted it on their signs, and I was literally being short changed at some of the stores. After the rape was reported, the gas station that was always nice to me, and said hello when I entered, even stopped doing that.

Since I've lived here the Planned Parenthood was forced to close in February  because no one in the city would rent to them. I was showing signs of pregnancy, and felt helpless because of this; the emergency birth control that I was given was not effective because of my weight.  I think that this is the only time I will say, "Fortunately I wasn't pregnant, it was gonorrhea." Not only are women being forced out of town for "these sexual inconveniences" I did some more investigating. After my felonly rape and assault I became curious as to how many sexual offenders were in my area, and the city of Pueblo, CO Sexual Offenders List doesn't even include photos. 

I didn't get to see my assailant, but I do suspect that it's someone associated with my landlord, because I had changed the locks since I moved here, and his office was the only one with a key.

The Current Situation

When I returned from my brief Easter vacation of two days there was an eviction notice on my door.  I had paid my rent as late as the seventh in the past (only once), otherwise it was always in the five day grace period. The notice was dated April 7th, and I called the landlord immediately. I was baffled that he would take such measures without there being an a ulterior motive.

I feel now that he is the prime suspect or somehow involved in my "home invasion" which was probably done with something as simple as a key, and now the landlord just wants it to all go away. Shortly after my attack I called the Police to see what the landlord was responsible to do for my safety, concerning additional locks, and was never called back by the officer in charge of my case.  I think that you can tell at this point, that this is not a safe place to live.

I need to be able to pay off this lease, which has two months left at 450/month, and be able to find a new place which will be 450-500/month including a security deposit.  There will be some traveling costs involved, because I definitely don't want to stay in this town. I also have to allow for deposits, if any, on utilities.  I receive SSI and coming up with this much cash at one time is impossible for me.

Please donate to my cause, sexual assault, especially one that involves extreme bodily harm, in your own home is the most terrifying thing of all, because it jeopardizes the one place everyone should feel safe.

story:
Short Summary

NAFI Connecticut, Inc. is a non-profit human services agency working with children, families, and adults across the state. Our residential therapeutic program located in Litchfield, CT is looking to fill an empty bookcase with high-interest, inspirational titles for teenage girls. Books purchased using these funds will help our girls acquire healthy alternative coping skills and strategies as they prepare to return to their communities. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $1,000.00 to help us purchase approximately 75-100 new books. We estimate that each book will cost us $10-$20. All funds raised will go towards the purchase of these materials. 

Because NAFI Connecticut, Inc. is a non-profit organization, all donations are considered tax-deductible. Donors will receive recognition throughout agency correspondence such as our quarterly newsletter and annual report. Donors will also receive a hand-crafted thank you note.  

The Impact

How many times have you found yourself lost in a book on a good day? Our girls are struggling with the impact of trauma, substance abuse, and societal pressures. We are optimistic that having quality books available will help normalize their experience in our care and provide a therapeutic outlet as they complete treatment. 

Risks & Challenges

We understand $1,000.00 is a lofty goal, but there are no risks! You can be assured that any and all donations will be used towards the purchase of books and help us to achieve our goal of filling that bookcase.

story:
A Little About Enlighten Bodhi Spa...

Natasha Apiag & myself are partners in life, business and a shared mission to bring a sense of wellbeing to those around us. We began Enlighten Bodhi Spa with a simple mission;

  • Create a Spa focused on healing our guests and educating them on how to maintain balance
  • A space where our guests feel transported from their daily grind
  • To grow and expand our philosophy of Eastern and Western treatments and ideology

We may be small right now, but our dreams are big! One day, Enlighten Bodhi will be a brand that brings therapeutic treatments, educational classes, clothing, Yoga and fitness plans, and skin are and beauty products that are good for the Earth and affordable for everyone.

What We Need & What You Get

We are growing, and fast! So we are moving into a larger location and need some help in getting there. Donate today and choose your treat:

  • A complimentary brow wax with any $10 donation
  • Complimentary Aromatherapy add on to any full price massage service

If we don't reach our goal in two days, no worries! Whatever we make will go towards are vision of a full service spa that you helped make a reality!

The Impact

We both come from single mother families, where are mothers worked themselves sick to create enough money to feed, shelter and cloth us. I'm sure many of you have experienced the struggle of financial instability. Our goal with our business is to create a future for our family  and create more jobs for those who are afraid to trek out on their own. Being self employed can be very scary, we want too be able to support other entrepreneurs and make their dreams reality too.

 Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Kelly Ferguson, I’m a C5 Quadriplegic due to a spinal cord injury which occurred 17 years ago.  After my accident, I returned to college and graduated with a degree in Mechanical Engineering.  Using my engineering background, several years ago I designed and built a geared wheel prototype.

This campaign will give me the resources to produce a new pair of geared wheels for a manual wheel chair.  I will design and manufacture custom parts allowing these new wheels to be much lighter and more functional than the original prototype.

I currently use a manual wheelchair, however, I have difficulty pushing up steep inclines or over uneven terrain.  The geared wheels I’ve designed, which I’ve named "Geared to Go Wheels", will double my pushing strength.

These wheels will not just help me.  They will allow other wheelchair users to push further and go places which were once beyond their limits.  Geared to Go Wheels offer increased independence.  They also reduce stress on the shoulders, one of the most detrimental effects of pushing a wheelchair.

 

Your contributions will be used in the following categories:

  • CAD Software: I will need the latest 3D drafting software in order to design and build each custom part.

 

  • Custom Gear Train: For the original prototype, I used a commercially available speed reducer.  It was heavy and only offered a 3:1 gear ratio.  With custom, aluminum gears, I can reduce weight and get the 2:1 ratio the design requires.

 

  • Materials: Aside from the custom gears, I will also need aluminum stock, pushrims, tires, bearings and all of the fasteners associated with building a wheelchair wheel. 

 

  •  CAD/CAM: I will utilize computer aided manufacturing to produce the various parts.  When building the first prototype, I realized the more intricate parts would require CNC fabrication to reduce costs.

 

  • Testing: I will begin stress and road tests of the wheels with any remaining funds.

Even if the campaign isn’t fully funded, I still hope to be able to purchase the drafting software.  Getting the design “on paper” and having each part represented in a 3D model will streamline production.

The Perks:

To the right you will see the perks I’ve set up for this campaign.  Because of the unique nature of this campaign, I’ve decided to make the perks, unique, as well.  Several perks feature my own original art, as well as, prints from the comic that I draw, “Basketcase.”

 

1st Gear Contributor:  Anyone who makes a donation of any kind will get their name on the “Thank You" section of the Geared to Go website.

 

2nd Gear Contributor:  ($20) Receive a A G2G refrigerator magnet, Your name in the "Thank You" section of the Geared to Go website & a thank you card.

 

3rd Gear Contributor: ($40) This will get you a hand signed copy of one of my cartoons printed on poster-board, plus everything in the 2nd Gear level.  You can choose between these four cartoons:

 

 4th Gear Contributor: ($100)  Contribute this amount and you will get a snazzy Geared to Go mug plus everything in the 3rd Gear level--including all four cartoons.

 

Revolutionary Contributor: ($250) Receive a 14"x14" print on canvas, of my "Che Scan Code" Op-Art piece, plus everything in the 4th Gear Level.

 

Spaghettio Contributor: ($250) Receive a 12"x16" print on canvas of "Uh-Oh, Spaghettios!"  Plus everything in the 4th Gear Level.

 

Abstract Contributor: ($350) Receive a 10"x10" original abstract painting.  Painted by yours truly with acrylic on canvas. Plus everything in the 4th Gear Level.  The painting will be similar this:

 

Abstract Contributor II: ($500) Receive a 12"x12" original abstract painting.  Painted by yours truly with acrylic on canvas. Plus everything in the 4th Gear Level.  The painting will be similar this:

 

Corporate Contributor: ($2500)  Contribute at this level and I will place a sticker featuring your company logo, website address, etc prominently on each G2G prototype wheel.  Your company logo will also be featured on the G2G website, with links to your website, as well.
