story:
We have invented the FIRST pill that ELIMINATES the heat and the burning sensation that comes from eating the capsaicin found in hot peppers, hot sauce, & spicy foods.

Capsaicin  is the active component of chili peppers, which are plants belonging to the genus Capsicum. It is an irritant for mammals, including humans, and produces a sensation of burning in any tissue with which it comes into contact. Capsaicin and several related compounds are called capsaicinoids and are produced as a secondary metabolite by chili peppers, probably as deterrents against certain herbivores and fungi.
(source: wikipedia.com)

These pills work effectively on the capsaicin WITHOUT any aftertaste or altering the way your food tastes. Enjoy hot wings, spicy Thai food or even some of your neighbors Scotch Bonnet peppers fresh from his garden with NO FEAR of the consequences.

You can take on Adam from Man Vs. Food with NO FEAR!
Get YOUR name and photo on the Wall of Flame at your fav wing joint!
Try that new Indian place in town and get the crazy hot curry, you'll be ready.

Please help us patent and then bring these Cooling Tabs to market. We developed and tested the concept with hundreds of different tablets and concentrations of the active ingredient. We showed them to the head of a local pharmacy school and he crowed "...these are bigger than Bean-O...".

We will manufacture & package them here in our hometown of Erie, PA, and hopefully we can grow the company to the point of adding employees!!!! Erie is also home to our award winning hot sauce company.

We need funds to finalize the exact best % of the SECRET active ingredient (one of 3 important ingredients to make this work) for best effectiveness, continue & complete the patent process, purchase the needed tablet making machinery, create the packaging and then mail samples to every retailer and media outlet we can find.

The tablet making machinery and designated "clean room" needed to manufacture will take the most money and it is VERY important to us that we make these tablets by hand and in-house. We want to grow this business to the point where we can hire employees from Erie.

We have been selling delicious, all-natural hot sauce for three years and our test kitchen came up with the perfect antidote to the heat we create with our Scoville Food Institute Hot Sauces. We are growing yearly but simply cannot fund this project out of our cash flow. 

We need your help to bring this innovative and much-needed new product to market. Imagine the intrinsic reward you will get from saying to your friends and family, " Hey, I helped lauch that product and actually had some of the FIRST tablets ever made!"

We will include a free sample of Dr. Scoville's Cooling Tabs on EVERY bottle of our Scoville Food Institute hot sauce sold at a major grocery chain in order to stimulate interest, trial, and demand for our new product.

 

Thanks for looking at our project, we look forward to your support!
Please tell your friends & family and re-post on your favroite social media outlets!!!

Jon Whaley
President
The Scoville Food Institute

 

 

VIDEO COMING SOON.

 

FDA Disclaimer

The statements and products shown on this website have not been evaluated by the US Food and Drug Administration.

These products are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure or prevent any disease.

Those seeking treatment for a specific disease should consult a qualified integrative physician prior to using our products if possible.

story:
JOBS IN OUR TOWN (WE MADE IT!! - PLEASE see "updates")

Our video may come across as light-hearted, but we wouldn’t be here if we weren’t stone serious. We’ve spent eighteen months getting to this point.

Twelve of us [a pastor, homemaker, two students, two retirees, two graphic artists, a writer, a school administrator, a housing director, and even our retired City Manager] from Lompoc, CA decided last year that 15% unemployment in our town was simply unacceptable.

We saw empty stores and homes, increased gang violence and our library was closing more and more hours. Our children’s future, which once seemed secure, was slipping away.

We couldn’t sit still any longer complaining about politicians and Wall Street while we waited for rich out-of-town entrepreneurs to plop down factories here. Sitting and waiting and complaining was getting us nowhere. But what to do?

 

SO WE STUDIED

We learned that 2012 is the United Nations Year of the Cooperative for their successes in the Third World. We learned about Mondragon in Spain, and Evergreen Cooperatives in Cleveland. We learned about Arizmendi Bakeries and WAGES, both right here in California. We learned that we ourselves can plant worker-owner cooperatives with sustainable jobs that won’t leave town the next time the stock market burps. And they won't depend on government subsidies either.

 

WE FOUND EXPERTS 

So, we got the California Center for Cooperatives in Davis, CA to come here and help us. Now we foresee a string of co-ops, one after another, all financed from the same revolving loan fund called an “incubator.” Our first business will be a green cleaning company. We hope to hire in September. Another start-up will come in 2013.  We’ve set the spark of a tiny flicker of hope. Maybe that’s why our video seems so boisterous.

To be honest, we still need your help. While we were crunching the numbers on a feasibility study and a business plan we staged three fundraising events and we’ve received three small foundation grants, but we still need to raise $7,500 (or more if we can get it) just to cover the bare bones of training and materials for the start-up.

 

THAT'S WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

This is the most unorthodox, the most audacious campaign to underwrite a Lompoc business since farmers started the co-op bean warehouse in the 1800's.

In exchange for your contributions we're offering perks. A local artist has welded a sculpture of Rosie the Riveter’s biceps. Remember her from World War II?  Her slogan was “We can do it.” She is on the right at the bottom of the list of perks. Her slogan is our slogan.

To be clear, your assistance is not an investment; no amount of outside money can buy a piece of the co-ops we develop. They are staying here!

But your gift will help hire people in Lompoc who want to work, and it will create real hope for the co-ops to follow.  And maybe this co-op cluster concept can be used in your town.

Besides money, we hope you will help in other ways too—post to your friends, tweet, follow us on facebook (http://www.facebook.com/#!/pages/Lompoc-Co-op-D...) [and like us please… please] and on our website www.lcdp.coop.  Let us know your creative thoughts. Shoot your ideas for business (and fundraising) to us at Rosie@lcdp.coop. And use the IndieGoGo share tools.

So thanks for reading. Keep in touch. And thank you for your support.  

Lompoc Co-ops IndieGoGo team

Rebekah Arnold, Rev. Chuck Arnold, Jeff Bessmer, Judy Clifford, Tamara Cribley, Tom Flores, Maria Garcia-Cacique, Raquel Gonzalez, Gary Keefe, Nancy Luevanos, Jake McCollum, John McReynolds, Bill Mullins, Caj Segura, Devlin Seymour. Steve Stormoen, Marcus Wilkins

Twelve of us [a pastor, homemaker, two students, two retirees, two graphic artists, a writer, a school administrator, a housing director, and even our retired City Manager] from Lompoc, CA decided last year that 15% unemployment in our town was simply unacceptable.
We saw empty stores and homes, increased gang violence and our library was closing more and more hours. Our children’s future, which once seemed secure, was slipping away. 
We couldn’t sit still any longer complaining about politicians and Wall Street while we waited for rich out-of-town entrepreneurs to plop down factories here. Sitting and waiting and complaining was getting us nowhere. But what to do?
 
SO WE STUDIED
We learned that 2012 is the United Nations Year of the Cooperative for their successes in the Third World. We learned about Mondragon in Spain, and Evergreen Cooperatives in Cleveland. We learned about Arizmendi Bakeries and WAGES, both right here in California. We learned that we ourselves can plant worker-owner cooperatives with sustainable jobs that won’t leave town the next time the stock market burps. And they won't depend on government subsidies either.
 
WE FOUND EXPERTS 
So, we got the California Center for Cooperatives in Davis, CA to come here and help us. Now we foresee a string of co-ops, one after another, all financed from the same revolving loan fund called an “incubator.” Our first business will be a green cleaning company. We hope to hire in September. Another start-up will come in 2013.  We’ve set the spark of a tiny flicker of hope. Maybe that’s why our video seems so boisterous. 
To be honest, we still need your help. While we were crunching the numbers on a feasibility study and a business plan we staged three fundraising events and we’ve received three small foundation grants, but we still need to raise $7,500 (or more if we can get it) just to cover the bare bones of training and materials for the start-up.
 
THAT'S WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP
This is the most unorthodox, the most audacious campaign to underwrite a Lompoc business since farmers started the co-op bean warehouse in the 1800's. 
In exchange for your contributions we're offering perks. A local artist has welded a sculpture of Rosie the Riveter’s biceps. Remember her from World War II?  Her slogan was “We can do it.” She is on the right at the bottom of the list of perks. Her slogan is our slogan.
To be clear, your assistance is not an investment; no amount of outside money can buy a piece of the co-ops we develop. They are staying here!
But your gift will help hire people in Lompoc who want to work, and it will create real hope for the co-ops to follow.  And maybe this co-op cluster concept can be used in your town. 
Besides money, we hope you will help in other ways too—post to your friends, tweet, follow us on facebook (http://www.facebook.com/#!/pages/Lompoc-Co-op-D...) [and like us please… please] and on our website www.lcdp.coop.  Let us know your creative thoughts. Shoot your ideas for business (and fundraising) to us at Rosie@lcdp.coop. And use the IndieGoGo share tools.
So thanks for reading. Keep in touch. And thank you for your support.  
Lompoc Co-ops IndieGoGo team
Rebekah Arnold, Rev. Chuck Arnold, Jeff Bessmer, Judy Clifford, Tamara Cribley, Tom Flores, Maria Garcia-Cacique, Raquel Gonzalez, Gary Keefe, Nancy Luevanos, Jake McCollum, John McReynolds, Bill Mullins, Caj Segura, Devlin Seymour. Steve Stormoen, Marcus Wilkins

story:
Case

Case is an 18 month old little boy who has neuroblastoma.  He was diagnosed shortly before his first birthday and it has been very aggressive,

Case has undergone many rounds of chemotherapy, an aggressive surgery and several infections.  He needs several more rounds of chemotherapy and at least one more surgery.

Currently, Case has been in the hospital for going on 4 weeks straight,

What his family needs

Case's family needs help with the medical bills.  Case also has an older brother who is only 4 so his father could use some time off in order to spend time with both children.

They need support and non-hospital food.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Help me spread the word!
  • Can you cook?  We could take them some home cooked food!
  • Are you a housekeeper?  They could probably use some help there!
  • Do you have toddler/baby clothes and toys that you could donate?

story:
My name is Travis Urban and I have been in the auto industry for 11 years.  I started out doing on-site repairs with borrowed tools from my father.  From that meager beginning, I have expanded the business to include selling pre-owned parts. I now need more warehouse space.

"There is still controversy about overpriced auto repair and who you can trust. Supplying those people and companies with our quality parts is our contribution to rebuilding and upholding faith in the auto industry by keeping parts costs affordable for consumers."  -Travis Urban

Our unique idea makes buying recycled parts quick and easy and is also a great choice for the environment. APS Milwaukee recycles over 97% of what comes through the door including all vehicle fluids, metals and plastics. 

Our loyal customer base is ever-growing from the reliable service and parts sales we've provided since day one.  We now need a larger building and would like to fill the expanded shelving area with more inventory.  Help us build inventory to offer a wider variety of parts at affordable prices to people that need them most.  In order to achieve our goal we seek the amount of $50,000.  Our unique parts store idea is based on having good quality recycled parts on the shelf ready to be sold immediately for shorter downtime of your vehicle.  Supplying you, your repair facility or insurance company with these ready to install parts is a key factor in a timely quality repair of your vehicle.  We eliminate you having to retrieve your own part or having to wait for your part to pulled from a car at a typical junkyard.  These parts will help parents get their kids to school, people to work, get groceries in the fridge, take your favorite vacation or get you simply from A to B in your daily events.  We also have the capability to install the parts we supply.

Your contribution will go to directly supplying the community with quality used parts from the vehicles purchased.  The capital received will move us into our new location and purchase many salvage vehicles to stock our shelves for people in need of those parts.  The recycled damaged vehicles purchased as parts cars and trucks will be tested, dismantled, and then cleaned, cataloged and shelved.  Every vehicle supplied for parts will stock approximately 100 good usable recycled parts for resale.  The money will go towards the first years rent in the new building.  It will also allow us to purchase nearly 20 salvage parts cars.  That will put about two thousand more parts on the shelves to reach a wider variety of customers.  A few new pieces of equipment will be purchased or upgraded with the remainder.

If you are a contributor you will receive your APS swag as well as the redemption for your APS credit good for parts or labor.  Everyone will need some sort of auto repair in the year 2014.  Help us take a huge step in business growth by basically prepaying the payment for your automotive needs this upcoming year.  A new AAA report says that the biggest automotive related percentage increase this year was in maintenance costs, which grew by 11.26% to 4.97 cents per mile, on average, for sedan owners. The average miles per year is 12,000 to 15,000.  Yes that means you will potentially spend between $596.40 to $745.50 in 2014 alone. 

You can help us supply people in need of these parts and revive the faith in the auto industry directly

WE APPRECIATE YOU!!!

Option for payment by PAYPAL


*You will receive a discount card with your name and registered vehicle for the discount.  Please include mailing address for shipping of merchandise.
*Oil changes are for five quarts of conventional oil and filter.
*Other amounts can be negotiated and much appreciated!

story:
Just a taste of the hand crafted awesomeness


I've been making jewelry since I was a kid. And the last three decades have led to my own style of jewelry-making that I am proud to be sharing with you and the world. Without a doubt, my most popular item is the sterling silver wire-wrapped ring. A great gift, a bit of fun or a touch of class for every day, and all totally custom-designed to your own personal taste.

But for the more discerning customer, a sterling silver necklace is what I recommend. Pick something to accentuate the lovely hues of your bright and beautiful eyes.

Why stop there? That outfit that makes you look like a million bucks will up the ante with a sterling silver bracelet to match.

But don't keep all the jewelry fun to yourself! A jewelry party is the best way to spend an afternoon with friends. I'll travel to your home - or other place of your choosing - and craft a sterling silver ring custom-made to the wishes and desires of each and every one of six of your friends. Plus, a fun and educational workshop on the craft of wire-wrapping. Travel within 100 miles of Charlottesville is included - if you are farther afield, please email redscustomjewelry@gmail.com so that we can discuss logistics.

Eagle Scout that I am, all my work comes with a guarantee. If the work doesn't quite match your expectations, I will make it right. Adjustments or replacements are gladly offered. And, I will repair any of my work for no fee. If you purchased jewelry from someone with lower standards, I am also happy to offer jewelry repair at a very reasonable price.

If you have an idea for a custom creation and you don't see it here, don't worry. Just email redscustomjewelry@gmail.com, and I will see what I can do to turn your creative genius into a glittering reality.

RED's Custom Jewelry official launch 2015

So, 2015 is the launch year for my up and coming jewelry business. The planning period is over and I have drafted an exhaustive business plan to include a summer full of events and festivals, setting up sales displays in a growing number of retail locations and tapping into internet market places with my own website - www.redscustomjewelry.com - to help organize custom orders and act as a platform to promote business. With personal appearances at live festivals and events as well as retail exposure, I hope to streamline custom production with a circular approach beginning and ending with internet orders.

I hope that you can come out to see me at one of the events where I will be showcasing my work this summer. The full event schedule will ultimately be available at REDsCustomJewelry.com, but here is a sample of some of the places I will be in the next month or so!


What the money I am raising goes towards

I have an enviable inventory and decades of experience, so money raised is not going to purchase materials or cover the cost of learning the trade. This June, I will also be graduating from the CIC craftsman crash-course MBA, so I am also not raising the funds to learn to run a business.

The significant start-up costs that I am seeking benefactors for are:

  • Professional photographs. I am thankful to friends (and my phone) for the pictures you see on my campaign. But eventually, professional photographs of my jewelry will be a must. 
  • Event vendor fees. Setting up at a show can cost anywhere from $100 to $1000 apiece, including registration, set-up, liability insurance, and travel.
  • Safe, interactive website. I have already begun the process of designing my website with a professional. But showing off my work and creating a safe transaction environment is a large undertaking.

I am thankful to each and every person who orders jewelry on this campaign. I feel a special debt of gratitude to those who pledge $250 or above to not only receive one-of-a-kind pieces of jewelry, but to help me get my business on the road in 2015.

Risks & challenges (aka stuff that won't stop me)

As much as I would love to control the decisions of which shows I am accepted to, this can be a difficult market to break into. And, although this is my business, it requires the work of a team - photographer, web designer, materials vendors, and others. 

That said, you know I am tenacious... ok, stubborn. I will submit to as many events as I can, work as closely with my team members as I can, and continue to hone my craft so that I am the best. I am sure there will be bumps along the way, but you can be sure I will go over, around, or just straight through them. 

    Other ways you may support RED's Custom Jewelry

    I know not everyone is in the position to buy a piece of jewelry today. But there are still many ways you can help my business to succeed:

    • Please like RED's Custom Jewelry on Facebook
    • Share my campaign link on your social media: http://igg.me/at/rcj
    • Tell all your friends who love jewelry to stop by my campaign before the end of May!
    • Visit my website and help me with beta-testing - I'm still working out the bugs
    • Provide an introduction to jewelry, artisan, and other stores you frequent where my jewelry would be the perfect addition to their range of merchandise.
    • And I always welcome some moral support from a friend!

story:
We cannot contain our excitement to finally show all this to you. Our team has pushed through the adversity of a slim budget over the past 10 months to create this product. 

On January 4th, we received confirmation that the Apple Store has approved Roundabout and we have chosen April 13th as our launch date, which follows our participation in One Spark, the World's Largest Crowdfunding Festival in Jacksonville, FL April 7-12. If you are in the area, come enjoy an incredible event and hang out at our booth!

As a backer of this project, you will forever be connected to us like no one else. Make sure you grab one of these hot tees or get your face on a custom designed graphic tee!

                                       "the Roundabout way is like city-folk off roading"

story:
10% from any pre-order will go to the Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research

Brought to you by www.iMcFly.com

WE BELIEVE THRUST VECTOR CONTROL IS THE ONLY WAY TO MAKE THIS HAPPEN!

             

iMCFLY, the World's 1st Real Flying Thrust Vector Control Hoverboard!

We have a great idea we would love to make a reality, which is the world's first real functional hoverboard. 

People have been attempting this on and off ever since the early 90's, but we feel that all have failed, because they have been using unproven or unrealistic technologies. We intend to develop and employ proprietary engines with thrust vectoring technologies, similar to what is used in the F-35 VTOL, but miniaturized. With proper R&D, safe, stable and controlled flight will be achieved. 


Powered By Solar:

Advancing Renewable Energy 

Advancing Energy Efficiency 

Reducing Energy Waste

Controlled By Wind:

Thrust Vectoring Control 

Manipulate Air Direction 

Innovative Second-generation Technologies

Controlled By Bluetooth:

Friendly design

Waypoints function

Auto landing function supported

Uses the Bluetooth 4.0 low-power consumption technology

TURN IT ON. HIT THE ROAD!

The iMcFly App is the control center for your iMcFlyBoard. Activate your board via Bluetooth before each use and track route information such as path, distance, speed, and travel time. You can also rate and share locations with the iMcFly community or via social media to Twitter and Facebook.

story:
Hi all,

Some of you have been through this process with me before last year, and some are new.  For those that are un aware, this is my second annual Secret Santa Adopt a Child fundraiser, in an attempt to make Christmas day a happier occasion for those that have potentially fallen on hard times or are for any reason less fortunate this holiday season.  Last year we over exceeded our goal and were able to provide presents and gifts to multiple families.  The pictures of the children were so priceless and heartwarming.  I can only hope that this year brings as much success and happiness if not more to many more children.  You can donate anything, a penny, a quarter or a dollar, anything helps and is greatly appreciated.  The donations will end on December 15th and ALL proceeds will be used to buy items off the wish lists of families who have been submitted to the church for assistance.  As I did last year, I will keep you all up to date on purchases and post pictures that I receive of the families receiving their presents.   Thank you all in advance for your generosity and I can't wait to ride this journey out with you again this upcoming season.  And like I always say, smiling is contagious so spread the smiles and spread the love!

story:
Help Jeannie Help Mitch 

Aloha Friends, Fellow Frisbee Players, and Good Samaritans!

This summer, our Keokea frisbee teammates Mitch and his girlfriend Jeannie received some difficult and unexpected news.  Mitch, who is only 32, was diagnosed with metastasized testicular cancer; cancer that has quickly spread now to his lower back.  Mitch, originally from Saskatchewan, Canada has moved back for treatment because his healthcare is covered there, which is awesome. The not-so-awesome part is he therefore can't work right now and Jeannie can't work in Canada. Jeannie, Mitch's main emotional support, must stay behind on Maui to continue working her two jobs so she can provide as much financial help as possible. 

Fortunately, Jeannie has approval from work to leave for a week each month to fly to Saskatchewan to be with Mitch.  But with the expenses of travel on top of missing a week of work each month, it is nearly impossible for her to make the 15-hour trek there and back without basically depleting all of her resources. She just returned from a one-week trip to be with Mitch while he had his first round of treatment and from the sounds of it, it was physically, emotionally and financially draining.

The cancer treatment Mitch is undergoing is chemotherapy. It will last 9 weeks in total.  That's 3 different drugs, 5 hours a day, 5 days a week, for 9 weeks.  It involves a lot of nausea and discomfort and he has cut off all his long, black, beautiful hair in preparation for the hair loss that also comes with chemo.  It's been clear from the week Jeannie just spent with Mitch, that being together as much as possible is really necessary.  

Jeannie is used to being highly self-sufficient and has yet to ask for help. She probably won't ever ask! So, we were thinking, if we can raise some money it will go a long way to help alleviate some of the financial strain. This in turn, will enable her to give Mitch some much-needed emotional support during this intense and challenging time. 

Where the money goes
All the money will be sent directly to Jeannie's PayPal account, so she can buy flights before the prices go up for the holidays. 

Special Chemo cat therapy... especially comforting while playing rummy.

Sad day.

Jeannie is used to being highly self-sufficient and has yet to ask for help. She probably won't ever ask! So, we were thinking, if we can raise some money it will go a long way to help alleviate some of the financial strain. This in turn, will enable her to give Mitch some much-needed emotional support during this intense and challenging time. 

Where the money goes

All the money will be sent directly to Jeannie's PayPal account, so she can buy flights before the prices go up for the holidays. 

Special Chemo cat therapy... especially comforting while playing rummy.


Sad day.

story:
C’est Brigitte Dionne, présidente de Diobri, une compagnie spécialisée en marketing commercial, marketing social et marketing Internet depuis 2000, qui a inventé quelques années plus tard, le concept de DollaractifMD. Offrant ses services professionnels auprès de différents commerçants ou organismes dans le domaine de l’activité physique et sportive, madame Dionne a imaginé un incitatif financier comme moyen de stimuler la population à adopter un mode de vie physiquement actif et une saine alimentation.

S’inspirant du modèle d’affaires des programmes de fidélisation de type coalition de marchands et des plateformes de cybercommerce communément appelées Marketplace, elle a développé au fil des ans, avec son équipe de Diobri, le concept original de DollaractifMD. And the rest, as they say, will become History!

Why Are We Called Dollaractif?

Well, because that's our philosophy. Life is expensive, you need dollars to do just about anything, including living a healthy lifestyle. We believe that your hard earned dollars should do more than get you the basic necessities and some treats from time to time - they should help you thrive as an active and healthy person every single day. 

Oh, and if you're wondering why Dollaractif is spelled with an "f", it's because we're based out of Montreal, Quebec (Canada), which means we're French. But don't worry, the site is going to launch fully bilingual!

We are a passionate team of communications experts, graphic designers, programmers, kinesiologists, nutritionists, and project managers that want to help small and medium sized businesses grow beyond their daily limits and in doing so, get our community moving and eating healthy again by saving money on anything that leads to better lifestyle choices. 

How Are We Doing This?

We're building a full scale e-commerce site that's focused on promoting health, and not just shopping. In a nutshell, our site is divided into three sections: General Consumption, Physical Activity, and Healthy Eating. Anytime you buy something you need from the stores on the platform, you get 2-4% back in dollaractif rewards to use in the Physical Activity and Healthy Eating sections. In these two sections you will find products like sportswear, fitness equipment, gardening tools, fruit and vegetable baskets and cookbooks. We'll even have services such as consults with Registered Dietitians, personal trainers, sports lessons for children, and much more. There are no complicated point systems or levels to reach, 1 dollaractif = 1 Canadian dollar. It's that simple.

Our vision is to break the financial barrier often associated with nutritious eating, fitness, gym memberships or athletic wear. Families and individuals should not have to choose between the things they need and the things that are good for them. 

This picture is a mock-up of what our current homepage looks like as the real thing is under Beta at the moment making sure it's perfect for launch. 


What We Need & What You Get

We've been working really hard over the past 2 years and we are so close to launching and seeing our dream become a reality. In order for that to happen successfully, we need money. Building a site of this magnitude and approach has been very expensive and we've done everything we can to save our pennies to get where we are today. In order to truly reach our community locally, nationally and internationally, we need a marketing budget. 

With the $45 000  we want to launch a promotional campaign that is original, engaging and motivating. We need to show everyone exactly who we are, what we're doing, and how we can positively impact the health of societies and the success of local businesses no matter where you're shopping from. We even have Canadian Olympic Athletes that are waiting for us to give them the "GO!" to start promoting our cause. 

The funds we raise here will help us create and implement a web and print awareness campaign, hold local activities to promote exercise and nutrition, help us connect with merchants that will benefit from selling on our site and hire some awesome promotional staff that'll be our ambassadors out in the community. We'll start in Montreal, but our vision is huge; healthy living has no borders.

Check out the Perks section to see what we can offer you for your generosity and support! 

The Details 

You might have some questions about how we're going to make money once we launch. Here are the details:

1. Merchants can open an online store with us at absolutely no cost. No monthly fees or subscriptions needed. They can also sell whatever products and services they want at prices they want; we are not a deals site, we want businesses to have freedom in their endeavor with us. 

2. If and when they make a sale, we will take only an 8% commission (+ a small transaction fee since we take care of all the payment processes) on the sale, up to half of which we will return to the customer as dollaractif rewards. At the end of the day we only take 4% to keep the business going. We want our services to be affordable for our businesses, and profitable for our consumers. 

What Else Do We Offer?

Our dollaractif rewards can be shared among friends, donated to charities and non-profit organizations, and even given to employees as a gift from employers. We will have a health blog with tips on healthy living, recipes, exercise information, and a schedule of local events that promote physical activity and nutrition. We'll even have a forum where our customers can share stories and tips with each other on how to reach their healthy living goals. 

    What Challenges Are Ahead For Us?

    The challenges of launching an e-commerce site are plenty. After we've done the beta launch, tested till perfect and are ready to open the doors, we have to face the challenges presented by the merchants and customers we need. 

    When it comes to e-commerce, business want the bottom line. It's our job to show them that at Dollaractif, our core foundations are transparency, honesty and integrity. There are no hidden fees or restrictions nor will we stealthily impose rules to increase our profits. For our shoppers too, the only restriction we place is on how they can only spend their rewards towards healthy living items. We do this because it is the core of our business strategy: to create an economic environment that favors sustainable access to healthy living. 

    We're confident that once merchants and consumers are given the chance to interact with our platform (thanks to your donations), they will see that we put our money where our mouth is. 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you can't make a financial donation, that's OK! Our success depends on wonderful people like you to spread the word and let the world know that there can be more to online shopping than what is currently available. Tell your friends, your family, or anyone that will listen; be our partner in health promotion!

story:
Brygg - et magasin om kaffekultur

Brygg er et magasin om kaffekultur. Første utgave ble lansert i oktober og kan leses på 120 av landets kaffebarer.

BRYGG #2 er lansert:


Brygg drives av tre ildsjeler som alle er lidenskapelig opptatt av kaffe og magasiner.

Lene Haugerud – Redaktør
Har tidligere jobbet som både redaktør og skribent i en rekke reise-, kultur, mat og litteraturtidsskrifter.

Amalie Winther – Fotoredaktør
Amalie har bakgrunn fra både redaksjonell-, kommersiell og kunstfotografering, samt erfaring innen reklamefilm- og musikkvideoproduksjon. Amalie har også lengre bakgrunn fra kaffebransjen.

Mikal Strøm – Art director
Mikal står bak flere kunstpublikasjoner, matmagasiner og filmproduksjoner, og har jobbet flere år i Kaffebrenneriet både som barista og som daglig leder.

En av våre favorittsysler er å sette oss på en av Oslos mange kaffebarer - å ta en pause med godt lesestoff og en god kopp kaffe. Kaffe er noe de aller fleste har et nært forhold til, og det er en voksende interesse for kaffefaget verden rundt. Men de færreste har dyptgående kunnskap om kaffe og kaffekultur. Vi ønsker å gjøre godt kafferelatert lesestoff mer tilgjengelig, og derfor har vi laget Brygg.


Førsteutgaven har blitt utrolig godt mottatt. Kaffepausen er en sanselig opplevelse, og derfor er printmagasinet kaffens naturlige kompanjong. Vi elsker print! Den sanselige opplevelsen av et godt magasin kan ikke sammenlignes med noe. Derfor har vi nylig inngått et samarbeid med 07 Gruppen i Oslo - et trykkeri som alltid leverer ypperste kvalitet innen trykk. 

Vi gleder oss til å vise deg den kommende utgaven av Brygg hvor vi besøker Barista Parlor i Nashville, historiske Café Yones i Beirut, og hvor vi tilbake i Norge går en søndagstur på Bakklandet og tar et glass naturvin på Supreme Roastworks på Grünerløkka.

Førsteutgaven av Brygg kan du allerede lese på mange av landets spesialkaffeforetninger i tillegg til de fleste store kaffebarene. Vi jobber stadig med å utvide vårt distribusjonsfelt og vårt mål er at Brygg skal være gratis for hele Norges befolkning. Det er her du kommer inn i bildet. For å kunne trykke opp nok eksemplarer trenger vi din hjelp. Dette vil sikre deg et rykende ferskt eksemplar av kommende utgave og vi har også en rekke PERKS som vi håper faller i smak.

Takk for oppmerksomheten, vi gleder oss og håper du gjør det samme!

Hvor går pengene?

  • Trykkeri 55.000,-
  • Distribusjon 5000,-

Vil du bidra på andre måter?

  • Del gjerne denne kampanjen med dine venner.
  • Har du bil er vi evig takknemlige om du vil hjelpe oss å distribuere magasinet  sammen med oss. 
  • Følg oss på sosiale medier:
    • www.instagram.com/brygg_magasin
    • www.facebook.com/bryggmagasin
    • www.twitter.com/brygg_magasin
    • www.bryggmagasin.no

_____________________________________________________________________________

Brygg is a magazine about coffee culture. The first issue was released in October and can be read at 120 coffee shops all over the country. In addition, we ship the magazine to coffee loving readers around the globe in exchange for a postage fee.

Brygg magazine consists of three coffee enthusiasts:

Lene Haugerud – Editor
Lene has past experience as editor and writer of of travel, culture, food and litterature publications.

Amalie Winther – Photo editor
Amalie has background as a barista in Oslo and has been working as a photographer for the last years. She has experience with documentary photography and commercial photography as well as art photography.

Mikal Strøm – Art director
Mikal has made a series of art publications, zines and film productions. He also has a background as a barista and a manager of a coffee shop.

One of our favourite activities is to take a time out at one of Oslo's many coffeeshops, accompanied by interesting reading material and a nice cup of coffee. Coffee is something that everyone has an opinion on. There is a rising interest about the coffee scene, but not yet something that many people has extensive knowledge about. We want to make good coffee related reading material more available to the public, and this is why we made Brygg magazine.


The first issue of Brygg has been very well received. It is our perception that the coffee break is a sensuous experience, and that's why a print magazine is its natural companion. We love print! The tactile experience of a magazine is beyond comparison. Thats why we just partnered up with the 07 Group - a print house in Oslo, known for its meticulous print qualities.

We are really looking forward to sharing with you the upcoming issue of Brygg, with stories from Barista Parlor in Nashville, historic Café Yones in Beirut, a sunday stroll in Trondheim and a visit to Supreme Roastworks in Oslo.

The first edition of Brygg is already availible at several local and other well known coffee shops. We are always working to expand our distribution, and our goal is for Brygg to be free of cost for all our readers. But a free magazine still costs money, and we need your help to cover the printing and some of the distribution costs. Hope you like our PERKS, and thank you for your concideration.

Where does the money go?
  • Printing $8000
  • Distribution $1000
Want to help in any other way?
  • Share this campaign with your friends.
  • Do you have a car? We would be eternaly greatfull if you will help us with the distribution of our magazine.
  • Follow us:
    • www.instagram.com/brygg_magasin
    • www.facebook.com/bryggmagasin
    • www.twitter.com/brygg_magasin
    • www.bryggmagasin.no

www.bryggmagasin.no
We are also working on making a extensive online video library with brewing guides, instruction videos and inspirational films in collaboration with Barista School.

story:
Our Journey

We, Patience and Chance, were separated at a young age due to the 1994 genocide in Rwanda, We were after 9 long years them reunited and we decided to create Tohoza.com the No1 Online Advertisement Platform in Rwanda!

Launched on November 11th, 2011, Tohoza.com has become very quickly popular - Today it has more than 10,000 unique visits/day with almost 15,000 Facebook Fans.

Amazing progress! Isn't it? However, Tohoza.com Co-founders need to serve each and every Rwandan: both Internet-users and Non-Internet-users.

! What next? !

This is why we need your support to help us funding the expansion of Tohoza.com services to the mobile. 'TOHOZA Info' will enable any mobile phone holder to share and access useful information about Job, Houses/Cars for rent/sale, etc.) using our platform. This will allow Tohoza.com to have a bigger impact and serve all Rwandans without any exception through affordable access to practical information with economic and social development impact.

! What We Need !

To develop, implement and operate TOHOZA Info, we depend on:

Hiring more staff for the development and the implementation of TOHOZA Info, as until now almost everything has been done only by the 2 Co-founders. Additional SW developers are needed.
Transforming into full time employees some of our volunteers currently working as data collectors and marketing agents.
Renting a proper workplace office, as we worked from home so far and it is not possible anymore.
Buying IT equipment to be more efficient.

! Bigger Impact !


Tohoza.com is the general utility platform by excellence.

  1. Tohoza.com is No1 Rwandan Website in terms of Job Announcements:  We contribute to reducing unemployment specially among youth at ZERO Costs!

  2. Beyond posting Job Ads online, we do provide offline free coaching sessions to prepare new and future graduates for the labor market.

  3. April 2014: We have started a program to empower youth by giving them the opportunity to get practical experience by offering them 6 months volunteer positions: currently we have over 200 Tohoza Volunteers working as Content Designers, Marketing Agents and Content Monitors. In addition to the experience provided to them, we train them by giving them practical skills both in entrepreneurship and career wise.

  4. Tohoza.com is also a platform for companies and businesses owners to promote their products and services and at the same time we connect them with potential customers.

  5. We do help individuals who are renting/selling items to connect with renters/buyers.

Photos: TOHOZA in Action at Nyabugogo Taxi Park, Kigali, Rwanda (March 2014)

! Can't Help with Money? !

You can help us by spreading the word within your networks.
We do sincerely thank you in advance for your help!

* Tohoza.com in the Press *

  

Please read the article by CNN: http://cnn.it/1pw8jCR

Please watch the video by CNN: http://cnn.it/1kbhEun

Please listen to the Co-founders story by BBC : http://bbc.in/1rrdVdn

Tohoza.com was 1 of the 10 businesses selected in the FinaBank Entrepreneurship Competition : http://bit.ly/1gWgr6h

Chance Tubane, Tohoza.com Co-founder has been awarded by Rwanda First Lady as a Young Achiever partly thanks to TOHOZA.com. Please read :  http://bit.ly/1rrMn9F

! How can you support us? !

Donnate one of the amounts and get one the following perks!

Beyond posting Job Ads online, we do provide offline free coaching sessions to prepare new and future graduates for the labor market. 
April 2014: We have started a program to empower youth by giving them the opportunity to get practical experience by offering them 6 months volunteer positions: currently we have over 200 Tohoza Volunteers working as Content Designers, Marketing Agents and Content Monitors. In addition to the experience provided to them, we train them by giving them practical skills both in entrepreneurship and career wise.
Tohoza.com is also a platform for companies and businesses owners to promote their products and services and at the same time we connect them with potential customers.
We do help individuals who are renting/selling items to connect with renters/buyers.
Photos: TOHOZA in Action at Nyabugogo Taxi Park, Kigali, Rwanda (March 2014)! Can't Help with Money? !
You can help us by spreading the word within your networks. We do sincerely thank you in advance for your help!* Tohoza.com in the Press *

  



Please read the article by CNN: http://cnn.it/1pw8jCRPlease watch the video by CNN: http://cnn.it/1kbhEunPlease listen to the Co-founders story by BBC : http://bbc.in/1rrdVdnTohoza.com was 1 of the 10 businesses selected in the FinaBank Entrepreneurship Competition : http://bit.ly/1gWgr6hChance Tubane, Tohoza.com Co-founder has been awarded by Rwanda First Lady as a Young Achiever partly thanks to TOHOZA.com. Please read :  http://bit.ly/1rrMn9F! How can you support us? !Donnate one of the amounts and get one the following perks!

story:
My lovely people!

I recently volunteered for an organization called Impacting Hearts. Impacting Hearts is a place where teenage foster kids can go after school to just hang out, eat, share, and know/feel God's love. 

Every thursday night, they serve dinner for about 30-40 kids. They don't have a budget, so pizza and water is what they get most of the time... And I would like to change that (at least for a few dinners). And I need your help! I would be forever grateful if everyone can make a donation of $5 or $10. I would love to serve some korean bbq (which they never had!), healthy snacks, and some fresh squeezed orange juice (which I will be juicing).

Check out, impactinghearts.younglife.org. to learn more.

Thank you!

Ji

story:
Hi, I'm Zan - I live in Nelson, and I'm noticing a theme...

It's coming on Novemeber - some of us in the Kootenays have our firewood cut, stacked and ready to keep us warm.


But that's just some of us.
I see a lot of stress, for a lot of families and mamas, some with young babies, to find the cash or supplies to get the wood they need to keep their families warm for the winter.
And that, especially in this community is totally crazy.

So here's what I want to do. 

$1300 will buy us 4 chords of the best quality wood- thats enough to give a lift to 4 families, and ease the pressure of the winter.

The Impact

All of us here in the Kootenays are so proud of how connected, supported and community oriented we are. And this is a way to take it to the next level - providing the basics for people you don't even know.

As far as accountability - I'd like to keep the families receiving the support anonymous, unless they speak otherwise, and I'm putting my reputation, name and honour behind it. I'd love to hear if you have a family that you know needs the help - so we can reach out far into the corners of this community.

Maybe you have some wood, or maybe you can just share this information on line, but there's so many ways we can keep our Kootenay families warm this winter, and I'm excited to help.

Thanks for all you do,

Zan

story:
in advance is the usual strategy:), tons of research on hotels and places to visit from forums and travel guides, even going on Google maps to see how they look. This should be enough right? Well, not quite...you manage to discover only few of the hidden spots, you get to eat and drink in nice places discovered by mistake rather than the ones printed in advance and miss lots of other stuff.        

Because all the places out there (attractions, restaurants etc...) with thousands of good reviews on internet are usually all frequented by tourists, not locals. A good family-owned restaurant will probably not even have a webpage, but a local will certainly know about it!     

 makes your trip more enjoyable by connecting you with a local that can help you with all your needs: from the most interesting things to visit to the best places to eat/drink/party. They can even help with small issues that you might have; and the awesome part is that you will have support in real time during your stay: your local is at your finger tips ready to give you all the information you might need (via sms, phone call or social media).






The main part of the funds will cover the IT developing cost, to build the website, structure and design in order to have a great feel and interactive look when you use Tripal.

The running costs will include hosting, website maintenance and enhancements.

The marketing costs will be covered partially by the funds raised and will help us reach the target audience.

Share, Share, Share with your support we will make it. Spread the word among your friends and colleagues about our campaign and our website. 



Do you like postcards? Do you love one of the destinations above? Just pick a city from the following and we will send you a postcard. Don't forget to leave your shipping address. If you want more of them, just select the $10 perk more times. You can also make to someone close to you, a nice surprise. Just pick a city, tell us your personalized message, add their address and we will take care of the rest. Isn't that cool?


Have you heard about aperitivo, a cool alternative to dining in a restaurant in Italy? Did you know that in Bucharest, Romania there are a lot of non-stop restaurants and supermarkets?  Select this perk and you will receive for $15 a cool infographic (10 cool facts) via e-mail containing all the hidden facts of your favorite destination (choose from Italy, Germany and Romania). A preview image of the infographic will be posted here shortly.


Check our cool Tripal t-shirt. Together with your purchase, you will also receive 10 super stickers with Tripal.

LIMITED EDITION: If you are among the first 50 to select this perk, you will get it for $20 (add extra $10 for shipping in Europe and $20 for shipping outside Europe). 

You've missed the limited edition? Don't worry you can still get the t-shirt and the sticker for $35 (add extra $10 for shipping in Europe and $20 for shipping outside Europe).


Use our service for free for the first time! Once we launch Tripal you will get a free Tripal support from one of our locals for your trip. We plan to start with top locations from Europe, so this perk is perfect for you if you plan to visit one of them next year.


If your next trip destination in 2014 is in Europe, then tell us a little about what you hope to do (when, where etc ...) and we will provide to you all the details you need for a personalized trip (how to book cheap flights, hotels, what to visit, how to move around). If you come to Italy we will offer our support during your stay.




 My friends call me GPS on holiday! Never trust the others when it comes to organizing a trip, always plan it in advance and search for the best fares (I'm a Flightfox.com expert). More about me on my Linkedin profile. You can write to me at: alexandru@tripal.me

 I always go on my holidays with friends like Alex that have everything already prepared, you might say that I like to follow my well prepared friends, but still, most of my information comes from asking around locals. Discover my Linkedin profile. Contact me at: daniel@tripal.me

 Although I'm not an adrenaline junkie, the greatest thing I survived during a trip was a Zorb ride. It wasn't a planned thing - following a plan is plain old boring. Our New Zealand motel hosts told us about it. No one knows a place better than a local.:). Have a look on my Linkedin profile. Drop me an e-mail at: mihai@tripal.me





Thanks a lot for your support! 

Stay in touch with us using one of the links below:

story:
Short Summary

If you have ever spent time at the Leopard Lounge and Spa @ VW Bus Camp at Burning Man you know how inviting and inclusive this space is.  The Brain Freeze machine will cool you and rejuvenate you.  The live music will make you dance and sing.  The lounge chairs are inviting and someone will care for your poor Playa feet.  This space has welcomed and nurtured Burners for 9 years. The space includes: 10 lounge chairs for hand and foot care, 3 massage rooms, a brain freeze machine, a live music space, with keyboard and mics and lots of drums. Last but not least is the Tequila Bar.  The Leopard Lounge and Spa is a place to get out of the sun and enjoy some fun at Burning Man.

What We Need

We have new walls coming.  More funding would allow us to replace other worn parts of the Leopard Lounge and Spa.
  • We raised enough for the walls, now we would like to fund some other parts to the set. 
  • We have created great Bus camp/ Leopard Lounge perks .
  • Now we would like to raise more funds for other parts of the Lounge.

The Impact

We can now upgrade the Leopard Lounge walls.  VW Bus Camp is a green clean camp and we wish to remain that way.  With extra funds we can replace some of the other parts of the set.  Carpet, some new lounge chairs, even a new pop up or two.
Other Ways You Can Help
  • Please share this with all your friends.  We would like to get this sorted by May.
  • Please use Facebook, Twitter, or even word of mouth... drums work well too

Thank you

story:
The spark

It's always been my dream to own a yarn shop.

  • I'm Kristin.  I've been knitting and crocheting my whole life. Recently, a good friend and I were talking about dreams and I told him mine.  He said, "Let's make it happen!"
  • Knitters love community. And good yarn.  We don't have that in this otherwise groovy town.  Stash will be a place where all that happens, right in the heart of downtown.


What We Need & What You Get

One reason yarn shops are not immediately successful is inventory:

  • We want to make sure the shop is fully stocked when we open.  We'll be attending the TNNA trade show in early May looking for those special yarns that aren't available locally.
  • We've got some great perks whether you knit or not!  My business partner has the capital, I've got the skills. I need to turn that into capital.
  • Every little bit will help.  If we don't get the store fully stocked we'll make sure there are some awesome events and classes at the shop.

The Impact

Local is the new black:

  • Small businesses are what make communities unique.  Helping any small business helps create that uniqueness.  Helping me will enable me to give back to my community and expose my customers to the other businesses on the block.

Other Ways You Can Help

As I mentioned in the video it's not JUST about the money:

  • Share my campaign with your friend and social networks.
  • Use the power of Facebook, Twitter and all the other networks.  You'll have my undying love and appreciation.

Let's get knitting!

story:
Our Story

Hi guys!!

Our names are Kristin and Dannielle, and we have a company called Everyone Is Gay. 

Everyone is Gay is a couple of things. First, it is an advice website for all, with an emphasis on Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, and Queer (LGBTQ) youth.  The website uses humor and honesty to support these youth, to dialogue with others in the LGBTQ community, and to simultaneously keep everyone laughing.  Second, Everyone Is Gay works to increase awareness at high school and college campuses through an ongoing, nationwide tour. 

Before departing on our very first tour this past September, we were both working part-time jobs and meeting in Kristin's living room twice each week to keep up with the influx of emails, messages, phone calls, and other business-related items.  Having now returned home, we have quit our part-time jobs (GULP!) and are continuing to reach out to schools and other youth organizations. 

We are now working five days a week to keep things moving, and to reach as many youth as possible.

What We Need & What You Get

More than anything else, we need to survive and be able to pay the many bills, both for the company and for ourselves, in order to do the work that goes along with running a website and managing a nationwide tour of schools.**


We need your help to keep things running, especially through the next few crucial months of our growth. We have made it this far with your support, and we truly believe that by putting all of our energies toward these efforts we will soon be able to support ourselves while continuing to reach hundreds of thousands of youth worldwide.


We are campaigning to raise $20,000 to help us as we become a full-fledged and self-sustaining business.  We want to encourage you to give any amount, there is NO AMOUNT TOO SMALL!  Every little bit helps and gets us that much closer to our goal!


So, what do you get (apart from our daily advice and antics)?!  Our perks include listing your name in one of our webcasts, a compilation of original Everyone Is Gay songs by artists such as Greg Laswell, Jenny Owen Youngs, and Company of Thieves, a personal wake-up call or a 20-minute video-chat with Kristin and Dannielle, t-shirts, mugs, an awesome poster signed by all of the important people on planet earth, and dinner with Everyone Is Gay!


Why should you help us?  Well...you can contribute because you love us, or because you want to Skype with us, or because you want to give your boo the BEST HOLIDAY GIFT EVER and have her unwrap a note that says, "Kristin and Dannielle will be calling to wake your ass up for our date tomorrow. You're welcome."


-----THIS JUST IN---

If you're outside of the US and having trouble contributing to our campaign, we have made all of the perks available via our ONLINE STORE, you can use paypal!!

-----THIS JUST OUT---


We love you guys and we are so, so excited to keep on keepin' on.


XOXO,


Kristin and Dannielle


**for the curious cats, a breakdown of expenses is available upon request.

story:
Our Story

I have assembled a team of devoted, hard working volunteers from all around the world that are working to bring you a community driven marketing machine.  Participants and supporters range from 17 year-old Lars working hard in Germany and AkeemPennicooke, the 16-year old boy wonder behind Hemiogenic  to Digital Roar, infrared5, Designing Digitally,Reaction Grid.  Alex and Elliot and the other members of the Boston Unity Group are hard at work bringing up our next generation of rock stars.  You all know Danielle Olson- The vision behind Infinite unityverse -responsible for the Comic book look. Wait- I can't forget Deniz who is spending his weekend knee deep in wordpress code and helping us find developers to get the site up to par.  And Joe Burchett -of Game Developer Radio whose 80 minute interview helped me think through all that I wanted to say and find renewed energy in the community.


The Impact

Our machine as it exists already brings thousands of developers together daily in one strong focused voice.  We're already able to get young talented indie developers the kind of visibility reserved for large companies.  We connect them with the people that they need and we work with our partners to provide them with access to tools that would usually be out of their reach.  Most importantly we teach them to be introspective about their wildest ideas and dare to dream about the possibility of them becoming a reality.  

By gamifying Infinite Unityverse into an environment where developers can choose to purchase visibility or work and earn it as well as a magical pseudounityverse  we give developers the other half of the puzzle.  Unity engine democratized game development.  We are well on our way to doing the same for indie developers marketing their apps,games and goods.  In a world where they are superheroes they believe that they can build amazing stuff-.  That's because they can and do.  We then make sure that the whole world sees them and that they can collaborate and cooperatively get that moment to show the world what they've got and bat it out the park!


Imagine a 16 year old working hard in his bedroom and then able to connect with another 16 year old halfway around the world with ninja video editing skills and his friend with amazing modeling skills.  Now imagine that they are joined by another 20 year old who is a master of all things audio with a score to die for and all of them are able to work on an immersive 3D movie that the whole world is watching.  Better yet stop imagining and drop by infinite unity3D to see how far we've come on the strength and effort of volunteers and know that we will be even better when we're able to devote our time to the cause instead of being limited because of a broken template.  We're getting 40-60,000 monthly views as a rag-tag bunch of guys.  Look forward to us as a well built machine with the same fire, renewed passion and even more energy. 

What We Need & What You Get

At this point these devs are taking time away from their own work in progress to help us build.  I'm spending hours daily debugging wordpress and chasing bugs instead of being out in the community growing young developers.  

The goal is to be able to have a team that will fix and maintain the site so that the over 600 articles that we've accumulated each get a chance to shine and so that developers can find each other and collaborate.  

By supporting Infinite Unityverse you'll be part of the machine that leveled the playing field.



if you're not able to support us financially please help us get the word out so that our mission and vision is clear.

Imagine a 16 year old working hard in his bedroom and then able to connect with another 16 year old halfway around the world with ninja video editing skills and his friend with amazing modeling skills.  Now imagine that they are joined by another 20 year old who is a master of all things audio with a score to die for and all of them are able to work on an immersive 3D movie that the whole world is watching.  Better yet stop imagining and drop by infinite unity3D to see how far we've come on the strength and effort of volunteers and know that we will be even better when we're able to devote our time to the cause instead of being limited because of a broken template.  We're getting 40-60,000 monthly views as a rag-tag bunch of guys.  Look forward to us as a well built machine with the same fire, renewed passion and even more energy. 


What We Need & What You Get
At this point these devs are taking time away from their own work in progress to help us build.  I'm spending hours daily debugging wordpress and chasing bugs instead of being out in the community growing young developers.  
The goal is to be able to have a team that will fix and maintain the site so that the over 600 articles that we've accumulated each get a chance to shine and so that developers can find each other and collaborate.  
By supporting Infinite Unityverse you'll be part of the machine that leveled the playing field.


if you're not able to support us financially please help us get the word out so that our mission and vision is clear.

story:
LIVE RICHLY

Hi my name is Delano Shaw, i currently reside in new jersey, and have been running a very small business in the island of Jamaica. I am however currently looking to bring a new business venture to the island but the country is so far behind on thinking outside the box," from the extremly high interest rate banks to the down playing of creativity.

I am on the verge of getting a contract with two major hotel chains on the island to pick up there high end customers but to complete this transaction I need to acquire two luxury vehicles. I believe everyone should want the best and have the best for themselves if only for a day or better yet for a vacation, wedding, or any special event. 

The idea behind this is to be affordable enough so everyone can taste what luxury feels like, to be catered to, and to enjoy the best of life .. By contributing to my campaign you will not only create a valuable perk for yourselves but provide a source of income for many residents that call this island home. I also intend to continue creating multiple businesses and new funding opportunities to make it easier for the next generation of entrepreneurs on the island and eventually throughout the world..

What We Need & What You Get

  • Looking for a minimum of $200,000
  • ($200,000+ indiegogo fee=186,000)-$150,000(Range Rover) This pays for one vehicle = $36,000 , every vehicle is double the price on the island plus paper work and office lease ($5000 a month for 3 months=$15,000)= $21,000 ($5,000 for members cards & perks)=$16,000 ($2,000 for employee uniforms)=$14,000 ($5,000 training materials/office supplies, office furniture etc...)= $9,000 > left for miscellaneous items.
  • LINKS> & number to the dealership in montego bay dealership (atlautomotive.com) - (1-888-285-7378)
  • Look at the great perks below, to see all that I have in store for my supporters.

The Impact

If by now you are not convince by reason of me not eloquently expressing my needs well enough I do apologise "I'm not a writer", but this is me asking for help in the way I know best, so please dont let my incompetents cloud your judgement.. 

And as I have said earlier by contributing to my campaign you will create a valuable perk for yourselve as well as income for me and the many residents that call this island home.. I intend to continue creating multiple businesses and new funding opportunities to make it easier for the next generation of entrepreneurs on the island and through out the whole caribbean.... Thank you in advance..

Other Ways You Can Help

Like the heading says there's many other ways you can help:

 Just because you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • You can advertise on your FACEBOOK page by using indiegogo tools, twitter, etc. And even more important " TELL A FRIEND"                                                                                               
  • Remember:  You dont have to have it all at once, you can contribute multiple times, again thank you in advance

story:
Introduction

My name is John Dohanic from Aquatic Performance Training. My education is a Bachelor of Science degree in Health & Exercise Science Teaching and a Masters of Science Degree in Rehabilitation Science. I have focused my professional career the last 10 years in developing an aquatic exercise and rehabilitation program that is combined with nutrition to help others change their lives.  At the age of 19, I became one of the youngest recipients of a joint replacement in the country and my life was forever changed. This injury inspired me to develop an aquatic exercise program that is helping clients who have injuries and limitations reach their health goals. This campaign is to help our company Aquatic Performance Training be able to expand and grow

Goals: 

1) Purchase a building that will turn into the greatest aquatic training facility in the world

2) Develop new aquatic programs which will include :

A- Specialized aquatic group sessions: utilizing underwater bikes and unique strength                      training equipment

B- Aquatic Therapy: working with clients that need the aquatic environment to recover from            injuries and surgeries

C- Stationary swimming stations: for clients that are in need of swimming space or training            for a swimming event such as triathalons, or ironman competitions

D- Aquatic treadmill stations - for active runners or participants that may not be able to bear all of their body weight on an injured area. Other competitive athletes will be able to utilize these treadmills in order to train for events such as marathons, or triathalons 

 E- Training youth athletes in a variety of modalities that will help prepare them for their                     upcoming seasons in a safe and efficient way

With your help we will be able to do all of these amazing programs, continue to change lives, and create an experience that will change the health industry forever.

Who is Aquatic Performance Training?

Aquatic Performance Training is an exercise and rehabilitation company specializing in aquatic training. We use the natural properties of the water, unique training equipment, research, and nutrition to help our clients with their individual health goals. Some of our clients' goals pertain to weight loss, recovering from injuries, getting stronger for an upcoming event, or just a sustainable exercise program that they can do for the rest of their lives. We are a group of health professionals that range from occupational/physical therapists, exercise physiologists, aquatic directors and swim instructors. 

Project Story 

The Aquatic Performance Training story starts 12 years ago when the owner John Dohanic needed to have a joint replaced at the age of 19.  A former football player and active weight lifter John needed to find an exercise program that produced amazing results with as little stress on the body as possible. Recommended by his doctor, he turned to an aquatic center and felt great being in the pool but the traditional aquatic training with noodles, foam dumbbells, and group sing alongs were not cutting it to transform his body. What happened next?! While working on his Bachelor and Masters of Science degrees John created Aquatic Performance Training. This program was created out of necessity, research, testing, and a culmination of a thousand different clients that were all transformed by a brand new aquatic program that has grown over the last 9 years. From private training, to small group training, to now working with over 100 fantastic people a day Aquatic Performance Training is continuing to grow. We have over 300 amazing clients, 15 team members, and our focus will always be creating the safest, most effective, exercise programs in the world.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Hannah King. After spending years in government contracting, I took a leap of faith and opened Littleton Market. This campaign is important to me because we are doing something no one else would. Before Littleton Market, downtown Littleton Colorado was classified as a food desert. There was simply nowhere to get quality, local groceries.  

      Now, 8 months later, we are becoming a staple in the community. Still, we have a long way to go to reach our goal: to service 50 return customers a day. With your contributions, we will be able to create revenue for costs associated to expand, while working towards our goal. 

     What contributers get is one of our five packages offered. Each package was uniquely designed for you in mind. 

     There have been many hurdles to get the store started, financial obstacles, dissapoinments, and wins. However, we keep coming back to our mission statement: to connect people to the story of their food. 

     Littleton Market will be successful, because we believe in what we are doing. Remember the store your grandparents used to talk about? The one they bought milk and bread from...that is what we want to bring back to life. Please join us as we do so.

story:
What is Portland Shave Ice?

We are a women owned business based on fun, love of good food and bringing joy to children and adults alike.

How do we do this?

We craft a selection of unique syrups using the finest ingredients the Northwest has to offer. Our boozy shave ice is exactly the fun and unique bit of awesome to make your next event special. We also offer a variety of kid friendly flavors that are lower in sugar. 

Heather and Amanda both bring professional food service experience, huge amounts of drive and motivation and a varied and electric expertise in parties.

We would greatly appreciate the help and support from the community to get our business running smoothly and efficiently.


What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to get a commercial shave ice machine, supplies for our cart and a few more licenses, we are working our way through a pile of paperwork and need the funds to file it all with the man.

  • You get something good for your donation! Most donations receive a Haiku (who doesn't love a Haiku!)

  • The most exciting thank you package anyone in Portland could dream of  includes a  Shave Ice party with a signature flavor named after you! Your friends will all be impressed!

  • We will be having a launch party in May - the $25 perk - and it is going to be a rocking good time! We’ll continue to share party details as the date nears but you can count on a party that is as unique, exciting, fun, and boozy as our business concept. Look forward to seeing you there!


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • If you have more time then money that’s okay, maybe you have a super awesome skill, or your really strong (we need some things lifted) maybe you read business law books as a hobby, or have a big van or know how to screen print. Please, contact us at portlandshaveice@gmail.com and we will gladly accept a helping hand with the deepest of gratitude.
  • If you like the idea of Portland Shave Ice , please help spread the word using the  Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you and Party on.

xo,

Heather and Amanda

story:
The Basics

Access to Clean Water is a vital component in:

  • the Elimination of Poverty
  • Political Stabilization
  • Education and Equality of Women
  • Eradication of Curable Disease
People around the world are forced to spend excessive time and energy going to collect clean water, sometimes hours a day. Children are forced to quit school and parents are unable to hold normal jobs, making it impossible for them to create a better world for themselves. 

What is Needed

The Water Project Inc is an incredible charity that takes donations and builds wells in water unstable communities around the world. Sells 4 Wells will partner with The Water Project by allowing people to turn their junk into well-building donations. 

Our Goal

Create an online yardsale site where people can "buy" gently used items in exchange for a donation to the Water Project. Each site will be focussed on a single geographic location (i.e. Richmond, Virginia or Austin, Texas) making it possible to for each city to group fund single wells in "sister cities" across the globe. 

Risks & Challenges

Currently, money is needed to advertise the site in the launch city. Once the ball is rolling, word of mouth should be sufficient to sustain the traffic utilizing the site. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our story. It's so simple. Use the Indiegogo share link, or share this on your social network profiles. 

And that's all there is to it.

story:
I started SKOT magic about 6 months ago to sell fun magic tricks that can be performed close up. I wanted to give everyone the opportunity to be just like David Blaine and Dynamo.

Hi There! I wanted to Introduce myself. I'm Scott the person behind SKOT magic! (The dog in the picture is Edna, yes named after Dame Edna, of course!)

With so much hatred and nasty things happening in the world my aim is to try and make life a little more joyful. That's why I decided to create SKOTmagic.co.uk with the aim of bringing some fun and laughter to everyone out there.

I want to create an online store that is full of affordable fun products for everyone. I want to stock everything from fun magic tricks, to novelties for parties, everything will have the aim of making life a little more fun and enjoyable.

Life should be fun and full of laughter and giggles, that’s why every product I stock is guaranteed to bring you some fun! Read more about SKOT magic by clicking on this link: http://www.skotmagic.co.uk/page/aboutus

I will use the funds raised to help me source stock, I have found lots of suppliers some are based in the USA, China etc. I aim to buy quantities of stock and keep it here in Derby, England. That way I will have total control over the shipping, which  will lead to quicker postage times and better customer service.

I have been speaking to lots of performers and magicians and finding out what products they want. So I want to expand my offering to provide for these.


The Impact:
I will be able to :
> Expand my product range
> improve my customer's experience of shopping in my store
> deliver a wider variety of fun products
> make the world a more fun place to be!

My experience:

I've always loved entertaining and making everyone happy!

I have been selling online for years using Ebay and Amazon and also via my own websites, but I struggled to find a niche; I have found it now and I am very excited and eager to make it work!

I have also run 2 market stalls, one selling jewellery and another selling army surplus.

So I do have a lot of retail experience to draw on and lots of experience in meeting the c ustomers needs.

If you can't contribute money it would be great if you would take a look at my website and share it with your friends, also give me a like on facebook!

www.skotmagic.co.uk

www.facebook.com/skotmagic

story:
Short Summary

Inhabit is a church-based non-profit that rehabs foreclosed houses and moves Christian leaders into the central city to live and serve. 

  • Inhabit is a 501c3 non profit started in 2012 by Transformation City Church. 
  • Inhabit recently bought a 6 bedroom house in Sherman Park for less than a quarter of the list price,  (10,000 dollars)
  • It needs : A new hot water heater, all new plumbing, AC, Furnace, new roof, some new electrical, all new flooring, structural improvements, a new exterior door and much more. For a complete list, click here
  • We have recruited leaders to live in it this Fall but still need to raise funds to rehab it. 
  • With your help we would like to raise 30,000 dollars in 40 days and pay for the entire rehab and have the house move in ready for this fall. For more specific information about the cost associated with the rehab, click here.

What We Need & What You Get

We need you to give generously, share our campaign with your friends and tell others what we are doing.

We have many perks for donors at different levels with fun tours, VIP  meals , Inhabit Flair, EPs and more. We want this to be fun for everyone. Check it out before you donate. 
If we don't reach our entire goal, we will apply the funds raised to the house rehab.

The Impact

Your donation will make an immediate and lasting impact on a block. The house on 50th St. has been vacant for over four years. Over that time, it fell into disrepair, was flooded and looted by thieves. It became a liability to the overall health of the neighborhood.

Together, we can change this. Inhabit will rehab the house, move Christian leaders into the neighborhood and develop ministries based on the voiced needs of neighbors. 

Inhabit and Transformation City have rehabbed 2 houses already and started a tutoring, dance, mentoring, youth and kids ministry that all started in the neighborhood surrounding the houses. We have planted community gardens, provided a safe place for kids and ministered to neighbors through presence, practical help and prayer.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • There are other ways to help on our website. 
Thank You!
