If we don't reach our entire goal, we will apply the funds raised to the house rehab.   The Impact Your donation will make an immediate and lasting impact on a block. The house on 50th St. has been vacant for over four years. Over that time, it fell into disrepair, was flooded and looted by thieves. It became a liability to the overall health of the neighborhood.
Together, we can change this. Inhabit will rehab the house, move Christian leaders into the neighborhood and develop ministries based on the voiced needs of neighbors. 
Inhabit and Transformation City have rehabbed 2 houses already and started a tutoring, dance, mentoring, youth and kids ministry that all started in the neighborhood surrounding the houses. We have planted community gardens, provided a safe place for kids and ministered to neighbors through presence, practical help and prayer.

    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
There are other ways to help on our website. 
 
Thank You!

story: Nevermind
story_txt: Nevermind

story:
Dear Donor, 

As you probably already know the Syrian Civil War has created a massive humanitarian crisis sending millions of displaced Syrians all over the world. Currently many refugees face an undetermined future and they are in need of as much help as possible. 

I will be traveling to Sofia, Bulgaria for a short while and I am hoping to make as much impact as possible. Recently 11,000 refugees claimed asylum in Bulgaria but their future still remains in the balance. 

My proposal is a simple one off donation where I will be contributing food, clothing, and toys to those in need in time for the start of spring and Orthodox Easter which is significant in Bulgaria. I will use the funds to locally purchase as many goods as possible, that will be as beneficial as they can be. 

These donations will be accompanied by photographs and hopefully some video which I can later share to spread the message for those in need. 

Please consider any size donation, it will be extremely helpful. 

Regards,

Nima Yaghmaei

story:
UPDATE: We are thrilled that we hit over 600% of our campaign goal! Based on interest, we are extending signs-up unitl Monday, May 4, just before midnight.

For folks in San Francisco, Daly City, Brisbane or San Bruno (CA): Please sign up for our local delivery pilot program of our handcrafted cocktail ingredient kits.

For folks in other parts of the continental U.S.: Please sign up for mail delivery of select handcrafted cocktail ingredients and bartending tools.

Please find more details below. Thanks again for the support!

Creative libations continue to grow in popularity throughout the country, and we are here to bring the cocktail bug to you.

Salud Cocktails & Co. is a new service starting in the San Francisco area that delivers ingredient kits to make delicious cocktails. We cater to people who want to host their own gatherings, but who are hindered by the prep time or deterred by the unfamiliar ingredients.


THE BENEFITS

DIY.  Experience the fun of learning how to make some tasty cocktails yourself using our packaged ingredient kits and recipes.

QUALITY.  We handcraft simple syrups, bitters, and other ingredients in small batches using fresh and unique flavors.

TIME-SAVING.  Can't track down the many and difficult to find ingredients in stores? With local delivery, the ingredients are delivered at your convenience.

AFFORDABLE.  No need to stretch your budget. The average cost of each drink could be as low as $4-$6 depending on the liquor that you purchase.

SOCIAL.  Find time to socialize with your friends by hosting monthly gatherings, or throw a weekly happy hour at the office.



OUR PRODUCTS & SERVICES

Starting in San Francisco, Daly City, Brisbane, and San Bruno (CA), we will be locally delivering cocktail ingredient kits that include our handcrafted syrups and bitters as well as other ingredients such as club soda, ginger beer, and garnishes needed to make amazing drinks with little effort. You simply choose a date and a 2-hour window to receive the delivery. Then, select the desired cocktail kit and size to make either 12 drinks or 24 drinks. We’ll let you know the base alcohol (whiskey, gin, vodka, etc.) that you will need, or you can choose to keep it virgin.


Here is a sample of some of the available cocktails that are available: 
* Denotes hand-crafted ingredients by Salud

Thai One On
A refreshing, effervescent cocktail with traditional Thai flavors.
Kit includes: lemongrass-ginger simple syrup*, lime, lemongrass, Thai basil, club soda
(Recommended with vodka)


A Spicy Mango
Bright mango and lime with a spicy kick provide a great contrast to the salty-sugary rim.
Kit includes: Manila mango-lime puree*, lime, jalapeño, sea salt-sugar
(Recommended with tequila)


Mumbai Mule
Our tangy tamarind take on a classic, this mule’s kick comes from a hint of jalapeño.
Kit includes: tamarind-chili puree*, lime, jalapeño, ginger beer
(Recommended with vodka)


Good Ol' Fashioned
A time-honored tradition, starring small batch bitters and spiced cherries.
Grandpa-Style kit includes: orange-clove bitters*, Turbinado simple syrup, orange, spiced maraschino cherries*, bamboo pick
NOLA-Style kit includes: chicory-coffee bitters*, Turbinado simple syrup, lemon, spiced maraschino cherries*, bamboo pick
(Recommended with bourbon or rye whiskey)


World Peace
Our spin on the Paloma. Nothing says peace like a refreshing harmony of citrus, floral, and herbal notes.
Kit includes: grapefruit, lemon, elderflower-lemon simple syrup*, mint
(Recommended with gin)


Mango Mojito
A tropical take on the refreshing classic mojito.
Kit includes: Manila mango-lime puree*, lime, mint, club soda
(Recommended with white rum)


Red-Headed Kid
Your comforting combination of fresh "ginga" with lemon and honey with the punch of whiskey.
Kit includes: ginger-honey simple syrup*, lemon, ginger beer, crystalized ginger, bamboo pick
(Recommended with Irish whiskey)


The Sour Cherry
A sexier take on the whiskey sour with muddled cherries and fresh citrus juices.
Kit includes: spiced stewed cherries*, Grandpa (orange-clove) bitters*, lemon, orange,
(Recommended with rye whiskey and with optionally Aperol)


Salud Bloody Mary (8-drink kit only)
Our classic house Bloody Mary stacked with accompaniments including light and crisp homemade pickled vegetables.
Kit includes: Tomato juice, seasonings, lemon, lime, pickled carrot/daikon/cucumber*, olive, pepperoncini, bamboo pick
(Recommended with vodka)



OTHER PRODUCTS

While we won't be able to ship fresh fruits and herbs, people in other parts of the continental U.S. can still purchase some of our versatile simple syrups, purees, and bitters, which can be used for both virgin and non-virgin drinks. 
Simple Syrups & Purees
Simple Syrups (makes ~24 drinks): elderflower-lemon, ginger-honey, lemongrass-ginger, turbinado
Purees (makes ~12 drinks): Manila mango-lime, tamarind-chili

Bitters (makes ~24 drinks)
Grandpa (orange-clove), NOLA (chicory-coffee), Diva (hibiscus-pink-peppercorn)

We will also have staple bartending tools for optional purchase. Our essential bartending starter kit is available with selected perks for this Indiegogo campaign.
Bartending Starter Kit
Includes: Boston-style shaker, hawthorne strainer, 2 jiggers, muddler, bar spoon



OUR CURRENT PROGRESS

Salud has been extremely fortunate to have Drake, a gorgeous lounge in San Francisco’s SoMa area, host our production in their kitchen facilities. We were also given an exciting opportunity by Drake to create a cocktail menu using our handcrafted ingredients to complement their newly launched dinner service. We custom designed the drinks to match their culinary style of American comfort classics with an Asian twist. (Learn more here!) After getting some great feedback on our cocktails from Drake’s customers so far, we are now ready to open the doors to our delivery service starting with a pilot program.

We're also using this pilot to gauge people's interest in our products and services. If the program is successful, we will take the next step in the long battle to try to obtain an alcohol license so that we can include liquor with our kits as well.



HOW YOU CAN HELP!

FOR FOLKS IN THE SAN FRANCISCO AREA. Please join our May pilot program if you live within the San Francisco, Daly City, Brisbane, or San Bruno city boundaries by signing up for one of our "PILOT PARTICIPANTS" perks. Perks provide a discount from our standard pricing. Only participants will be able to see the products to submit orders on our website while we test our processes. We will be looking for you to provide valuable candid feedback on our goods and services to help us craft the best experience for customers.

Orders for the pilot program will open on April 27, 2015, and deliveries will be available Saturdays and Sundays throughout May 2015 from 10am-4pm. We may potentially add other options based on feedback.

FOR FOLKS IN OTHER PARTS OF THE CONTINENTAL U.S. You can still support us! Please sign up for one of our "MAILER" perks to receive some nifty items via mail instead. You can also opt in to receive updates on our full launch, future expansion outside of San Francisco, and potential additional mail-delivery options.


REFERRAL CONTEST

For every time your referrals' contributions total an increment of $100, you'll receive $10 of store credit to purchase local delivery or mail delivery products on our site during the pilot program!

ADDITIONAL PRIZES:

Top Total Referral Contributions: 4 Passes to Salud’s Launch Party including 16 drink tickets and a gift certificate for 2 24-drink kits to host your own party. Or you can choose to receive a $200 gift certificate for any products or services on our website instead.

2nd Top Total Referral Contributions: 2 Passes to Salud’s Launch Party including 8 drink tickets and a gift certificate for 2 12-drink kits to host your own party. Or you can choose to receive a $100 gift certificate for any products or services on our website instead.

IMPORTANT NOTE: You must be logged into your Indiegogo account and use Indiegogo’s share tools for our analytics to track your referrals. You will be able to check your referrals through your Indiegogo profile.


THANK YOU!

We are appreciative of any support and participation that you can offer. While we would like to get as many pilot participants as possible, even a $5 contribution will be a difference in helping to get our business up and running. Thank you for your support in advance!

Salud Cocktails & Co.

story:
Our Story

I am an electronic technician by trade and a musician by night.  Having played the saxophone in a successful band during the 1960s, I had dreamt of touring with the band until, disappointingly, we members were sent on our separate paths by the draft for the Vietnam conflict.

Six years ago, my wife and I decided to move to Prince Edward Island for its natural beauty, relaxing lifestyle, and warm and talented people.  We embraced the operation of a Bed & Breakfast and volunteerism:  my wife became a board member with Canadian Parents for French-PEI and I, Chair of the village Arts Council and Treasurer of its Development Corporation.  Ultimately, lacking sufficient, compensated year-round employment, we set out to open a restaurant and pub in 2011 with the objective of promoting Island food, culture and music, having met many local musicians while serving on the Arts Council and performing with the Holland College Welshmen Community Band.

Thoroughly captivated by Islanders' copious, colourful stories of PEI of bygone days, we decided to borrow this theme for our new restaurant.  We thus embarked on a journey to depict the eras throughout Island history:  from the days before PEI joined the Confederation of Canada up to 1993, when Canadaâ€™s first female Premier was elected in PEI.  My wife spent countless days and nights at the Office of Provincial Archives and Robertson Library at the University of PEI amassing digital images, which were then printed, framed and now adorn the walls of our establishment. We even appropriated the name from historical annals; prior to the construction in 1847 of PEIâ€™s Province House, politicians would gather for animated discussion at the Cross Keys Tavern, Charlottetownâ€™s popular watering hole.

In our foyer, a map of PEI with the original Miâ€™kmaq place names is displayed alongside a magazine cover from 1891, discovered in a gallery in Ottawa, portraying a PEI Aboriginal chief.  Brown University in Rhode Island donated the digital image of the oldest known portrait of an Acadian from PEI.  Our other portraits include the first Acadian Member of the Legislative Assembly (MLA); the first Acadian Premier; the first Acadian Lieutenant Governor; the first Bishop of Charlottetown; Lord Selkirk, instrumental in transplanting 800 Scots to the Island; the first United Empire Loyalist Governor; the first catholic Lieutenant Governor (an Irishman); the first catholic Premier (another Irishman); the first female MLA; the first Dutch resident of PEI, Samuel Holland, who became Canadaâ€™s first Surveyor General; and so on.  We have created a cultural destination by assembling a gallery of approximately 30 prints (portraits, maps and legislation) in celebration of PEIâ€™s rich political history.

Steeped in this history, we have tried to re-create the look and feel of a 19th-century pub.  Realistically, we could only address the interior of our rural, nondescript commercial building; altering the faÃ§ade would have simply been cost-prohibitive.  We have built a bar and bench seating; the venue is warm and comfortable where local musicians are invited to perform.  We offer Sunday afternoon jam sessions and promote special events to celebrate various holidays and sporting events, thus relishing every moment we spend with friends and neighbours (which seems to have diminished in the hustle and bustle of today's society).  Finally, we have tried to add to the historical appeal by using stoneware from an Island potter.

The Impact

It has been heartbreaking to witness families in the Atlantic Provinces separated by the need to go west for work in order to survive.  My wife and I deeply believe in giving back to our community and hope that, by hiring over 42 local employees, this will in some small way allow a few families to remain intact by not needing to leave their beautiful Island home.  In fact, we are honoured and humbled to have brought on board a local Red Seal Chef who, having returned home from Alberta, asserts that he wishes to remain here â€œas PEI is (his) home, and this is where (he) wants to live and die."

To date, we have used all the proceeds from the sale of our former home, augmented by start-up loans, to establish this dream in our new-found land.  As many will understand, having been self-employed for 30 years, I have no savings, retirement or additional funds on which to depend. Regrettably, everywhere we turn for possible funding assistance (for the prints and framing, the promotion of cultural tourism, etc.), we have been denied, the cited reason being that we are a restaurant and not a museum or cultural centre.

What We Need & What You Get

 

After spending $2,000 on an energy audit, no funding was available for recommended improvements.  Unfortunately, the renovations to our purchased building exceeded the initial proposals and we have had to delay much-needed work that would enable us to become more energy efficient.  It is our personal mandate to decrease our energy footprint, thereby cutting our energy costs in order to accomplish our other objectives. 

Consequently, we need $15,000 for an air-to-water source heat pump, $3,000 for additional insulation, and $200 for programmable thermostats.  Moreover, without this adequate ventilation, our kitchen becomes so hot the Health Department could, in fact, shut us down during the summer months, our busiest season.  We hope to complete the work progressively as soon as we can afford to do so.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us realize our dream of promoting local music and healthy food in a family-oriented environment.  If you have not yet given us a try, please drop in!  If you cannot contribute here, visit us or call today to reserve your next meeting or private function at our restaurant.  Please help spread the word by sending this campaign to your friends!

story:
ABOUT TOM and A NEW VISION OF LIVING™

Creating an integrated new media platform that provides tools and inspiration for healthy, balanced, rejuvenated, awake, interconnected, joyful, and sacred living . . . 


For over 45 years I have traveled the globe from the Amazon to the Yukon, from Polynesia to South East Asia, throughout the United States and Europe studying indigenous wisdom ways,  including completion of a 11 year apprenticeship with Huichol shamans of Mexico, while earning 3 degrees and keeping up with the latest findings of western psychology, wellness practices, brain science and quantum physics.....all of which I use to help people wake up, remember and live from the truth of who and what we are and why we are here.

I know that the truth of our deepest being is the luminosity of unconditional love, wisdom, creativity and joy.

I know this because...
  • I developed a successful wilderness treatment program for heroin addicts in the early 70’s
  • I co-created the first at-home Hospice program in the United States and have worked with children and adults facing life-threatening illness using innovative attitudinal healing practices for over thirty years
  • I have led vision quests and created meaningful rites of passage ceremonies and experiences marking key life transitions for people and groups for over 40 years.

I have worked with thousands of people around the world helping them find and live this truth in their daily lives. 

Towards this end I have authored four books, Fruitful Aging: Finding the Gold in the Golden Years, Shamanic Wisdom of the Huichol: Medicine Teachings for Modern Times, Do They Celebrate Christmas in Heaven? Spiritual Rite of Passage Teachings from Children with Life-Threatening Illness, and Climbing the Ladder: 12 Years of Pilgrimage to Mt. Shasta,  created entertaining You Tube videos and CD’s,  founded the non-profit organization, WAKAN, and most recently developed A New Vision of Aging program, including Recognition Rites Honoring Elders.

THE VISION


Why do we need a new vision?

There is no part of our biosphere or psyche not under threat of extinction. In response to the environmental, health, social, and economic challenges of the times, research shows that an increasing number of people report feeling:

  • Powerless
  • Depressed
  • Isolated
  • Fearful
  • Stuck 
  • Hopeless
  • Frustrated 
  • Lonely

The problems of today's world stem from a perceptual and belief system based on an understanding of reality as  distinct, ego-identified, independent objects separated in space from other objects. Yet science today echoes what the world's wisdom and spiritual traditions have  been saying for eons: on the deepest level of our being we are not things at all. We are patterns of vibrating energy fields enmeshed and "entangled" in a an infinite field of energy, a web of oneness in which every "thing" is interconnected. In fact, there is no such thing as a separate thing! 

We desperately need a new vision of who and what we really are and here is the essence of that vision: WE ARE ALL SACRED WORTHY, LUMINOUS BEINGS. WE ARE LOVE AND OUR LOVE IS FOR GIVING. 

My mission is to share this message around the globe helping people wake up to the life-changing truth of who we are, what we are, and why we are here! With your support I can use new media to empower people to re-discover their essence and live from that knowledge, transforming relationships toward a world that works for all beings.

I ask your support in helping me help people connect their hearts, minds, and bodies re-learning how to walk in sacred love, balance  and harmony with the wondrous creation in which we are gifted by grace to live and thrive. 


FUNDING GOALS

I am seeking $8500.00 in total. Use of funds:

  • Website (we have a designer lined up who has agreed to do this for a largely reduced fee) $1500

  • Community Outreach (marketing, PR, program development) $3,000

  • Video shoots and editing (1 introductory seminar video of 60 minutes, 12 fifteen-minute workshop videos, 4 two-minute inspirational videos) $2500

  • E-books, podcasts, webinars  $1500


IMPLEMENTATION 

With my latest book, Fruitful Aging, I have set the tone for a series that explores new, more sacred, joyful, and sustainable visions for a myriad of aspects of living. The following domains are assets that will be used as part of this platform:

  • ANewVisionOfAging.com
  • ANewVisionOfLiving.com
  • ANewVisionOfWealth.com
  • ANewVisionOfHealing.com
  • ANewVisionOfWellness.com
  • LiveEnriched.com
  • SacredWorthyLuminousBeing.com
  • FruitfulAging.com

I will use new media to create easy access programming and outreach available to people around the world. A new website will provide a user friendly, inviting "online home" for folks drawn to, and interested in, learning about A New Vision of Living™.


IMPACT

Tom has already inspired and empowered thousands of people around the world; But the times call for ever more positive change and Dr. Pinkson can help lead the way. Here are just a few of the testimonials clients and participants in his workshops, retreats and Recogntion Rites have shared:

“With his humility, strength and incomparable experience, Tom holds sacred space like none other. He makes everyone feel safe, welcome, and valued.” – Glen, Film Maker

“One ceremony with Tom is like 10 years of psychotherapy.” – Candace, College Student

"During the ceremony with Tom I was jolted. Can't think of another word that works here, but yeah…during the ceremony, I was jolted by the spiritual channel he opened up. Clarity. About my life. About the world at large. And this opening occurred from the medicine but also Tom's powerful calling and bringing in spirit. The drums. The chants. The intention. All of it." - Steve, Entrepreneur

“My gratitude for Tom can’t be put into words, my entire world-view and perception of reality now reflects something much closer to truth. There isn’t a much bigger gift you could give someone, so thank you Tom.” - Ian, Business Owner

“Tom is such a valuable presence in the world. I can’t think of any men I know that hold the kind of space that he holds.  His years of dedication from his heart in your apprenticeship with the work he does has created such a strong center in him.  It’s very unique and so needed.” - Isabelle, Therapist

“I wish I had taped that conversation with Tom. What I would give to sit and talk one on one with him for an hour. He really knows how to communicate with people.” - Mary, Teacher

“This couple has traveled all over the world and they have never met up with anyone that could convey a message that they connected with. Tom got thru to them….he has a way of delivering messages  that is a gift.  The more people Tom talks to the better our world will be…. how many others are there out there that don’t believe the fundamental truth that they are worthy and sacred at their core? Thanks for having the patience to get this message thru to my friends, and to others.” - Nancy, Business Owner

                                                        ---------------------


A NOTE ON PERKS


As you will see below, World Love Bracelets are included with every contribution. Why? Because in my work as a psychologist, leading groups and retreats, when it comes time for people to introduce themselves I invite them to share their names and then to say: “I am a sacred, worthy, luminous being. I am love and my love is for giving.”

Unfortunately many people do not believe this about themselves so this inspired me to create  World Love Bracelets to support people waking up to the truth of their being.  I have given out over 1500 of these bracelets and encourage others to do the same thus sending out ripples of love energy into the world field that desperately needs more love. Thus far, everyone who has received a World Love Bracelet, has ordered more for friends and family.


I would like to create more lifestyle products with this message such as different color and style bracelets, necklaces, totes, perhaps even sacred object home decor people can give as gifts to themselves or loved ones.


QUESTIONS? Get in touch.

WWW.DRTOMPINKSON.COM
FB @SACREDLIVING
TOMPINKSON@GMAIL.COM


THANK YOU FOR YOUR CARING AND SHARING.


ALL BLESSINGS TO YOU AND THOSE YOU HOLD DEAR.     


~ Tomas
story_txt:
ABOUT TOM and A NEW VISION OF LIVING™Creating an integrated new media platform
that provides tools and inspiration for healthy,
balanced, rejuvenated, awake, interconnected, joyful, and sacred living . . . 


For over 45 years I have traveled the globe from the Amazon to the Yukon, from Polynesia to South East Asia, throughout the United States and Europe studying indigenous wisdom ways,  including completion of a 11 year apprenticeship with Huichol shamans of Mexico, while earning 3 degrees and keeping up with the latest findings of western psychology, wellness practices, brain science and quantum physics.....all of which I use to help people wake up, remember and live from the truth of who and what we are and why we are here.I know that the truth of our deepest being is the luminosity of unconditional love, wisdom, creativity and joy.I know this because... 
I developed a successful wilderness treatment program for heroin addicts in the early 70’s
I co-created the first at-home Hospice program in the United States and have worked with children and adults facing life-threatening illness using innovative attitudinal healing practices for over thirty years

story:
Yogi Fair is the first Certified Fair Trade supernatural skin care line, made for yogis by yogis. Our mission is to spread yoga worldwide to the communities that need it most and to empower and grow the women's cooperatives in West Africa where we source ingredients.

We provide super high quality, certified Fair Trade, 100% natural skin & post yoga care products. By offering mission driven products & by allocating a minimum 10% toward yoga & community related projects we create a virtuous circle whereby our missions are fully funded and every stakeholder group participates positively

Our dream is a world where the products you buy support yoga and everyone involved in the supply chain, from the farmers who grow each and every ingredient to the women in the West African cooperatives where we source our ingredients to the employees who fulfill your order, to you — the customer!

Yogi Fair is a business hatched in the new paradigm of "trade not aid" that supports the ideals of conscious capitalism. By supporting us, you are telling the world that you are an active participant in the global economy and willing to step up and put your money where your heart is.




Our startup team has over 100 years of yoga, business & marketing experience. We also have over 40 years of natural products development experience and have managed businesses ranging from $1M up to $1.5B a year. Your support will help us avoid venture capitalists and other funding sources that certainly will not have our higher, heart driven mission in mind. Be the change YOU wish to see in the world, and together WE can create something beautiful.

We need approximately $25,000 to help us get our first production run of 100% natural Facial Care product, Yoga Mat Sprays, Body Spray, Hair Revive Spray, Body Butter, Lip Balm & Savasana Temple Roller completed. 

Additional stretch goal funds (which we hope to have the opportunity to talk about!) will help us expand our marketing reach by funding early stage promotional campaigns and our first yoga mission to Togo, West Africa. Help support our mission and be the change!


We have some really exciting perks available, including our very first Yogi Fair products which we have put extensive time and effort into with our formulation experts. These are super high quality, 100% natural products that will leave your skin glowing, and your body, hair & yoga mat smelling great!

Check out the $50 "Face the World" package for a full set of facial care products and save over $20, or consider supporting at the $75 level and "Get in the Flow" while saving $25!

Many of our additional perks are designed to offer a variety of products at a great value, and each time you buy our products you'll know that your purchase helps women's cooperatives in West Africa and spreads yoga across the world!

We also have some special perks if you are local to our hometown of Austin, TX. Come practice yoga with the Yogi Fair crew at Del Sol Martial Arts & Fitness, as well as join our Chief Yoga Officers Claudia & Thomas Leverett on a special Hearts Wide Open journey to Nicaragua for a yoga & seva retreat. 

Last but not least, if you really are looking for a once in a lifetime opportunity & you truly believe in our mission, you can join us for our first yoga and community project mission to the villages of Togo, West Africa!

If we do not reach our entire goal, we will use the funds collected toward a smaller first production run and scale back plans to teach the benefits of yoga to women in West Africa. But you can help make sure we fully fund this project by telling your friends, and sharing the love with the people you practice with locally. ♡♡♡

Rise up and be the change you wish to see in the world!

Share this campaign via your Facebook, Twitter or whatever social media network you are a part of. Tell your friends, and talk about us at your local yoga studio! We plan on visiting studios all over the country in the future and we will certainly buy you a green juice as a thank you!

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

We thank you sincerely for taking the time to read our campaign and for your generous contribution! Namasté.

We are forever grateful to so many members of our friends and family. While we cannot thank all of you individually on this page, we offer our ultimate gratitude and loving-kindness. You have literally helped create a brand and for that we are filled with gratitude.

We'd like to thank the Austin-based company Compass Initiative (and Ian Pollard, specifically) for helping us with our Indiegogo video. We couldn't have done this without their patience and passion. Check out their Vimeo page for inspiring work!

We'd also like to thank Dayton, Ohio's GO W/ THE FLOW (Ben Rivet and Tory Reynolds) for donating a live song for us to use in our video. Go check out their upcoming schedule or plan to FLOW with them at Squaw Valley's Wanderlust in July!

story:
Meet Jess!

Many of you are aware of the wild ride my sister & I have been on for the last decade together... several of you have met Jess already, and know the sincerely amazing person that she is. And I'm not saying this out of any obligation from the blood-bond we share... Truly, of the thousands of people I've met, and the hundreds upon hundreds that I've come to know - my sister is one of the most wonderful, compassionate, and savvy people I've ever had the honor to meet.

Well, she's 21 years old now and is about to be a Mom! (due at the end of August)

Life, as it does, has thrown her for a loop recently - her partnership has dissolved (for the best), she's in the process of finding and establishing a new home ...and is flat broke. 

 

New Additions to our Tribe

So, truth be told...

I've been stupidly fortunate when it comes to connecting with amazing people along my lifetime (I'm not blowing smoke here. Sincerely... you rock!). I'd like to introduce you to Jess in the hopes that you find some bond to share, just cuz... we're all a little better off together, right?

I also seek to limit the struggle of a young mom and give a sincere boost to the child she's bringing into the world by creating some breathing room for them as they begin their journey together. 

 

Anything/ Everything Helps 

Donations will go to:

  • secure housing 
  • food
  • offset medical expenses
  • transport
  • buy time on a couple of bills, and
  • acquire all the baby-gear that she cannot otherwise get kicked down... 

 

We've set a modest goal that will just scratch the surface of these expenses. But we think we can achieve it and buy some critical time for Jess to establish herself quickly in Asheville, NC ...and get back into school this spring!

If you're in a position to offer a little extra support, please consider doing so (or just go ahead and blow that tiny goal out of the water! ;)

For everyone who's contended with my madness over the past couple of decades, know that the success of this campaign will surely blunt the sharper edges and soothe my head & heart substantially. You already know I wouldn't ask if it wasn't important! 

Believe me when I say: any amount will go a loooooong way.

 

 

Family

Typically these campaigns offer substantial rewards of some kind. 

For now we have an immense amount of gratitude for your time and consideration. If you have any questions at all, please be in touch. 

Also, pelase fwd this on to any extended family who might get behind the cause! Social media? Go for it...

Oh right, did I happen to mention...?

It's a boy... 

("Uncle Graham"? hm... cool! ;)

story:
We Love Source for Well-Being

Source is the premier alternative heath provider in Western North Carolina for over 12 years. They have won awards for their work, and are repeatedly voted the best in business for alternative healing.

Whitney and Blake Madden, owners of Source, are involved in a long legal zoning battle.  A reversal by the town administration on their original decision to allow Source to remain in its current location on Montreat Road has caused the Maddens $16,703.98 in legal expenses thus far.  With a superior court appeal on the horizon, additional funds estimated to be another $5,000 will be required.  The Maddens have already completely exhausted their personal resources.

95% of the Town of Black Mountain wants Source to stay where it is.  Let's use our resources to help Whitney and Blake support Source For Well-Being.



Help us raise $5,000

$5,000 is a small piece of what Blake and Whitney have to pay legal fees. (Our "indiegogo" goal is $3500, but we're really hoping to hit $5,000. We can do it!) Their lawyer estimates total costs will be in the range of $20,000-$21,000, possibly more. This fundraiser is a good way to show that we care about Source. Look to the left to see exciting perks that you will receive as a contributor. 

Whitney and Blake will continue to spend their own money on lawyers as long as it takes to defend this precious community resource. Many of us have received powerful healing at Source. Let's say thank you. Your energy and your participation does matter. Please put your name up there TODAY!




Get more info about Source's zoning experience here: http://www.blackmountainnc.org


Spread the word, friends

Here is how you can help (please try to do all of these):

  1. Donate. Look to the left and pick a perk. You will have to get a (free) indiegogo account. Thank you for going to that trouble. Thank you for donating. (Note that if you want to contribute a different amount, or if you don't want the perk, just specify that - it's all possible.)
  2. Comment. There is a "comments" tab above. After you donate, please click on there and say something nice about Whitney and Blake, or what Source for Wellbeing has done in your life. Your comments will help the energy of our campaign in many ways, not the least of which is making it more visible to search engines, and bumping us up in the Indiegogo hierarchy.
  3. Facebook. Yep, when you donate, it will ask you if you want to Facebook about donating. YES you do! Say something like, "I just donated to Whitney and Blake's fundraiser and here's why you should too..." It will help!
  4. Join our Facebook group. Yeah!

    Join Friends of Source for Well-Being on Facebook here

If you absolutely can't understand indiegogo, and you want to just send a check to Source, you can do that. We will make sure that your contribution is recorded in the campaign.

___________________________________________________________

More about our PERKS:

  • If you would like to help by donating a perk for this campaign (something that you can give in a multiple of 4+), please email cinnamon.kennedy@gmail.com. We appreciate the help.
  • This is the image by Blake Madden included in the $25, $50, and $95 contribution perk (5x7, suitable for framing):


  • This is the image by Blake Madden for the $550 contribution (printed on metal, ready to hang.):

  • More about Blake Madden, professional photographer, artist responsible for our $25, $50, $95 and $550 perks can be found here: http://www.blakemaddenphotography.com/
  • More about Cinnamon Kennedy, yoga therapist, ($95 & $125 perk) can be found here:
  • More about Katharine Winship and Black Mountain Pilates ($70 perk) can be found here:  http://www.blackmountainpilates.com
  • More about Rebecca Word, Source for Wellbeing Naturopath ($135 perk) can be found here: http://sourceforwellbeing.com/rebecca-r-word-np
story_txt:
We Love Source for Well-Being

Source is the premier alternative heath provider in Western North Carolina for over 12 years. They have won awards for their work, and are repeatedly voted the best in business for alternative healing.
Whitney and Blake Madden, owners of Source, are involved in a long legal zoning battle.  A reversal by the town administration on their original decision to allow Source to remain in its current location on Montreat Road has caused the Maddens $16,703.98 in legal expenses thus far.  With a superior court appeal on the horizon, additional funds estimated to be another $5,000 will be required.  The Maddens have already completely exhausted their personal resources.
95% of the Town of Black Mountain wants Source to stay where it is.  Let's use our resources to help Whitney and Blake support Source For Well-Being.






Help us raise $5,000
$5,000 is a small piece of what Blake and Whitney have to pay legal fees. (Our "indiegogo" goal is $3500, but we're really hoping to hit $5,000. We can do it!) Their lawyer estimates total costs will be in the range of $20,000-$21,000, possibly more. This fundraiser is a good way to show that we care about Source. Look to the left to see exciting perks that you will receive as a contributor. 
Whitney and Blake will continue to spend their own money on lawyers as long as it takes to defend this precious community resource. Many of us have received powerful healing at Source. Let's say thank you. Your energy and your participation does matter. Please put your name up there TODAY!










Get more info about Source's zoning experience here: http://www.blackmountainnc.org




Spread the word, friends
Here is how you can help (please try to do all of these):



Donate. Look to the left and pick a perk. You will have to get a (free) indiegogo account. Thank you for going to that trouble. Thank you for donating. (Note that if you want to contribute a different amount, or if you don't want the perk, just specify that - it's all possible.)

Comment. There is a "comments" tab above. After you donate, please click on there and say something nice about Whitney and Blake, or what Source for Wellbeing has done in your life. Your comments will help the energy of our campaign in many ways, not the least of which is making it more visible to search engines, and bumping us up in the Indiegogo hierarchy.

Facebook. Yep, when you donate, it will ask you if you want to Facebook about donating. YES you do! Say something like, "I just donated to Whitney and Blake's fundraiser and here's why you should too..." It will help!

Join our Facebook group. Yeah!
Join Friends of Source for Well-Being on Facebook here



If you absolutely can't understand indiegogo, and you want to just send a check to Source, you can do that. We will make sure that your contribution is recorded in the campaign.
___________________________________________________________
More about our PERKS:


If you would like to help by donating a perk for this campaign (something that you can give in a multiple of 4+), please email cinnamon.kennedy@gmail.com. We appreciate the help.

story:
Short Summary

International Humanitarian Hope Society (IHHS) has teamed up with the Cure Foundation to raise funds in order to build safe houses for children who have been rescued from sex trafficking. These are little children, ranging in age from only 3-8 years old, who are physically and emotionally scared from not only the inhumane acts that are done to them but by their mothers prostituting their own children in order to make money. IHHS is a non-profit organization who has a mandate to help orphanages and homes for children in poor countries throughout the world. IHHS first began in 1999, under the vision of Evelyn Picklyk, and today her organization works with orphanages in five countries. IHHS maintains a very low overhead with no one receiving wages and all volunteers pay their own way.

What We Need & What You Get

Each safe home that is built requires $22,000. The money is used for three main costs: building the safe house, providing funding for both a "house" mother and a "house" father; as well as, funding living costs for 6-8 children to remain in that safe home environment until they have finished their schooling. We believe that providing long term support is a critical component to the healing of these children.  Providing support and aid for a year or two does not offer these children what they desperately need - love and security

You will receive a tax receipt from IHHS for your donation. Moreover, when you donate, you also receive the satisfaction of knowing that you have made a real difference. Let's not settle for building just one safe house. Let's work together and create a safe community for these children to grow up feeling secure and feeling loved.  As well, we have some unique perks available for you when you donate specific amounts of money.

The Impact

Let's build a community of safe homes that allows these helpless victims to heal. We believe that healing can occur when you nurture and cherish them. We need to feed their soul. We need to feed their bodies. We need to provide them with education to break this cycle.

Other Ways You Can Help

Post, tweet, Myspace, email, text.

Prayer.

Just get the word out and this link to others.

You can continue supporting this and other causes at www.humanitarianhope.com

story:
Family Reunion in Ethiopia

I am a friend of Michele's who has been following along with her and Maia's adventures on Facebook.  Many of us are excited for their upcoming family reunion in Ethiopia.  I thought we could make this trip a little financially easier on Michele.  This is just one way we want to remind her that she's not in this alone and has lots of loving supporters here for her.

If you are able to and are so inspired, please consider a small donation!  Any funds raised will pay off airfare, travel expenses and generally facilitate a reunion of Maia with her biological grandmother and sister in the country of her birth. If we exceed our fundraising goal of $1000, extra monies will go to the nannies who cared for Maia at Layla House-- they are starting a cafe business after having lost their jobs.  Michele and Maia also sponsor a young Ethiopian girl and extra funds would go toward her schooling as well. 

The Beginning of the Reunion Story

As you may know, Maia's sister, Bezawit, was adopted at age four by a family in the Netherlands.  As she learned to speak Dutch, she began to tell her parents about a little sister she had in Ethiopia.  With careful consideration, her parents sought out more information and were able to find Bezawit's little sister, Maia, living with her mom, Michele, here in Ann Arbor.  Having had no knowledge of Maia's Ethiopian family's existence, Michele and Maia learned that Maia's birth mother had died from a hemorrhage when Maia was a newborn infant.  Her grandmother worked nights at a factory to try to support Maia and her sister.  She came to the realization that she could not provide for their safety and well being in the way she knew they needed.  Maia lived at Layla House and Bezawit at another orphanage until they were adopted into their families.  They were reunited this past Spring in Chicago.  Maia fell instantly in love with her big sister and Bezawit reclaimed the sister she had held as a very young girl.  This trip to Ethiopia will allow for Maia and her grandmother and sister to be reunited, surrounded in love by their expanded international family.

story:
Summary

MyMenu delivers community-curated, allergy-free menus to diners with food allergies or sensitivities. Because we believe dining out should be safe, easy and enjoyable for everyone, MyMenu will allow users to instantly create a personalized menu based on their dietary restrictions.  Our Company has been fortunate to gain mentorship and resources from the Northwestern Kellogg School of Management.  Currently, our proprietary menu database is over 150 unique restaurants strong with over 8,500 allergy free entrees and is growing every day.  MyMenu’s app-based platform will be available for beta testing by mid-June, with an anticipated launch of August of this year. 

How it works?

Build a custom profile indicating what foods you cannot eat.  From there, you'll be able to search for entrees based on location, cuisine or specific restaurant, and we will tell you what you can safely eat. 

We care!

The team is focused on developing a solution for the 15 million Americans with food allergies and the 105 million Americans with food sensitivities.  Based on our personal experiences, we know there isn’t a good solution and we're dedicated to making dining in restaurants safe, easy and enjoyable for everyone.  Individuals with food allergies and sensitivities should be able to celebrate a friend's birthday at their favorite local restaurant or attend a corporate lunch at a restaurant they've never been to without the anxiety of trying to figure out what they can eat.  Come Join Us by making a donation to MyMenu and help revolutionize the way allergy sufferers eat away from home.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding will help us to complete a user friendly mobile app allowing you to easily determine what is safe for you to eat.  The app will be easy to use and will leverage your personal profile to let you what you can order (gluten free, dairy free, vegan, etc).  Our goal is anxiety-free, hassle-free, fearless dining!

The Impact

Approximately 15 million Americans have a food allergy and 1 in 3 people have a food sensitivity.  These numbers are growing and unfortunately there is not a reason for the increase.  But MyMenu aims to make it easier to dine away from  home with a food allergy.  This app will also help vegans and vegetarians and ultimately life style diners as we expand.  Your donation will enable diners all over America to have a safer dining experience.

We are fortunate to have the expertise of the Northwestern Kellogg School of Management faculty working with us.  Our mentors have helped launch a number of start-ups and are well versed in the most efficient way to bring a product to market.  With your support and their continued guidance, we will build a product that will make dining away from home safe, easy and enjoyable for all!  We need your help to put it in the hands of the people who need it most.

story:
Who We Are

On Nursing Excellence, Inc. (ONE) a 501(c)3 non-profit organization was founded in 2009 to expand the effectiveness, efficiency, well being and recognition of the healthcare workforce. ONE is the umbrella organization for the Institute for Staffing Excellence and Innovation, providing information to assist organizations in achieving excellence in staffing and realizing the quality, safety, financial, operational and cultural outcomes that result when excellence is achieved. This organization is led by a group of mission-driven nurse leaders who volunteer their time to promote and further the work of nursing.  Our Board includes: Rhonda Anderson, RN, DNSc, FAAN, FACHE (Chairperson), Karlene Kerfoot, PhD, RN, NEA-BC, FAAN (Vice-Chairperson), Karen K. Kirby, RN, MSN, NEA-BC, FACHE (Treasurer), Suellyn Ellerbe RN, MN, NEA-BC (Secretary), Carol Ann Cavouras, MS, RN, CNAA, Donna Nickitas, PhD, RN, NEA-BC, CNE, FAAN and Ann Van Slyck, RN, MSN, CNAA, FAAN. 

Our Goal

As a non-profit organization, we are dependent upon generous support from both corporate sponsorship and individual donations to further our work. Each year we raise funds to support the operational costs of the organization and bring large projects to the nursing community in support of our mission to generate innovations in the nursing workforce.  Our 2014 goal is to raise $100,000 in sponsorships and donations from both corporations and individuals toward project support. 

Project Support

Among the projects for 2014 are two large initiatives that your generous contribution will directly support.

Excellence and Evidence in Staffing  - Learn more about this project here.  The Institute for Staffing Excellence and Innovation is preparing the second edition of its 2008 White Paper, Excellence and Evidence in Staffing: Essential Links to Staffing Strategies, Design & Solutions for release in 2014.  The original 2008 White Paper was the result of a collaboration between The American Nurses Credentialing Center™ (ANCC), Sigma Theta Tau International™ (STTI) Honor Society of Nursing, Concerro, Inc. and healthcare leaders from clinical, academic, policy and research who contributed to this work that resulted in a definition of excellence, an evidence-based model for staffing, and 10 Best Practices.   The Institute for Staffing Excellence and Innovation has engaged nursing and healthcare leaders across a broad spectrum of organizations, settings and professions to assist in updating and disseminating the 2008 White Paper, Excellence and Evidence in Staffing. 

NURSES film - Learn more about the film here.  In 2013, ONE released the feature film documentary NURSES, If Florence Could See Us Now. We continue to see NURSES grow in popularity, adopted into educational settings for nursing schools, new graduate orientation, and recruitment efforts, and more. We continue to work hard on the expansion of this inspirational project through video shorts - our program called Stories Worth Sharing -  as we believe it is vital that nurses everywhere are reminded of the amazing work that they do every single day. After seeing the film, a student nurse shared, "As a student nurse, we do not know exactly what it is like to work as a real nurse. Watching this movie made me excited to graduate and start my life long career." An RN’s husband remarked, “I’ve lived with my wife who has been a nurse for 20 years and never appreciated or understood what she did every day as a matter of course until I saw this film.  I cried knowing that I had been living with a real life hero all these years who was so silent about all the miracles she had been apart of.”  See the film trailer below! 

The Impact

Our work aims to impact nurses, other healthcare providers, healthcare leaders in service, academia and research as well as healthcare professional membership organizations, healthcare technology, insurance companies, and policy makers. The world of healthcare is in a time of tremendous change. We are striving for a future where policy makers and healthcare leaders are making well informed decisions, where the public has a better understanding of nurses, where nurses are inspired towards excellence and diversity of roles, and where others are inspired to join the profession of nursing. 

Your Generous Support 

Our goal is to raise $10,000 in online/individual contributions towards our overall goal of  $100,000 for our 2014 year. We are excited to partner with Indiegogo with this campaign to achieve this part of our fundraising goal.   Direct Sponsorship is available for specific projects as well. To learn more about Corporate Sponsorship, please contact our Managing Director - sara@onnursingexcellence.com. All donations are tax deductible.
