story:
Short Summary

Hello there, 

We are Hitesh and Catalina who love to travel and everything related to it. We traveled across India and realized that there are not enough places/centers/hubs that cater to a traveler's need: their need to be heard; to share their stories & experiences; to sit, relax, read, and eat when they are on the road. The café will also promote the native culture of India and encourage travelers to promote their own cultures. We are going to open this travel café in the heart of the mountains, in Rishikesh, Uttarakhand which is surrounded by the mountains and the river Ganga. 

This campaign is an effort to raise just enough money to set up the café. Your small contributions will help us making this dream a reality because we believe that a travel café is the need of all the travelers. We make an appeal to all our friends, followers, and the like-minded people to help us raise this amount and walk with us in this journey to the new beginning. 

Our Story

Hey! I am Hitesh Bhatt. Last year in July, I quit my job to travel across India as a budget traveler. I traveled from North to South and learned more than I did from any classroom or an office cubicle.
(read here about my journeys: 

Fb Page: https://www.facebook.com/projectgonative/?fref=ts

WordPress Blog: http://www.thosethreedots.wordpress.com )

When the Solo became Duo

I met another traveler from Europe, we traveled together to seven Indian states. Our endless conversations with each other about people, places, journeys, and life in general made us fall for each other and our love for mountains made us go to her favorite place in India: Rishikesh in Uttarakhand. 
Having the mutual desire of traveling in a native way, understanding and going deep into the culture of a place, we ended up having an idea of setting up a place which will be more than a café. It will be a hub for travelers, a platform for people to showcase their talents, a support for young people to explore the native India, a junction for foodies to satiate their hunger and believe us it will be a paradise for the book lovers.  


The Most Important: Money! 
We need USD 4410 to set up the café. 
This money will be used to pay the deposit and the rent of the café,  renovate the café, to change its interior according to our concept of a travel café. We need the money to buy the kitchen utensils, music system, decoration materials, and hire the staff. 
Below is the break-up of the cost:
1. Renovation (includes the purchase of materials for the interiors, decorations and the kitchen): USD 2,205
2. Deposit & Rent: USD 1,765
3. Miscellaneous (includes the staff hiring and small purchases): USD 440
And hey! there are exciting rewards for each contribution you make to the campaign. It will be fun to get involved in the whole process of creating a new concept and seeing the progress from the beginning. We will keep you updated about the happenings in the café and send you a lot of perks! 

Spread the Word! Go Native!

If you are someone who loves traveling and things related to it but cannot contribute with money. No problem! Use the power of internet and share our campaign with as many people as possible. You never know who can help, the best thing is to ask.  

Friends are Amazing

We thank Gaurav (singh.gaurav001@gmail.com) to help us design this campaign and being the friend in need. 

We can't thank Kamlesh and his team enough (https://www.facebook.com/UncapedHeroes/?fref=ts) for designing the logo for us.
This campaign wouldn't have been possible without the help of many people throughout our travels who motivated us, inspired us, and believed in us. 
We use this platform to thank all the known and unknown people of this country to bring us at this stage. 

Social Media Links 

Fb Page: https://www.facebook.com/projectgonative/?fref=ts

WordPress Blog: http://www.thosethreedots.wordpress.com 

Twitter: @hiteshbhatt23

Account Information

In case you have difficulty contributing the amount through the campaign, use this account information to transfer the funds directly to the bank account. Don't forget to write your name while transferring the money. 

Account No: 32458264499

Name: Hitesh Bhatt

Bank: State Bank of India

Branch: Kaggdaspura, Bangalore

IFSC Code: SBIN0011290


Read More, if You Want to...

Why a Travel Café?

Our café is not only a café but an activity and change making center. In today's time, when travel is treated as a holiday package of 3 nights/4 days, we will be promoting travel as a way of life, as a method of learning. 
Through this café, we have plans to encourage and sponsor young people to travel and learn from life. We will be a voice to the unheard talent which can be a hidden poet, a musician, a painter and so on. 
We believe, it is important for people to learn about their own culture, their natives, tribes, and rural lifestyles. Our café will be a place for people to indulge themselves in the literature and first-account of travelers to educate themselves.
story_txt:
Short Summary
 Hello there, 
We are Hitesh and Catalina who love to travel and everything related to it. We traveled across India and realized that there are not enough places/centers/hubs that cater to a traveler's need: their need to be heard; to share their stories & experiences; to sit, relax, read, and eat when they are on the road. The café will also promote the native culture of India and encourage travelers to promote their own cultures. We are going to open this travel café in the heart of the mountains, in Rishikesh, Uttarakhand which is surrounded by the mountains and the river Ganga. This campaign is an effort to raise just enough money to set up the café. Your small contributions will help us making this dream a reality because we believe that a travel café is the need of all the travelers. We make an appeal to all our friends, followers, and the like-minded people to help us raise this amount and walk with us in this journey to the new beginning.    
Our Story

Hey! I am Hitesh Bhatt. Last year in July, I quit my job to travel across India as a budget traveler. I traveled from North to South and learned more than I did from any classroom or an office cubicle. (read here about my journeys: Fb Page: https://www.facebook.com/projectgonative/?fref=ts
WordPress Blog: http://www.thosethreedots.wordpress.com )





When the Solo became Duo
I met another traveler from Europe, we traveled together to seven Indian states. Our endless conversations with each other about people, places, journeys, and life in general made us fall for each other and our love for mountains made us go to her favorite place in India: Rishikesh in Uttarakhand. Having the mutual desire of traveling in a native way, understanding and going deep into the culture of a place, we ended up having an idea of setting up a place which will be more than a café. It will be a hub for travelers, a platform for people to showcase their talents, a support for young people to explore the native India, a junction for foodies to satiate their hunger and believe us it will be a paradise for the book lovers.  





The Most Important: Money! 

We need USD 4410 to set up the café. 
This money will be used to pay the deposit and the rent of the café,  renovate the café, to change its interior according to our concept of a travel café. We need the money to buy the kitchen utensils, music system, decoration materials, and hire the staff. 
Below is the break-up of the cost:
1. Renovation (includes the purchase of materials for the interiors, decorations and the kitchen): USD 2,205
2. Deposit & Rent: USD 1,765


3. Miscellaneous (includes the staff hiring and small purchases): USD 440

And hey! there are exciting rewards for each contribution you make to the campaign. It will be fun to get involved in the whole process of creating a new concept and seeing the progress from the beginning. We will keep you updated about the happenings in the café and send you a lot of perks! 


    Spread the Word! Go Native! If you are someone who loves traveling and things related to it but cannot contribute with money. No problem! Use the power of internet and share our campaign with as many people as possible. You never know who can help, the best thing is to ask.  

Friends are Amazing
We thank Gaurav (singh.gaurav001@gmail.com) to help us design this campaign and being the friend in need. 
We can't thank Kamlesh and his team enough (https://www.facebook.com/UncapedHeroes/?fref=ts) for designing the logo for us.This campaign wouldn't have been possible without the help of many people throughout our travels who motivated us, inspired us, and believed in us. We use this platform to thank all the known and unknown people of this country to bring us at this stage. 

Social Media Links 
Fb Page: https://www.facebook.com/projectgonative/?fref=ts
WordPress Blog: http://www.thosethreedots.wordpress.com 
Twitter: @hiteshbhatt23
Account Information


In case you have difficulty contributing the amount through the campaign, use this account information to transfer the funds directly to the bank account. Don't forget to write your name while transferring the money. 
Account No: 32458264499
Name: Hitesh Bhatt
Bank: State Bank of India
Branch: Kaggdaspura, Bangalore
IFSC Code: SBIN0011290
Read More, if You Want to...

Why a Travel Café?
Our café is not only a café but an activity and change making center. In today's time, when travel is treated as a holiday package of 3 nights/4 days, we will be promoting travel as a way of life, as a method of learning. Through this café, we have plans to encourage and sponsor young people to travel and learn from life. We will be a voice to the unheard talent which can be a hidden poet, a musician, a painter and so on. We believe, it is important for people to learn about their own culture, their natives, tribes, and rural lifestyles. Our café will be a place for people to indulge themselves in the literature and first-account of travelers to educate themselves.

story:
Our campaign was successfully funded, but if you would still like to donate to the Alameda Kitchen, please visit our website. We still need to reach our overall project budget of $300,000!  



The Alameda Kitchen will transform fruits and vegetables that would otherwise be wasted into nutritious, affordable food products and meals for low-income populations.




Food Shift works collaboratively with communities, businesses and governments to develop sustainable solutions that reduce wasted food and hunger. In our quest to solve these challenges we’ve learned that the community needs a kitchen facility to process the abundance of surplus food. A kitchen facility will also allow for the creation of affordable food products that can generate revenue for more food recovery while increasing access to nutrition.  

This leads us to the Alameda Kitchen. The Alameda Kitchen will transform fruits and vegetables that would otherwise be wasted into nutritious, affordable food products and meals for low-income populations. Food Shift will be utilizing the kitchen at Alameda Point Collaborative (APC) - a housing community for formerly homeless individuals and families - and provide job training to their residents.  The revenue generated will help us pay fair wages to these workers and allow us to expand our program to reduce waste and increase access to affordable healthy food.



We have the kitchen, the food, and the people to make this vision a reality. What we need now is your support!


Here's what people are saying! 


"Alameda Kitchen Transforms Places, Produce, People"- Berkeleyside


"An Anti Waste Kitchen Takes Root in Alameda" - East Bay Express


"Food Rescue Group Aims To Start Community Kitchen, Do Much More Than Just Feed Those In Need"- Food Tank


“Food Shift Launching Systemic Approach to Food Recovery with Alameda Kitchen” - Sustainable Brands

"Alameda Kitchen: A New Recipe for Tackling Hunger and Food Waste" - TriplePundit

"Alameda's newest food business transforms wasted produce to new products" - Bay Area Biztalk

"One Kitchen Aims to Upcycle Food Waste and Employ the Poor" -TakePart


"Alameda Kitchen aims to employ, feed homeless" --Inside Bay Area



How It Works

By rescuing surplus food and bringing it into the kitchen we can transform slightly bruised apples into applesauce for seniors, overripe bananas into muffins for school children, or misshapen veggies into an affordable Food Shift soup! 
This is the magic of the Alameda Kitchen.

The Alameda Kitchen will sell food products made from fresh fruits and vegetables from farms, distributors, and grocery stores that don’t meet strict cosmetic standards. In partnership with local chefs, we will design and sell premium products to local businesses, which will allow us to subsidize products at low costs for agencies that serve food insecure populations, including senior centers, after-school programs, and homeless shelters.


                 


In Food Shift’s history, we have recovered 100,000 lbs of food from farms, grocery stores, events, and more. Food Shift received 5,000 pounds of perfectly good food that wouldn’t have made it to the grocery store in September 2015 alone, most of which was donated by our friends at Imperfect. In a 3 month period Food Shift helped keep 45,000 lbs of food out of the waste stream from Andronico's Community Markets. In one day, Food Shift recovered an entire pallet of peaches from an Oakland produce distributor - totaling 1600 lbs! All of this high-quality food is the type of food we will be bringing into the kitchen to process. We’re also in the process of creating new relationships with farms, distributors, and stores who want their food to benefit the community.


Why Jobs? 

Over the past year Food Shift has learned that there are multiple challenges APC residents face, including difficulty accessing food, health issues, financial instability, and isolation.  99% of APC residents have incomes below the poverty line and as a result the majority of residents use the food bank and/or depend on low cost foods. Only 10-15% of the APC population is employed. Many residents feel isolated from the broader community and stuck in their socioeconomic position. 


Food Shift cares deeply about ending the cycle of poverty and hunger and we know that food alone won’t solve hunger.  APC residents want to get back to work, and the kitchen will provide hands-on-experience and support to make it possible.



Perks

If you believe in Food Shift and the Alameda Kitchen vision and want to give for the sake of giving, please do!  To show our gratitude we have some pretty awesome perks lined up for you all, so check them out, show us your love, and please share this campaign with others! 

*Shipping free within United States

  

Our Perks:

  • $10 - Food Shift Stickers: Sport our spiffy Food Shift logo on your laptop, bike, water bottle, or anything else with our awesome stickers! 2 stickers included.

  • $25 - Earth Island Journal: Get a year's subscription to the Earth Island Journal to stay up to date on news, analysis, and commentary on vital environmental issues and activism.

  • $35 - Bi-Rite's Eat Good Food Book: Get the most out of your grocery shopping with this innovative shopper’s guide and cookbook rolled into one. In Eat Good Food, former chef Sam Mogannam, owner of San Francisco’s popular Bi-Rite Market, guides you through the grocery store one department at a time, and explains how to identify incredible ingredients, decipher labels and terms, build a great pantry, and reconnect with the people and places that feed us.

  • $40 - Food Shift Tote Bag: Prevent waste from using paper or plastic bags and show off our Food Shift tote bags - perfect for your next trip to the grocery store, farmers market, or local farm.

  • $50 - Food Shift Tote Bag + Dive DVD: Get a Food Shift tote bag AND a copy of Dive! on DVD! Use our Food Shift tote bag to prevent waste from using paper or plastic bags - perfect for your next trip to the grocery store, farmers market, or local farm. PLUS get a copy of Dive! - a fun documentary about the adventures of dumpster diving and the realities of food waste.

  • $50 - Back to the Roots Tour + Mushroom Kit: Our fellow-Oakland based friends from Back to the Roots are offering a tour of their facility! Learn firsthand how this local startup went from recycling coffee grounds & growing gourmet mushrooms to producing US farmed organic breakfast products. In addition you will receive a mushroom kit so you too can become a mushroom farmer!

  • $50 - Waste Free Kitchen Handbook: Back due to popular demand!!! Want to waste less in your kitchen but don't know where to start? Get a copy of Dana Gunders' "Waste Free Kitchen Handbook" for tons of information and tips to help you waste less and save money. This book is the perfect holiday gift for your friends and family who love being in the kitchen but hate wasting food!

  • $75 - Thrive Market Subscription: Thrive is offering subscriptions to save on products for a full year. Thrive Market is the first socially conscious online store offering the world's best-selling natural and organic products at wholesale prices.

  • $100 - Recover over 3,000 lbs of Food: For every $100 we receive, we are able to recover over 3,000 pounds of food. Your donation will help this food stay out of the landfill, cover transportation to the Alameda Kitchen, and ensure it is stored properly until it can be processed in the kitchen.

  • $100 - Launch Party at APC: Get one exclusive ticket to join us for the official launch of the Alameda Kitchen! You’ll be able to see the kitchen and enjoy wine and menu options made from food that would have gone to waste.

  • $125 - Dinner with the Director: You can join Food Shift Founder & Director Dana Frasz for a special dinner at her home in Oakland, made from food that would have otherwise gone to waste!

  • $125 - 3 Cheeses in 3 Hours Class: Ever wondered how to make cheese at home? Our friends at FARMcurious are offering this amazing class where you can learn how to make three different cheeses in three hours! During the class, you'll enjoy a fun sampling of economical red and white wine in this fast-paced, hands-on workshop. More details here: http://bit.ly/1kwJkin

  • $150 - Video Chat Food Waste Tutorial: Want to reduce the amount of food you waste at home? Get some personal attention from the Food Shift team! We'll schedule a video chat on a date convenient for you to check out your kitchen and give you advice and tips on how to reduce food waste, make your groceries last longer, and save money.

  • $200 - Launch Party at APC for 2: You and a friend can attend the official launch party for the Alameda Kitchen. Join us at the Alameda Point Collaborative to check out the kitchen space and enjoy wine and menu options made from food that would have gone to waste!

  • $200 - Admission to Fancy Foods Show: Get one ticket to Specialty Foods' Winter Fancy Foods Show! The Winter Fancy Food Show is the West Coast’s largest specialty food & beverage trade show, held annually in January. Discover 80,000 on-trend and best-in-class products including confections, cheese, coffee, snacks, spices, ethnic, natural, organic and more. Connect with 1,400 exhibitors representing the latest in specialty foods and beverages from across the U.S. and 35 countries and regions.

  • $250 - Dinner with the Director for 2: You and a friend can join Food Shift Founder & Director Dana Frasz for a special dinner at her home in Oakland, made from food that would have otherwise gone to waste! Dinner will be served for up to 8 guests.

  • $500 - Cooking Class at APC for 5: Itching to see how the kitchen works at APC? You and four friends can join us for an exclusive cooking class in the Alameda Kitchen to learn how to make something delicious from food that would have gone to waste!

  • $700 - 2 Tickets to a Warriors Game: Are you a fan of the Golden State Warriors? Get two box suite tickets to an upcoming Warriors game of your choice! Choose between either 12/28/2015 (against the Sacramento Kings), 1/2/2016 (against the Denver Nuggets), or 1/4/2016 (against the Charlotte Hornets).


Food Shift is an Earth Island Institute sponsored project. We are a non profit 501(c)3 organization, and any donation above $100 is tax deductible.  You can also mail a check to: 

Food Shift

c/o Earth Island Institute
2150 Allston Way #460
Berkeley, CA 94704


Timeline

  • Now - Early 2016: Program planning, fundraising, partnership developing, food product testing and market research with Stanford ACT

  • January 2016 - March 2016: Hire program personnel and work with Stanford ACT to develop revenue model.

  • April 2016: Alameda Kitchen launch!



Show Me the Money!

Funds from our campaign will go towards wages for APC residents, hiring a part-time chef, cooking equipment, food storage, and transportation. 

Raising $30,000 will give us a substantial start! Here’s how your donations will break down:

Food Shift will be raising additional funds over the next year to cover full program costs including administrative and overhead costs.  

Your contribution will help strengthen local food systems by highlighting a holistic solution that exists within every community! 


Food Shift's Previous Work

Food Shift has established itself as a key educator, innovator, and leader within the movement toward a more sustainable use of food. Food Shift has built strong cross-sector relationships, co-hosted a 300 person national conference to discuss solutions to wasted food, and implemented innovative solutions to tackle wasted food and hunger.  We have conducted research, launched campaigns, and designed food recovery, waste tracking, and redistribution programs for schools, grocery stores, technology companies, major events, and county governments.  We have a deep understanding of the challenges, opportunities, and players within the complex ecosystem around food production, food waste, and food access.  


Food Shift’s key accomplishments include:

  • Designed and implemented a food donation program with 13 Oakland schools that redistributed 14,000 pounds of food to students, families, and community agencies. Food Shift is currently developing an implementation guide to expand the program.

  • Launched two public transit ad campaigns in 2013 and 2014 to raise awareness of wasted food and hunger. The ads were seen by millions and 67% of those surveyed said they would be less likely to waste food as a result of seeing the ad.

  • Co-hosted and planned the Zero Food Waste Forum conference and Feeding the 5000 to discuss solutions to wasted food, to spark national collaboration, and to build movement momentum.

  • Set up and managed a food donation and waste tracking program for Andronico’s Community Markets that recovered almost 50,000 pounds of food in 3 months, saved the store $27,000 in reduced waste disposal costs, and increased the reported happiness level of 87% of store staff.

  • Hired by the Santa Clara County to conduct a study on barriers and opportunities surrounding food recovery, and make recommendations for county-wide action to improve food recovery. Food Shift will serve as an adviser to Santa Clara County in the upcoming months to assist them in implementing the suggested steps of action.



Food Recovered from Imperfect - this is the kind of produce we'll be using in the Alameda Kitchen!


The Food Shift Team

Food Shift is a scrappy, organized, passionate, and focused team. We aim to radically shift the system from tossing away good food to using wholesome food to feed people and provide good jobs. Our mission is to develop innovative models that address the structural causes of wasted food and hunger and to develop a more effective and sustainable system for food recovery and redistribution.


Food Shift has 3 full-time paid staff and a core team of 12 volunteers who contribute 5-10 hours/week. Last year, our volunteers contributed over 10,000 hours of work for Food Shift! Our team is dedicated to spending our money wisely and putting every dollar to good use.


       


Dana Frasz, Founder & Director

Dana is a fearless, collaborative, and determined innovator with over a decade of food recovery and entrepreneurship experience. In college Dana launched an award-winning food recovery program while at Sarah Lawrence College in New York. She then spent the next three years working at Ashoka.  Applying her knowledge of social innovation and systems change to the food waste crisis, Food Shift has developed a national network and become a key influencer within the movement. This year, Dana was selected as an honoree for the inaugural Mic50, which recognizes “the next generation of leaders, innovators, and cultural influencers.”


Hanna Morris, Program Coordinator

Hanna has worked as the Program Coordinator at Food Shift for over the past year and has extensive background in zero waste, food waste prevention, and working with at-risk populations. At Food Shift, she helped set up a food recovery and waste tracking program for a local grocery store chain; planned a meal of all recovered and foraged food for attendees at a food waste awareness conference; and produced a report on food recovery for Santa Clara County.


Megan Mubaraki, Outreach and Development Coordinator

Megan joined the Food Shift team in July 2015 as the Outreach and Development Coordinator, and has a background in sociology, agroecology, and food justice at UC Berkeley. Megan recently graduated and completed a thesis on nonprofits in the East Bay Area doing food justice work. During her time as an undergraduate, she enjoyed volunteering with the Student Organic Garden as a facilitator of a weekly urban gardening class.




The Alameda Kitchen Team


Robert Egger

Robert Egger is the Founder and President of the DC Central Kitchen and LA Kitchen, where unemployed men and women learn marketable culinary skills while donated foods is converted into balanced meals. Robert is a passionate changemaker that provides mentorship, guidance, valuable introductions, knowledge about the nonprofit sector, feedback and a never ending dose of enthusiasm and inspiration.


Douglas Biggs

For the past 7 years as Executive Director of Alameda Point Collaborative, Doug has been providing leadership to largest supportive housing program for homeless families in the East Bay. APC serves 500 residents on 34 acres of land and 200 units of housing. Doug is an advocate for affordable and supportive housing on a regional and national basis.


Bill Brownell

Bill is a Board Member at ACT Program Management Board and a Board Chair at SV2. He has extensive experience consulting in business growth strategies, particularly in the technology sector. He is working as the Project Lead in Stanford ACT, a group of Stanford Business School alums that is working with Food Shift in conducting research and developing a revenue model for Alameda Kitchen.


Help us bring this kitchen to life!

At Food Shift we know that food alone won’t solve hunger.   People need opportunity, skills, jobs and support. Join us in launching the Alameda Kitchen to ensure all food is eaten and all people are fed. The Alameda Kitchen is more than just a kitchen - it's a new system that redefines how food and people should be valued in community.



Please share this campaign with friends, family, and co-workers. We've provided some sample text below to make it easy. Feel free to copy/paste from the examples below, or add in a line or two about why you are passionate about this issue and why you believe in our work!


Sample Tweets:

Support #foodrecovery in the East Bay while creating jobs! Check out @Foodshift’s newest project, Alameda Kitchen! http://bit.ly/1JVKto0

Sustainable solution to #foodwaste + creating much-needed jobs? Support & share @Foodshift’s Alameda Kitchen vision: http://bit.ly/1JVKto0


Check out @Foodshift's kitchen 2 provide jobs for formerly homeless. Please support & share! http://bit.ly/1JVKto0


Support @FoodShift in meeting their funding goal to create a kitchen in Alameda to decrease food waste & create jobs! http://bit.ly/1JVKto0


Sample Facebook Post: (please tag @Food Shift when you post on Facebook)  

I’m excited to share an amazing new project @Food Shift is launching - the Alameda Kitchen! The kitchen will transform fruits and vegetables that would otherwise be wasted into nutritious, affordable food products and meals for low-income populations. In addition to decreasing food waste and feeding vulnerable populations, Food Shift will also be using the kitchen at Alameda Point Collaborative to provide job training for formerly homeless individuals and families.

Join me in supporting Food Shift by checking out their crowdfunding campaign for the Alameda Kitchen here: http://igg.me/at/alamedakitchen

Please donate if you can, and share with anyone you know who might be interested! Together, I truly believe we can bring this kitchen to life :)


Sample Email:

Hi [name],

I hope you’re having a great day! I wanted to tell you about a project that Food Shift, a nonprofit in Oakland I support, is launching- the Alameda Kitchen. The Alameda Kitchen will transform fruits and vegetables that would otherwise be wasted into nutritious, affordable food products and meals for low-income populations. Food Shift will be utilizing the kitchen at Alameda Point Collaborative (APC) - a housing community for formerly homeless individuals and families - and provide job training to their residents.

Food Shift has been working hard to raise $30k in 30 days to help launch Alameda Kitchen. Would you be willing to make a donation, and/or share with others who might?

Check out the campaign page here, watch their video, see their great prizes, and please share with anyone you know who might be interested!  

Thank you for your support!

Your name


Thank you for your support!

Discover 80,000 on-trend and best-in-class products including confections, cheese, coffee, snacks, spices, ethnic, natural, organic and more. Connect with 1,400 exhibitors representing the latest in specialty foods and beverages from across the U.S. and 35 countries and regions.
$250 - Dinner with the Director for 2: You and a friend can join Food Shift Founder & Director Dana Frasz for a special dinner at her home in Oakland, made from food that would have otherwise gone to waste! Dinner will be served for up to 8 guests.
$500 - Cooking Class at APC for 5: Itching to see how the kitchen works at APC? You and four friends can join us for an exclusive cooking class in the Alameda Kitchen to learn how to make something delicious from food that would have gone to waste!
$700 - 2 Tickets to a Warriors Game: Are you a fan of the Golden State Warriors? Get two box suite tickets to an upcoming Warriors game of your choice! Choose between either 12/28/2015 (against the Sacramento Kings), 1/2/2016 (against the Denver Nuggets), or 1/4/2016 (against the Charlotte Hornets).




Food Shift is an Earth Island Institute sponsored project. We are a non profit 501(c)3 organization, and any donation above $100 is tax deductible.  You can also mail a check to: 
Food Shift
c/o Earth Island Institute2150 Allston Way #460Berkeley, CA 94704
Timeline



Now - Early 2016: Program planning, fundraising, partnership developing, food product testing and market research with Stanford ACT


January 2016 - March 2016: Hire program personnel and work with Stanford ACT to develop revenue model.


April 2016: Alameda Kitchen launch!










Show Me the Money!

Funds from our campaign will go towards wages for APC residents, hiring a part-time chef, cooking equipment, food storage, and transportation. 
Raising $30,000 will give us a substantial start! Here’s how your donations will break down:



Food Shift will be raising additional funds over the next year to cover full program costs including administrative and overhead costs.  
Your contribution will help strengthen local food systems by highlighting a holistic solution that exists within every community! 



Food Shift's Previous Work

Food Shift has established itself as a key educator, innovator, and leader within the movement toward a more sustainable use of food. Food Shift has built strong cross-sector relationships, co-hosted a 300 person national conference to discuss solutions to wasted food, and implemented innovative solutions to tackle wasted food and hunger.  We have conducted research, launched campaigns, and designed food recovery, waste tracking, and redistribution programs for schools, grocery stores, technology companies, major events, and county governments.  We have a deep understanding of the challenges, opportunities, and players within the complex ecosystem around food production, food waste, and food access.  
Food Shift’s key accomplishments include:

Designed and implemented a food donation program with 13 Oakland schools that redistributed 14,000 pounds of food to students, families, and community agencies. Food Shift is currently developing an implementation guide to expand the program.
Launched two public transit ad campaigns in 2013 and 2014 to raise awareness of wasted food and hunger. The ads were seen by millions and 67% of those surveyed said they would be less likely to waste food as a result of seeing the ad.
Co-hosted and planned the Zero Food Waste Forum conference and Feeding the 5000 to discuss solutions to wasted food, to spark national collaboration, and to build movement momentum.
Set up and managed a food donation and waste tracking program for Andronico’s Community Markets that recovered almost 50,000 pounds of food in 3 months, saved the store $27,000 in reduced waste disposal costs, and increased the reported happiness level of 87% of store staff.
Hired by the Santa Clara County to conduct a study on barriers and opportunities surrounding food recovery, and make recommendations for county-wide action to improve food recovery. Food Shift will serve as an adviser to Santa Clara County in the upcoming months to assist them in implementing the suggested steps of action.





Food Recovered from Imperfect - this is the kind of produce we'll be using in the Alameda Kitchen!

The Food Shift Team

Food Shift is a scrappy, organized, passionate, and focused team. We aim to radically shift the system from tossing away good food to using wholesome food to feed people and provide good jobs. Our mission is to develop innovative models that address the structural causes of wasted food and hunger and to develop a more effective and sustainable system for food recovery and redistribution.
Food Shift has 3 full-time paid staff and a core team of 12 volunteers who contribute 5-10 hours/week. Last year, our volunteers contributed over 10,000 hours of work for Food Shift! Our team is dedicated to spending our money wisely and putting every dollar to good use.



       

Dana Frasz, Founder & Director

Dana is a fearless, collaborative, and determined innovator with over a decade of food recovery and entrepreneurship experience. In college Dana launched an award-winning food recovery program while at Sarah Lawrence College in New York. She then spent the next three years working at Ashoka.  Applying her knowledge of social innovation and systems change to the food waste crisis, Food Shift has developed a national network and become a key influencer within the movement. This year, Dana was selected as an honoree for the inaugural Mic50, which recognizes “the next generation of leaders, innovators, and cultural influencers.” 




Hanna Morris, Program Coordinator

Hanna has worked as the Program Coordinator at Food Shift for over the past year and has extensive background in zero waste, food waste prevention, and working with at-risk populations. At Food Shift, she helped set up a food recovery and waste tracking program for a local grocery store chain; planned a meal of all recovered and foraged food for attendees at a food waste awareness conference; and produced a report on food recovery for Santa Clara County.  
Megan Mubaraki, Outreach and Development Coordinator
Megan joined the Food Shift team in July 2015 as the Outreach and Development Coordinator, and has a background in sociology, agroecology, and food justice at UC Berkeley. Megan recently graduated and completed a thesis on nonprofits in the East Bay Area doing food justice work. During her time as an undergraduate, she enjoyed volunteering with the Student Organic Garden as a facilitator of a weekly urban gardening class.



The Alameda Kitchen Team

Robert Egger
Robert Egger is the Founder and President of the DC Central Kitchen and LA Kitchen, where unemployed men and women learn marketable culinary skills while donated foods is converted into balanced meals. Robert is a passionate changemaker that provides mentorship, guidance, valuable introductions, knowledge about the nonprofit sector, feedback and a never ending dose of enthusiasm and inspiration.

Douglas Biggs
For the past 7 years as Executive Director of Alameda Point Collaborative, Doug has been providing leadership to largest supportive housing program for homeless families in the East Bay. APC serves 500 residents on 34 acres of land and 200 units of housing. Doug is an advocate for affordable and supportive housing on a regional and national basis.
Bill Brownell
Bill is a Board Member at ACT Program Management Board and a Board Chair at SV2. He has extensive experience consulting in business growth strategies, particularly in the technology sector. He is working as the Project Lead in Stanford ACT, a group of Stanford Business School alums that is working with Food Shift in conducting research and developing a revenue model for Alameda Kitchen.
Help us bring this kitchen to life!
At Food Shift we know that food alone won’t solve hunger.   People need opportunity, skills, jobs and support. Join us in launching the Alameda Kitchen to ensure all food is eaten and all people are fed. The Alameda Kitchen is more than just a kitchen - it's a new system that redefines how food and people should be valued in community.





Please share this campaign with friends, family, and co-workers. We've provided some sample text below to make it easy. Feel free to copy/paste from the examples below, or add in a line or two about why you are passionate about this issue and why you believe in our work!



Sample Tweets:
Support #foodrecovery in the East Bay while creating jobs! Check out @Foodshift’s newest project, Alameda Kitchen! http://bit.ly/1JVKto0
Sustainable solution to #foodwaste + creating much-needed jobs? Support & share @Foodshift’s Alameda Kitchen vision: http://bit.ly/1JVKto0
Check out @Foodshift's kitchen 2 provide jobs for formerly homeless. Please support & share! http://bit.ly/1JVKto0
Support @FoodShift in meeting their funding goal to create a kitchen in Alameda to decrease food waste & create jobs! http://bit.ly/1JVKto0
Sample Facebook Post: (please tag @Food Shift when you post on Facebook)  
I’m excited to share an amazing new project @Food Shift is launching - the Alameda Kitchen! The kitchen will transform fruits and vegetables that would otherwise be wasted into nutritious, affordable food products and meals for low-income populations. In addition to decreasing food waste and feeding vulnerable populations, Food Shift will also be using the kitchen at Alameda Point Collaborative to provide job training for formerly homeless individuals and families.
Join me in supporting Food Shift by checking out their crowdfunding campaign for the Alameda Kitchen here: http://igg.me/at/alamedakitchen
Please donate if you can, and share with anyone you know who might be interested! Together, I truly believe we can bring this kitchen to life :)
Sample Email:
Hi [name],
I hope you’re having a great day! I wanted to tell you about a project that Food Shift, a nonprofit in Oakland I support, is launching- the Alameda Kitchen. The Alameda Kitchen will transform fruits and vegetables that would otherwise be wasted into nutritious, affordable food products and meals for low-income populations. Food Shift will be utilizing the kitchen at Alameda Point Collaborative (APC) - a housing community for formerly homeless individuals and families - and provide job training to their residents.
Food Shift has been working hard to raise $30k in 30 days to help launch Alameda Kitchen. Would you be willing to make a donation, and/or share with others who might? 
Check out the campaign page here, watch their video, see their great prizes, and please share with anyone you know who might be interested!  
Thank you for your support! 
Your name


Thank you for your support!

story:
Dear All!

I would like to ask your help in the following situation:

Marta Gogos who lives in Paisley (Scotland), whose son Milan Vass (age 28) has disappeared on 19 August 2015 from Airdrie (Scotland) -  and Scotland Yard has been searched for over 2 months - found dead.

Huge pain on family, on freinds and on those people whom believed finding Milan in health due to the support of social media sites and channels.

Milan's dead body was found on 8 October ... every hope lost.

After issuing his Death Certificate on 16 October, the body transferred from the hospital to the crematory in Paisley. Due to the family's low financial possibility to having a funeral organized in Scotland have been asked to get his ashes in an urn.

The cost of cremation is 2980 GBP which amount will not be paid off due to the above mentioned reason and benefit has  not been awarded at all.

I would hereby kindly ask you to help Marta to get her son's ashes with your generous support.

I appreciate your support.

Thank you!

story:
Our Story

There isn't any place in savannah to buy music. Not even one! Let's change that. Together For Records will start off pretty small with about 300 vinyls but will have plenty of room to grow. While our inventory may be small to start, our knowledge of music is huge, so we'll always be able to recommend something new. We'll also have a regularly updated blog/ website which will have our current inventory, new additions to the store, features on who is coming to Savannah, and much much more! Our stock will include, but be far from limited to


Mumford and Sons


Foals


Tera Melos


Florence and The Machine


Kisses


Bon Iver


Fleet Foxes


Tyler, The Creator


Ra Ra Riot


Breathe Owl Breathe


Maps and Atlases


Of Montreal


Check out our ever growing inventory on our website togetherforrecords.com


The Impact

At the heart of great music cities, is a great record store. We have the knowledge, abilities, passion, and time to make this happen. The only thing we're missing is the funds. And that's where you guys come in! By having a place to buy new releases as they are released, Savannah can stay current on new music throughout the year. By opening a record store, we will have direct connections to the record labels, bands, and managers that schedule tours. With our connection and Savannah showing its interest and support a band by buying their music, they will have a reason to stop here on tour, which means MORE SHOWS IN SAVANNAH!!!


What We Need & What You Get

Need:

We need money for inventory. It costs money to get the actual records shipped here and put into the shop. 

(the more donations we get, the larger our starting inventory, plain and simple)

We need money for a space. While retail prices are relatively inexpensive in Savannah, it still costs money!

(the more donations we get, the bigger, and nicer our shop can be)

We need money for promotional materials, licenses, and fees.

(the smallest portion of our costs, but still important!)


Get:


You get gift cards to the shop! (to be redeemed within one year of opening, online or instore)

(whatever amount you pledge (excluding t-shirt pledges) will be returned to you 100% in the form of a gift card)

You can get a t-shirt!

(what better way to show your support than by wearing our spiffy logo around?!)

You get the satisfaction of knowing you nurtured the music community of Savannah, way to go!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't have a dollar you can contribute, post this to your facebook, twitter, or whatever you've got! Any and all press and buzz we can build up will help us immensely!

story:
The Need

As a pastor (The Shepherd's Fellowship) in the area, I have seen the great work that the Marion Shelter Program does for those in our community. Like many in our area, a new awareness of the financial struggle of this service arose with the recent news of additional cuts being made to make ends meet.

After meeting with some of the leadership of the program, I walked away excited and impressed about the long-term plans that are being laid out to move forward as an agency and meet the financial needs. However, it is on my heart to find an answer to the nagging question that many are thinking at his time, "What can the community come together and do to help during this time?"

So, with this in mind, I have put together this effort to invite you to join us in helping with the immediate needs by donating to this cause where all funds raised will be to the Marion Shelter Program.

What will the money go towards...

While I know all too well that people like you and I like to go to some particular project or vision... the cold, hard fact is this..... the Marion Shelter Program needs cash to prevent further cuts. It's not glamorous but it's reality.

In talking to the leadership, the reserve funds have boiled down to only $2800 after the last few years that have hit everyone so hard. It is my goal, with your help, is to at least double that. Will you be part of that solution?

Other Ways You Can Help

Will you help me get the word out? After you make your donation, will you consider sharing this campaign with others through email, Facebook, Twitter and the like?

Will you talk to your pastor to see if your church will take a special collection and add it into this campaign?

Will you be creative and come up with some ideas to raise some funds at your work place or with others to donate?

The goal is only $2800 but I would love to see our community rally and blow this goal out! What an opportunity to encourage those who serve our community and those in need!

Blessings!

(For those looking for your gift to be tax deductable, it will not be through this campaign. This is simply an effort for good people to do something good for the community. If you would like to donate and get a tax deduction, please contact the Marion Shelter Program direct.)

www.themarionshelter.com
www.theshepherdsfellowship.org

story:
Corporate Social Responsibility

What if you knew that your local grocery store helped support life-saving disease research programs? Or that the money you spend at the coffee shop around the corner went to developing third-world countries? Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) is becoming part of many companies' mission. We believe both big brands and small businesses can contribute to important social causes - while still earning a profit - and inspire social action and philantropy in consumers.


Truismo lets you find more responsible businesses and learn more about how they support nonprofits. Check in, leave tips, share with your friends, and earn points and badges that show the causes YOU care about. And if you already use apps like Foursquare and Facebook Places, you can still earn points and rewards on Truismo!


The Problem

There’s alot of noise out there about corporate responsibility, and sometimes its hard to distinguish all the blogs, PR, and “greenwashing” from actual reality. Most CSR indexes today measure sustainability, employee relations, and environmental impact. There's no common standard rating system, each industry is different, and small businesses are always looked over. Truismo breaks it down and shows you how businesses support nonprofits YOU care about.


The Solution

With Truismo, you can find socially good businesses, check in, leave tips, share with your friends, and best of all -- participate in challenges sponsored by big brands and turn your points into DONATIONS to charities! That's social networking for a good cause.



Truismo will also recommend places based on your interests. Got a passion for animals? You’ll be notified of places around you that support animal rescue and protection nonprofits. The more you check-in and share with your friends, the more points you earn, and you can get AMBASSADOR status -- giving you access to perks like tickets to Truismo-sponsored charity events and happy hours! Check out www.truismo.com to learn about all these great features.


What We Are Asking

We are currently in the design/mockup phase. We will be using the $7000 as startup costs to fund development -- which includes wireframing, design, and technical build. Funding will allow us to complete the prototype and begin work on a full beta release by Dec 2011. About 25% of the funds will also go towards the CSR/market research and data collection needed to build the Truismo database of businesses and their nonprofit partners which will initially populate the app, aka the Truismo Index Project.


Best Ways You Can Help

1. PLEDGE! Even a minimum $5 pledge will push us to the top of the site and increase our backers.

2. SHARE! Tweet us, post us on Facebook, Google+ us, share us with all your friends! It takes only a minute but makes all the difference in the world.

3. COMMENT! This is our first campaign and we could use your feedback, constructive criticism or praise.


Our sincerest thanks, and we look forward to using the power of social media to make a difference in the world together. Check out our website at Truismo.com to answer all your questions about this project!


Jon Sukarangsan

Truismo

story:
Hi everybody,

First thank you for your time to read my  story. Me, my wife and our five children come from Guadeloupe (near Saint Marteen) and we are french. We decided to create our french and caribbean restaurant and tea room in New York to propose fresh and fantastic products made by us (we propose breakfast, brunch, lunch and many varieties of sweet cakes and teas, and each day you have the choice between two dishes of the day : one french and one caribbean) with the confort of a tea room when using free wifi in the same time.

But all my kitchen equipment broke down one after the other (steam tables, kitchen hood, oven, and AC system) and as if that was not enough, a car parked on my basement trap doors and broke them. The next day I had water damage !! ...I fixed most of those problems but need funds  for the works. 

 we thank you in advance for your generosity. You can visit our website to see what we do :lamulatresse-nyc.net

you will also have access to the facebook page.

Sincerely Gerald Huteau.

story:
We're building a new online community for queer people of all kinds.

PURPL will be a place for people identifying as queer, bisexual, trans, intersex, asexual, lesbian or gay (and more!) to make friends and learn. 

Our new website will be a fully-featured social network. PURPL members will have personal profiles and private member-to-member messaging. The heart of our website will be groups and message boards where we can discuss important (and fun!) things relating to our community. These will be things like coming out, dealing with family, relationships, making friends, health, pop culture, fashion...you name it. Of course, friends and allies are welcome to join as well! PURPL will be a resource for people who want to learn more.

Who's Making This And Why?

"I'm Sam Saturday, a bisexual cartoonist and playwright. I first had the idea for something like PURPL last year when I was part of several panel discussions about the comic book "Anything That Loves." I and several other queer cartoonist friends spoke to audiences about our life experiences. It eventually occurred to me that there should be a safe central hub where people can learn about queer issues and meet people like themselves. 

A few months ago I put out a public survey to ask what kinds of features people would want from a site like PURPL. The survey received hundreds and hundreds of responses. Not only did respondents tell me the top features they'd like the site to have, they also wrote about their reasons for wanting a site like PURPL to exist. The most common reason was loneliness. Too many queer people feel alone, as if there's no one out there like themselves. I want PURPL to help fix that!"

How We're Gonna Do It.

We've been planning ideas for PURPL for months. Privacy will be a big part of the site. Members will be able to keep their real names hidden and user names can be changed.

There will be many options for members to define their sexual orientation, gender identification and romantic orientation. We'll have badges so you can quickly define yourself to others. You'll be able to set whether you're looking for friends and/or dating, and you'll be able to block specific users from contacting you.

PURPL will be a free website. However we will have Premium memberships available for either a monthly or annual fee. These paid memberships will mainly be a way for people to show their support for the site so PURPL can keep running, but they will come with some added benefits. Things like an ad-free website, special profile badges, shirts and more.

Special Badges?

Yup. We're designing a whole profile badge system around the concept of magical creatures. We don't want to say too much about it now. Just know it'll be cute!

Technical Stuff...

We've been discussing the site with several web developers and we've got a great one ready to start work! It will take a few months of work before we start the first limited beta test. After that we'll continue to privately add more users while we work out the kinks and ensure that the basic site features work.

What About Perks?

We have several levels of perks available. As a basic supporter you'll get a PURPL membership as soon as the site goes live to the public. If you want to get in on the site even earlier and be a beta tester, that's a perk, too! We're also offering two years of Premium membership for the price of one. Woo! And if you happen to be extra cool you can get a Lifetime Premium membership. Oh yeah, there are shirts too :)

How Will The Money Be Used?

PURPL will be a clean, modern-looking, and mobile-optimized website. This will take time and money to build. We also want to make sure we have enough money reserved to pay for continued improvements, hosting costs, and to fix any issues that may arise once the site goes live to the world.

Thank You!

Thanks so much for checking out this project. Even if you can't donate any money you can still let folks know about PURPL with the hashtag:

#IAMPURPL

Please help spread the word about PURPL and share our campaign. With your help we can make PURPL a super-awesome and magical place for queer people all over the world! Thanks!
story_txt: We're building a new online community for queer people of all kinds.PURPL will be a place for people identifying as queer, bisexual, trans, intersex, asexual, lesbian or gay (and more!) to make friends and learn. Our new website will be a fully-featured social network. PURPL members will have personal profiles and private member-to-member messaging. The heart of our website will be groups and message boards where we can discuss important (and fun!) things relating to our community. These will be things like coming out, dealing with family, relationships, making friends, health, pop culture, fashion...you name it. Of course, friends and allies are welcome to join as well! PURPL will be a resource for people who want to learn more.Who's Making This And Why?"I'm Sam Saturday, a bisexual cartoonist and playwright. I first had the idea for something like PURPL last year when I was part of several panel discussions about the comic book "Anything That Loves." I and several other queer cartoonist friends spoke to audiences about our life experiences. It eventually occurred to me that there should be a safe central hub where people can learn about queer issues and meet people like themselves. A few months ago I put out a public survey to ask what kinds of features people would want from a site like PURPL. The survey received hundreds and hundreds of responses. Not only did respondents tell me the top features they'd like the site to have, they also wrote about their reasons for wanting a site like PURPL to exist. The most common reason was loneliness. Too many queer people feel alone, as if there's no one out there like themselves. I want PURPL to help fix that!"How We're Gonna Do It.We've been planning ideas for PURPL for months. Privacy will be a big part of the site. Members will be able to keep their real names hidden and user names can be changed.There will be many options for members to define their sexual orientation, gender identification and romantic orientation. We'll have badges so you can quickly define yourself to others. You'll be able to set whether you're looking for friends and/or dating, and you'll be able to block specific users from contacting you.PURPL will be a free website. However we will have Premium memberships available for either a monthly or annual fee. These paid memberships will mainly be a way for people to show their support for the site so PURPL can keep running, but they will come with some added benefits. Things like an ad-free website, special profile badges, shirts and more.Special Badges?Yup. We're designing a whole profile badge system around the concept of magical creatures. We don't want to say too much about it now. Just know it'll be cute!Technical Stuff...We've been discussing the site with several web developers and we've got a great one ready to start work! It will take a few months of work before we start the first limited beta test. After that we'll continue to privately add more users while we work out the kinks and ensure that the basic site features work.What About Perks?We have several levels of perks available. As a basic supporter you'll get a PURPL membership as soon as the site goes live to the public. If you want to get in on the site even earlier and be a beta tester, that's a perk, too! We're also offering two years of Premium membership for the price of one. Woo! And if you happen to be extra cool you can get a Lifetime Premium membership. Oh yeah, there are shirts too :)How Will The Money Be Used?PURPL will be a clean, modern-looking, and mobile-optimized website. This will take time and money to build. We also want to make sure we have enough money reserved to pay for continued improvements, hosting costs, and to fix any issues that may arise once the site goes live to the world.Thank You!Thanks so much for checking out this project. Even if you can't donate any money you can still let folks know about PURPL with the hashtag:#IAMPURPLPlease help spread the word about PURPL and share our campaign. With your help we can make PURPL a super-awesome and magical place for queer people all over the world! Thanks!

story:
Down The Rabbit Hole

Down the Rabbit Hole is my one-woman jewellery business, which has just turned 2 years old. I love making and selling cute, kitsch and individual items, and I'm wanting to expand my product range with more bespoke and individual ideas and items, with more handmade and personally designed pieces. To do this, I am wanting to raise money to purchase a small, table top laser cutter, which will allow me to make more acrylic and wooden pieces of my own design, and personalised items!

What We Need & What You Get

A small table-top laser cutter is not as expensive as an industrial cutter, with the one that I have my eye on at £400. I am aiming to raise £500, which will enable me to hit the ground running as I will be able to also purchase materials such as acrylic in multiple colours and specific laser cutter suitable wood, so I will be able to have a massive product range within the first few weeks of purchase!

There are some great perks available for those who donate, starting from just £5 all the way up to £50, with a great choice of pieces available as a selection!

If the goal isn't reached, whatever money we have raised will be put aside safely while I raise the remaining funds myself. All perks would still be honoured, just as soon as the cutter is purchased and work can be completed!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's totally fine - it is a difficult time for everyone, after all! However, it would be fantastic if you could pass this campaign on to your friends and help get the word out!

story:
Tiny House Dating is creating community, social contribution and healthy conversation.We represent the kind of people you want to be in relationship with - people who care about values more than stuff. And we are so close to making this dream a reality.

We have found a website architect who has extensive experience launching, supporting and scaling social platforms. He knows how to stabilize the existing site in the near term (so we can finally offer you the experience you’ve hoped for) and rebuild it later on to meet growing demands. He can start tomorrow.

What We Need & What You Get

$2,500 will cover needed project costs, including:

  • A migration to Amazon Web Service (AWS cloud hosting), stablizing the platform for existing members and setting the site up for future growth. AWS will provide options for scalability, such as easy integration with CDN (content delivery network) for fast delivery of static files including images, CSS files, etc., and easy ways to put in a site into maintenance mode so that even if a server has major issues we can move traffic quickly over to a different server.
  • Rewriting "heavy" code that is bogging down the site, limiting the available number of connections and causing sessions to time out (which leads to server and database errors)
  • Completing this project means that you'll be able to view the site, login, send gifts and messages and/or instant chat without interruption.
  • Plus, we are offering perks to thank you for your contributions!

We're Building the (tiny) Community You've Been Hoping For

Even with the site going up and down since its introduction just two weeks ago, hundreds of members have joined from all over the world. You inspire us! It is enthralling to see who has signed up, read your profiles, and feel that our little contribution might make it that much easier for you to find friends and/or romantic partners.

And, as we're sure you know, it is deeply frustrating to have an inconsistent experience with this website. When the site comes back online for a few minutes at a time and we get another wave of new members, we're encouraged to keep going and give you something better!

Can we fix it, together?

For less than $10 per (current) member, we can re-build Tiny House Dating the right way.

If you can’t contribute financially, will you tell other Tiny House Enthusiasts what we are trying to do? Every little bit of effort will be a big step forward.

P.S.:

For any of you that have had to overcome these kinds of problems while building your own Tiny House (instead of a website), thank you for persevering!

story:
Holmes Mouthwatering Applesauce was created when I was 15 years old after I was given “Reallionaire” by my Godmother. The book told the story of Farrah Gray, a young entrepreneur who made a million dollars at 14 years old through his own food product. His story inspired me to start my own business at such a young age. I then had my grandfather show me how to make applesauce. Next, I took his recipe with his permission and innovated it, by making it all natural, adding cider and fresh pears.


I am currently a third year student at Hiram College, majoring in business management with a minor in entrepreneurship, and a intern for The Cleveland Heights Small Business Development Center. I bring the skills of creativity, persistence, innovation, and organization to my company. Starting the product at such an young age also gave me an upper hand to know what kids, my peers would enjoy. 

               

                                         There are currently two flavors:

                                        Holmes Mouthwatering Cinnamon

                                        

                                      Holmes Mouthwatering Original (Plain)

                                       

              My applesauce sells at $5 for a 16 oz jar & I have made a vow to:              

Donate 10% of the profits annually to an organization fighting childhood obesity.

What Do Kids Think of Holmes Mouthwatering Applesauce!?


"I looked at the market as a 15 year old kid and saw that the majority of the applesauce products in the USA for kids had a bland sugary taste to most of their products. Our mission is to create a product that was made up of every quality the big applesauce companies lack, while still maintaining healthy, local and all natural ingredients.

  Our goals are as following: 

  1. To acquire funding needed for inventory, production, product testing, & label requirements. 
  2. To begin production in The Cleveland Culinary Launch Kitchen
  3. Approach multiple retail stores around Northeast Ohio: Heinens, Earth Fare Market, Zagara's Market, Miles Market, Fresh Market & many more local speciality food stores. 
  4. Remain consistent in promotions, sampling events, food shows and press opportunities.
  5. Continue to grow & secure more markets, food service programs, lunch programs, and many more.
  6. Help convert thousands of adults and adolescents from junk food to high quality, healthy options. 

                     

In the past two months I have competed in - NortheastOhio  Expo 2nd place, Beachwood's Entrovation 3rd place, & I'm pleased to share that we are now finalist in The 43 North Business Competition, a competition with over 9,000 submissions worldwide. 

These competitions have helped us bring in the funds needed to get started in The Cleveland Culinary Launch Kitchen. Which have educated us in the legal manufacturing of food, scaling operations, label requirements, & much more                          

Now we are just $1,500 short of producing our first batch in the kitchen & landing our first specialty food retailer. 

                             

         

                                       (2014) Fresh Water Cleveland E-Magazine 

    http://www.freshwatercleveland.com/innovationnews/holmesapplesauce061214.aspx

                                   

                                                     (2014) Hiram College News

                                               http://news.hiram.edu/?p=10007 

                                      

                                                     (2013) Hiram College Magazine 

                                               

                                                                    Warren Brown, 

                 Founder of "Cake Love" and Host of Food Networks "Sugar Rush"

      (2012) "I love Holmes Mouthwatering Apple Sauce! The first time I tried it I was really impressed. It's not too sweet, has a great texture that's right between chunky and smooth, has just the right amount of spice to keep things interesting. What I really love is that it tastes so fresh! It's like you can count how many apples were cooked down in each jar." 

                                                       

                                                                             (2010)

                      Neighborhood Voice Newspaper: "Young Entrepreneurs Article"

story:
Many of us do not see the horrible things that go on in this world, as we are busy with our own lives and frankly don't care about what is happening around the globe. I want to change this, in the best way we know how. Through talent. We have so many talented musicians, actors, dancers and even magicians. We also have one of the most supportive communities there is, especially with our arts and music. I plan to present, in late August or early September a fully featured two night concert benefit sponsoring both the international charity known as A21, and several local charities such as SeaDoc also, the funding of young musicians who need money to get lessons and instruction. Please contribute to make this happen for our future and our community. All the money raised here will go directly to renting the Orcas Center, hiring stage managers and providing refreshments after the event.

Sasha Hagen-

Organizer

story:
The Fishing Tapper Summary


My name is Rob Busch and I am a business consultant located in Jacksonville, Florida.  My partner Robert Manghir is the owner and inventor of unique fishing product called "The Fishing Tapper."  This patented product is being re-launched on a larger scale and we need your help in funding this venture!
Robert developed this product to address and solve some of the frustrations that anglers have when fishing in heavy top grass or with logs and other debris in the water....you know, those structures that fish love to lurk around. 
The Fishing Tapper  allows the angler to fish with a wide variety of baits, both live and artificial by adjusting the arc of the Leader or the height of the Bobber.  The angler has the option of "Top Water Fishing" i.e.being able to adjust the bait to be slightly "Above Water," and tap the bait down to simulate an insect landing on top of the water.  A simple touch of your line will cause a dipping action onto the water. The Fishing Tapper holds the bait and hook out of the debris and won't tangle. When the fish hit the baited hook end, the Fishing Tapper will turn into a steel Leader that will literally allow you to pull the fish over logs or other debris!  
Check out the video to see this lure in action!!!


What We Need 

We need to raise $100,000 to re-launch this project into the marketplace.  There was an initial launch back in 2012 that was done through Trade Shows and Swap Events.  Though there was some initial success, we knew we needed a broader platform to launch our distribution.   We need to rebuild the website, begin larger production capability and print our marketing & advertising collateral.  We will first establish our distribution regionally and then look to a national marketing campaign via infomercial or one of the cable TV shopping channels.  The more money we raise the faster we can get this product out to the rest of the fishermen across the country to enjoy!  We are developing a full business plan to market this product on a national basis as well as working on multiple retail distribution markets.

Specific allocation for initial funding:

  • Improved Website to handle large traffic, order processing and payments
  • Replenish the current inventory
  • Funds for Producing a KICK BUTT Infomercial
  • Improved Marketing Materials and Packaging
  • Operating Expenses and Travel


What You Get

We will send you 1 Fishing Tapper for your generous donation of $10.  We will send you a Children's Tapper for $15.  For every $25 minimum donation we will send you out a packet of 5 Fishing Tappers!  For $100 and up we will send you a packet of 25 Fishing Tappers!  We want you to be able to enjoy the Fishing Tapper for yourself and to give them out to your friends and family!!!  We are looking for other potential partners or licensees to help us distribute this product across the world!


The Wider Market

We see an immediate opportunity to distribute to many parts of the world where fishing is necessary for daily food and survival.  We already have built in distribution for the Philippines and the Dominican Republic and we will test those markets for first as launch to other parts of the world.

Larger applications are being developed for larger catches such as Alligator Fishing and Ocean Fishing.  We have all seen how the guys on SWAMP PEOPLE catch those alligators in the deep swamp areas of Louisiana.  We plan to introduce these variations to our patented product a little bit down the road.

Kids love the "Triple Tapper" because they are easily entertained by watching the fish strike simultaneously and the fun of catching multiple fish.  And parents...wouldn't you love spending more time fishing and less time untangling lines?  This product is so simple to use you can teach your children quickly on how to use it, and watch them enjoy catching multiple fish at a time!


Risks & Challenges

Unfortunately we have had a few people that were working with us try to steal the design and the products for themselves.  We can assure you that the patent of this design is completely locked down and is 100% owned by the inventor Robert Manghir.  Our attorneys have assured us that they are capable of handling any further attempts to infringe upon any of our intellectual property, including patents, trademarks or copyrights.  With your help, we look forward to be able to "re-launch" this game changing technology successfully into the marketplace!


Other Ways You Can Help

We welcome your help in getting the word out to your friends and followers on social media!  You can use Indiegogo's variety of share tools to spread the word about us!

The music in the video was provided by "Jimmy Parrish and the Ocean Waves Band" from Jacksonville, FL

Risks & Challenges Unfortunately we have had a few people that were working with us try to steal the design and the products for themselves.  We can assure you that the patent of this design is completely locked down and is 100% owned by the inventor Robert Manghir.  Our attorneys have assured us that they are capable of handling any further attempts to infringe upon any of our intellectual property, including patents, trademarks or copyrights.  With your help, we look forward to be able to "re-launch" this game changing technology successfully into the marketplace!
  
Other Ways You Can Help We welcome your help in getting the word out to your friends and followers on social media!  You can use Indiegogo's variety of share tools to spread the word about us!
The music in the video was provided by "Jimmy Parrish and the Ocean Waves Band" from Jacksonville, FL

story:
It has always been my dream to create music that helps people get through the day.  For a while I was cooking up some hype around the local music scene in Omaha, NE -those days were priceless.

Here is a clip of me doing what I love back in 2007




When I met Riki and we fell in love, our son came to us, and he took priority over any and everything, including music.  (Babies are way more rock star than actual rock stars anyways!!!)  I needed a steady job.  Currently I work at a school for traumatized children who require and deserve additional care.  The rewards I receive from working with these kids are immeasurable.  Now I would love to give Mani the unforgettable experience of his youth.

This is my son Manasi (mah-NAH-see) and wife Riki Clawson


The aim of this project is to teach Manasi about the sacred act of giving to those in need while experiencing his family's culture. The money raised on this fundraiser will be used to fund a philanthropic trip to help with an Indian orphanage.

Here are the children of Thanal Orphanage


This is Grandpa and Grandma in India anticipating our arrival and the smiles you will help create through your generosity


In order to be a good husband and father while also expressing myself through music, I am writing, recording, editing, and posting to Youtube one verse worth of hip hop for every day that goes by for one full year. 

You can enjoy the catalogue of videos here




We hope the music will inspire you to help make our dream become a reality.  The combination of your help with our mission will guarantee to brighten many peoples' days and perpetuate the values of love, sharing, and community.

Sincerely,

Nick, Riki, and Manasi
