story:
Summary

Hello! Wesley, Sam, Wade, and Ani here. We are the owners/operators of Excellence House Cleaning & Janitorial. We're all in our early twenties and determined to carve out our own future. We started this company because we wanted to work in an environment where creativity, enthusiasm, and compassion thrived.

Its been a three year long struggle to keep Excellence going and get us where we are. But, now Excellence has a staff of cleaning experts, multiple contracts, and a growing residential client base. However, we're still facing many financial difficulties. To keep it simple; we're meeting our bottom line, but have very little in the event of emergencies. High taxes, vehicle repairs, overdue receivables, etc. can really hurt us. We need a safety net to keep us going in case of disaster.

Your contributions will bring Excellence and its team members a level of security we have rarely had throughout this endeavor. We've faced many challenges along the road and know we're going to face more. With your help Excellence will stay the course.

Use of Funds

We are seeking $2,000 simply to stay in our saving in the event of emergencies. Any additional funding after reaching our goal up to $4,000 also be kept in emergency savings. After $4,000 the funds will be used for marketing to grow our client base and upgrades to improve operations. After $6,000 we will save to move out of our residential headquarters to a commercial office location.
                                 

Perks

Below are pictures of our various promotional items available.

                                   


                     Stickers                                                            Thank You Cards                      

                                  

                                                     Sandstone Coasters

 

                                      Tote Bags                                                    Stress Balls

                                                                     T-Shirts

We are also offering 1 hour park cleanings, as well as house cleanings for contributors in our service area.

                               


The Impact

Excellence is a very small company composed of ambitious young entrepreneurs who just need to reach a comfort zone so we may focus on the bigger picture. With a safety net available we'll be able further devote our time to developing an enthusiastic capable staff, growing our client base, and establishing our presence in our area.

For three years my team and I have dedicated ourselves to mastering the craft of professional cleaning, as well as the nuances of running a business. To be completely honest, we've made many mistakes in the past, and its likely we will make more. But, one thing for sure is that we always learn from our mistakes and always do our best to correct and prevent them. The last three years have been the greatest learning experience of our lives. We are only a matter of steps away from transforming our dream of a self-sustainable enterprise, that values and respects its customers and staff, to a reality. 

Short Term Vision

Right now, Excellence is still combating financial stability when the unexpected occurs. Over the 6 months we will be working towards saving enough to handle the worst case scenario. Additionally, we will focus on building a large enough client base to always supplement the monthly bottom line. Along with increasing our client base we will also have hire and train more staff members.

Long Term Vision

We have a seemingly unlimited supply of ideas for down the road. We've discussed selling household goods to residential customers, creating a storefront to sell premium cleaning products, and even manufacturing our own cleaning products. We would love to explore such ideas later on, but our most definite long term goal is to streamline every aspect of our current operation and open another branch. Since we first created this company we have envisioned a fleet of cleaning crews servicing dozens of customers in multiple cities everyday. We have an incredibly long way to go before that dream will be realized. However, perfecting this branch is the first step.
                                     

Ask Us Anything

Don't hesitate to ask us any questions regarding who we are, our experience, how we run our business, etc. Also, please feel free to suggest any perk ideas you might have. Sid is a fun mascot whom we could do a lot of interesting things with. And, if you just want to tell us the things you want from a professional cleaning service we would love to hear it. 

Spread The Word 

Anything you can contribute will be incredibly helpful, including sharing this campaign. Please use the sharing tools below to spread the word and help make this group follow their dreams.

     

Thank You and Stay Excellent!

Sid is a fun mascot whom we could do a lot of interesting things with. And, if you just want to tell us the things you want from a professional cleaning service we would love to hear it.

Thank You and Stay Excellent!

story:
"On 1.95 million vehicles during the last six years or less 52% of the breakdowns are due to week battery"
-Battery University

"Flat batteries account for approximately 30% of all AA breakdown call outs"
-Automobile Association Developments

"A flat battery is by far the biggest reason breakdown services get called out."
- Breakdown Cover

"A breakdown due to the battery remains the number one cause."
-Battery University

" Top Cause of breakdown faults Flat/faulty battery –20%"
-Which News

" If you've broken down it can be dangerous to stop and it’s always inconvenient."
--Red Cross

"The top cause of car breakdown is dead battery,
the average car will need 2 jump start by year,
the average driver will take 2 hours to fix is car,
if your battery goes dead it lose 50% of its service life."
- Recent Study

How BATTMED Protect You?...

BATTMED will automatically disconnect your battery just before your vehicle drain its last bit of power. BATTMED will ensure you have the necessary power to re start your vehicle.

installing BATTMED will protect you from the number one cause of car breakdown.

Car batteries are really hard to recycle, by extending the service life of your battery you will make considerable saving and reduce your negative impact on the world.


Protect your battery and more ...



Work With Any Vehicle


My Story

During my years as a mechanic,  I have responded to thousand of calls asking me for emergency towing services. In 60% of the cases the cause of breakdown was dead battery, something  that could have been prevented.

its never a good time to be stuck with a dead battery but its always seems like the worse time when it happens. you can be late for a date, an important meeting at work or stuck somewhere in the middle of the night where no body want to stop and help you with a jump start.

My father always told me to prevent the problem before it happens. With this in mind I created the BATTMED. using the latest technology, The BATTMED will monitor your battery level and will prevent your car from draining it until the last drop of power, leaving you enough power to re start.

Until now the technology available in the market was too expensive, hard to install or not reliable enough. The BATTMED is reliable, easy to install, safe and affordable.

With your contribution I will be able to afford the mold, production and inventory cost and allow me to launch the product


Get Your BATTMED Now!

I would like to help you to protect your battery, save money and time. Three of our Perks includes 1 or more BATTMED and Free Shipping.



Ready For Production

After many months of planning, designing and testing, the product is now 100% reliable and safe. 

Source of Quotation

www.breakdowncover.co.uk/faq/top-5-vehicle-breakdown-causes.html
www.theaa.com/breakdown-cover/top-ten-breakdown-causes.html
www.store.selectbenefits.net/AUTOSAVE/Top-Reasons.html
www.which.co.uk/news/2011/08/top-10-reasons-for-car-breakdowns-263068
www.redcross.org.uk/en/What-we-do/Preparing-for-disasters/How-to-prepare-for-emergencies/Car-breakdown

FAQ

-What standard is it made to? CSA? EU?

EU Standart.

-What kind of warranty?

5 years.

-Does it affect radio and other electronic settings in your vehicle when the Battmed disconnects the battery?

When the BATTMED disconnect the battery these devices will not work anymore but you will be able to re start your car and than everything will be back to normal.

-At what voltage does the Battmed become active?

This is our secret sauce but it will cut it at the exact right level, unlike our competitors.

-What happens if your electrical system develops a problem while driving? For example alternator failure alternator belt failure?

Normally you can drive around 30 miles with a broken alternator belt, with the BATTMED you will be able to drive 28 miles and re start your car once you fix the broken belt.

Source of Quotation

www.breakdowncover.co.uk/faq/top-5-vehicle-breakdown-causes.html
www.theaa.com/breakdown-cover/top-ten-breakdown-causes.html
www.store.selectbenefits.net/AUTOSAVE/Top-Reasons.html
www.which.co.uk/news/2011/08/top-10-reasons-for-car-breakdowns-263068
www.redcross.org.uk/en/What-we-do/Preparing-for-disasters/How-to-prepare-for-emergencies/Car-breakdown

story:
Short Summary

Hi,

 I'm Ian. 

Just a regular guy from Down Under Australia. I'm 51 years old and married with four grown children and several grandchildren as well. I've launched my campaign for two reasons. One, I have a genuine desire to help others in their quest of a successful campaign and two, I believe in good karma, so by helping you I believe it will help me to fulfill a life time dream to own my own boat.  Although I've worked hard for the past 30 years things haven't always gone my way and I don't ever see me having enough money to realise my dream of owning a nice boat. That's where my campaign comes into play. I've come up with an idea to help raise those funds and to help others at the same time.

I have noticed when using Indiegogo that it is hard to view a lot of campaigns quickly and easily and that I'm sure there are plenty that go unnoticed. So my idea is to get as many as possible onto the one page, that's where my site comes into play. Please check it out at Million Dollar Boat Page.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I've always dreamed of owning a nice boat. One big enough to take my family out onto the waterways and explore the Queensland Coast and Great Barrier Reef.  Of course, to be able to do that, the boat needs to be quite large and large boats don't come cheap. 
  • Of course I don't expect people to just give me money. That's where my idea takes a small twist. In exchange for helping me realise my lifetime dream I have launched a website. People who take up one of my perks can be a part of that website and that can help them promote their own campaigns here on Indiegogo at the same time.
  • By purchasing a perk you will get to send us your image or logo etc and have it placed into your reserved pixel spot on our website. This spot will then link back to your own campaign. Check out our sample links on the website which point back to this very campaign.
  • Basically you are perking your way into an online presence and being a part of internet history ... your listing will appear on milliondollarboatpage.com for up to 60 days or until your campaign ends. Please note that the web site will remain active after our campaign finishes, so you link will stay active until your own campaign ends.
  • My expectation is that this project will become quite viral and that means much much exposure for those people who see the opportunity and take up on a perk while they last.
  • As we are working with the flexible funding mode, we are notified immediately when a contribution comes through. People who take up a perk will be contacted by email to provide us with their image / logo and link etc ... so as soon as your payment has come through we are notified and we will begin adding the links to our website. The sooner you take up a perk the sooner your listing will become active. We will be sending out emails daily and adding links to the site as soon as the information is provided. Why Wait ? .. Get on board early and capitalize on the traffic that this campaign will generate for our website and for YOUR CAMPAIGN link.
  • We recommend using the same image in your link as appears in your campaign, but we are happy to use another if that suits you too.
  • By purchasing a perk and placing a link on our website we expect that your investment will be returned many many times over by the increased traffic to your own campaign. We expect that with the exposure that this campaign will create that you will benefit from your investment many many many times over. 
  • We re ready and waiting to start fulfilling our perks ... so don't delay .. become a piece of internet history from as little as  $ 1.
  • Check out our perks now and see what we have to offer, and remember there are limited numbers of each perk available.

Risks & Challenges

  • Okay .. we're pretty sure we won't get to the million dollar mark for a while, but hey that's okay, I've waited 51 years so a bit longer won't hurt. What ever is the final figure,  even if we don't ever get to the one million mark, we will still be able to offer and deliver on all the perks that get taken up, regardless of the final campaign figure. Our website is here to stay, so jump on board now and benefit from the extra traffic to your own campaign.
  • As for the website, we do not foresee any real issues. I have already constructed the website to host all of the perks .. it can be seen here at milliondollarboatpage.com. My son Nicholas has also joined me in this venture and he will be my back up IT technical support. Nicholas has studied IT at the Queensland University of Technology and has a wide knowledge base in web site design and coding and between the two of us we will be editing and uploading all of the perks.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • I totally understand that some people just won't be able to contribute or may see that there is simply no advantage for them to do so. That's cool and like I say I understand. Even if you feel that way but still beleive in my idea you can always be a part of it by helping get the word out about my campaign. There are plenty of ways to help spread the word simply by utilising the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks for reading and I hope that you can become a part of my project in one way or another.

Nicholas has studied IT at the Queensland University of Technology and has a wide knowledge base in web site design and coding and between the two of us we will be editing and uploading all of the perks.    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  I totally understand that some people just won't be able to contribute or may see that there is simply no advantage for them to do so. That's cool and like I say I understand. Even if you feel that way but still beleive in my idea you can always be a part of it by helping get the word out about my campaign. There are plenty of ways to help spread the word simply by utilising the Indiegogo share tools!
   Thanks for reading and I hope that you can become a part of my project in one way or another.

story:
The Opportunity

Gelat’ONE is a fantastic investment opportunity which offers a chance to
get in on the ground floor of a new first-class brand in the making. We
are creating an authentic Italian Gelateria and Coffee House experience
to take advantage of the lack of high quality gelato parlours in London
and the UK. We are seeking £550,000 in start-up capital to establish a
showcase location in London and launch a chain of 8 shops in 5 years.
Investors can invest though 2 year 8% Term Financing, or a 20% Equity
stake with a minimum 3 yr commitment. The team projects a 59% ROI in 3 years, 272% ROI in 4 years and 603% in 5 years.

The Team

Gelat’ONE  is the idea of Stefano Brozzoni, Laurence Mahut and Gerardo
Pirola and is an original Italian gelato product and experience made in
the traditional way, with organic ingredients and hand crafting. We are
very passionate about fresh and natural Italian products and we also
have solid business experience behind us.

We believe there is lack of high quality gelato parlours in London (and
in Britain) and there is a serious business opportunity to develop a
quality chain of authentic Italian Gelateria which will not only provide
the highest quality gelato in the world, it will also provide an
authentic and compelling café experience that will bring the customer
right to the heart of Italia.

We also believe that, more than ever, consumers are looking for natural
quality products without added fats and industrial treatments. At the
same time, Italian food and the Italian way of life is recognized as beneficial for
one’s health and one’s soul.

Our Vision

We plan is to establish a UK based chain of gelato shops in the heart of
London.  Our market analysis demonstrates that UK consumers want
low-fat, healthy foods, and our gelato meets this need as it made
without the use of added hydrogenated fats, colorants and preservatives,
emulsifiers and unnatural thickeners  (as routinely  done by 99% of 
the existing ice-cream and gelato makers), whether handmade and
industrial. We intend use local suppliers, who can provide us organic
milk from certified farms, fresh cream and eggs from land-based farms.
In addition to the main draw of delicious gelato, our shops will “bring
the customer” to the café Italia experience and offer coffees including
espresso, cappuccino, latte macchiato made by Italian artisanal
roasters. 

The Market

The UK market is the sixth largest economy in the world with flexible
labour, attractive tax rates a compelling leisure and shopping segment
that goes hand and glove with quality Italian Gelato. The UK ice cream
industry posted 9% value growth in 2012, which was up on 2011 and has
been driven by innovation, heavy advertising and increasing demand from
British consumers. Combine the above trend with high quality Italian
gelato and you have a powerful model for revenue and growth.  

A recent article in The Independent said  “When is an ice cream not an
ice cream? When it's a ‘gelato’! A new fashion for frozen desserts with
lower fat content than traditional ice-cream has become a
multi-million-pound industry in Britain, with new outlets springing up
almost weekly. Over the past two years some 80 have opened across
London.”

This trend is building and Italian fresh handmade low fat ice cream
(gelato) is becoming more and more popular in the UK as consumers
increasingly look for handmade natural products with high nutritional
value as well as great taste. Euromonitor International reports that
Single portion gelato sales recorded one of the fastest retail value
growths of 38% in 2012.

Our Plan

1.   Establish a unique Italian atmosphere where customers can relax and enjoy themselves in the heart of London by this fall.
2.    Provide high quality artisanal Italian ice cream for customers at a reasonable price.
3.    Obtain and maintain a dedicated workforce to provide superior customer service.
4.   Establish and maintain a customer base large enough to sustain year round operations and provide for future growth.
5.   Open gelato shops in central London through organic growth beginning in year two.
6.   Be a recognized first rate chain throughout London within 5 years.

In Summary

We are raising £550,000 of start-up capital in 2014 to launch our
project and open the first shop in 2015 in exchange for a
generous financing rate and high return equity participation.

story:
Hi, my name is Marianna Mills.

I am a Hungarian artist, self-taught, and a single mother of two young children. I am going through a lengthy divorce, which appears to be finally nearing its conclusion. I endured domestic violence in my marriage of fifteen years, until it finally became too painful.  I didn’t even want to mention my divorce here, but it was, and still is, playing quite a large part in my health and financial problems.

 Listing my project on Indiegogo was my son Edward’s idea, to help raise the funds for my preliminary medical testing, and later on for the most appropriate treatment. So, here is my story:

 Last year, as a result of my routine PAP smear test, I was diagnosed with a large Myoma in my uterus.  A myoma is a non-malignant fibroid tumor.  Sadly, I had missed a few smear tests in the past, since moving back toHungary. My ex-husband is British, and we lived in the UK for over eleven years.  That's where my children were born. I went every two years to have a smear test done by the local nurse. Since my daughter was born, and after returning to my native Hungary, I haven't even seen a gynecologist, and I am guessing that's why the fibroids in my uterus were never discovered earlier. 

 Because of the large size of the fibroids (3-3.5" measured in the last ultrasound in January 2013), the doctors booked me for a hysterectomy this past January 21st. They told me that, at my age (I am 43 years old), it's the easiest way to deal with the Myoma. But I don't want to undergo major surgery if other, less invasive, treatments are available in other parts of the world. 

 With a friend's help, I found the Mayo Clinic’s Clinical Trial website, and have been in contact several times with their trial coordinator, who assured me that, if I can travel to the US for testing, they can determine which treatment is most appropriate for me. Then, in a few weeks time, I can participate in the clinical trial itself; which, in addition to benefiting me, will provide research data to help other women choose the best available treatment to reduce or remove their myomas.

 At this time, I earn my living with my art, but make only enough to put food on the table for my two kids and me, and to pay our utility bills.  My ex-husband has not contributed his required child support, and my family’s resources are very limited. To date, I have not been able to put any money aside for my travel to the US for the preliminary testing or for the actual surgery.

What is upsetting me the most is knowing I have potential to sell my art, but because people can not easily find my artwork on the Internet, I need to ask for help from generous people on Indiegogo to finance my health project.

 I need at least $8,000USD for the testing, the travel cost to the US, lodging, food and expenses, and to pay my utility bills at home while I am away.  I will also need to take time off from working.

 I can not raise so much money by myself at the moment. If I can do it here on Indiegogo, it will be amazing to know that I can be myoma free, can look after my children without pain or thoughts that there is something growing inside me.

 So, if people decide to help with my health project, I want to give something back to each of them. You are more than welcome to contribute without claiming your perk.  But it would make me feel better if you do, as I don’t want to just get something without giving something back.

 If I can not reach my goal, the funds will be put aside until I have the remaining money to finance my project. If, God willing, I exceed my goal, I will put that money towards to my next project, the actual treatment.

 What you need to realize, is that this fund will not only help me and my kids, who rely on me; but it will also help other women in the world, because I will be participating in the clinical trial, which is designed to determine which is the best type of treatment for each particular woman. So, every contribution will help.

 I will try to take pictures, and will write on my social media sites daily, about my journey and experiences with this project, in order to keep you informed. If it’s possible, I hope to meet some of the people who support my project and would like to claim their perks in person while I will be in the US; especially those who will receive my higher value paintings. I certainly wouldn’t mind taking them with me on my journey. But, we can arrange that later through email or by a Skype call.

 I understand that not everyone is in a position to donate money. Even if you cannot contribute financially, you can still help support my cause by passing my message on to your friends and family. Sharing this campaign, or even just my website link on Facebook, Twitter, or your blog has a bigger impact than you know! 

Weather or not you contribute to my campaign, please take a moment to share it with your social media contacts, or pass it on to someone you know that is passionate about art!  You will earn my eternal gratitude.

story:
ABOUT THE PRODUCT AND PERKS

The Appreciation Board™ will be a 9x12 magnetic whiteboard with a 1 inch frame. The frame will come in white, black and dark cherry to start. More colors may be added later depending on demand. It will ship with a magnetic marker pen and hardware to hang on a wall or a metal surface like a refrigerator.

We have spent many months toiling over the details and have finally selected a manufacturer who is lined up and ready to start making them for us; we now just need the capital to fund the project. $3,000 is the minimum we need to raise in order to place a product order. Any additional raised beyond $3,000 will be used to help promote and expand the business in the following ways: upcoming trade shows in Seattle in January ($2,000), San Francisco in February ($3,500) and Portland in April ($800). We will also need to fund marketing efforts and possible travel expenses to meet with buyers.

Here are samples of the standard Appreciation Board™ that will be produced and offered for the $25+ rewards. This is the product that will eventually be distributed to stores and sold retail. YOU ARE GETTING IT FIRST BY CONTRIBUTING TO THIS PROJECT! (PLEASE NOTE, THESE ARE DIFFERENT THAN THE CUSTOM FRAMES LISTED FURTHER DOWN BELOW.)

 Standard Appreciation Board™ in Dark Cherry

 

 

Standard Appreciation Board™ in White

 

Standard Appreciation Board™ in Black

 

We will also be offering custom designed boards for our $100+ reward. Here is an example of what a custom Appreciation Board™ could look like:

For custom designs, you will have your choice of the following 3 frame types and 7 fabrics. Once funded, we will contact you for your preference and Liz will hand make your custom design for you. Custom boards will also have the added benefit of being able to replace the whiteboard insert when needed, similar to replacing a picture in a picture frame. We will ship them with one replacement insert and further replacements will be available from us. (Whiteboards will usually last up to 6 months before any ghosting appears, depending on use.)

PLEASE NOTE: THE BELOW FRAMES ARE AVAILABLE FOR CUSTOM DESIGNS ONLY, NOT THE STANDARD BOARDS.

Custom Frame Choice A

 

Custom Frame Choice B

 

Custom Frame Choice C

 

Here are the design fabric choices:

 

All Appreciation Boards will come with a magnetic marker and accessory kit for hanging on a wall or metal surface such as a refrigerator.

 

How It All Began... (as told by Liz)

Sometime in early 2012 I was having a very bad week - feeling taken advantage of, unrecognized for the things I did for my family and basically just unappreciated. So, I went on strike. Typically Jeff was able to tell when this internal shift would start to happen, and would pull me out of it with an encouraging word, a warm and sincere hug or a gracious thank you. But this time he was just too busy with work and an upcoming business trip, so he too was emotionally drained himself.

After he left, we talked about it and he gave me some very warm words that made my heart smile. The next day I was back to my old self - humming, cleaning and just seeing everything more positively. Then I stopped suddenly and wondered, "Where did I get all this energy from?!" Just the day before I was lounging in my PJs all day... Then it occurred to me: it was what Jeff had told me! I understood more clearly the power of words. Then I wondered, "How would our kids feel if we (Jeff and I) made more of an effort to positively recognize them?" so I created an "appreciation board". It took off! Jeff and I wrote to each other; the kids wrote to us; the kids wrote to one another, it was amazing! But, the biggest amazement was how our house began to change. The kids were more patient with each other, they showed more respect to Jeff and I, laughter rang the roof more often and there were more hugs being shared. We saw that we see each other and it felt good.

One day Jeff came bounding out of his office - he had an epiphany. He said, "Liz, we should share this with others!" We thought about how it made us feel (empowered, recognized and seen) when we saw our own name on the board, and we realized how powerful the idea was.  We decided it definitely needed to be shared. So here we are now as Expressive Ideas, LLC hoping to bring the Appreciation Board™ to the world.

With your help we can do it. :-)

Possible Challenges

We have done our due diligence, but there are always risks with any endeavor. Possible challenges will come with manufacturing. While we are working with a reputable manufacturer, there is always the possibility for delays in the process. Assuming a successful campaign, we are expecting the Appreciation Boards to be completed and ready for sale/distribution by the end of February 2013. If there are any hiccups in production, that timeline will be pushed back.

The other possible challenge will be with the custom designed Appreciation Boards. Since they will all be personally hand crafted by Liz, there may be a longer than anticipated wait time for receiving your board. However, we will provide updates on our progress with your Appreciation Board™.

 

Learn more and connect with us!

www.theappreciationboard.com

www.facebook.com/appreciationboard

 

What do kids think about the Appreciation Board™?

http://youtu.be/5xJd2ID5um0

story:
Let me give you some background on the heartache this family has endured. Angela was a loving, kind, 30 year old daughter, wife, mother of 5 and step-mom. Her children range from 9 years old to as little as a 1 month old baby. Angela's mom Bambi Brown is a wonderful woman, who would give anything to someone in need. Bambi is a nurse that has dedicated her life to helping others. Unfortunately, Bambi and Angela have had so much trauma in their lives. Bambi's son died suddenly at 18 years old in November of 1997. Bambi, her husband and Angela were all devestated. The following November of 1998 Bambi's husband died suddenly leaving both Bambi and Angela devestated asking why. In 2003 Bambi lost her mom as well. Bambi and Angela were very close and helped each other overcome so much pain and heartache.

On Monday, July 16th 2012, Angela passed away suddenly in her sleep. Leaving behind, her mother, husband(George Coday) and children all asking why.

We would like to raise money to start college funds for all 5 of Angela's children and hopefully to send the family on a vacation. We hope reading this you will find it in your heart to donate to this family and pass this along to your friends, family and community. It doesn't matter if you donate $1.00 or $1,000.00 every dollar will help this family.

Please keep this family in your thoughts and prayers and we thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

story:
The Karibu Centre is making a difference to the lives of hundreds of disadvantaged children in Kenya.

We want to build a new website and produce a promotional film so that more people can find out about and contribute to the development plans at the Children's centre.

Your support for our project is so important. A decent website seems like such a simple thing but expansion and future funding for the centre would be almost impossible without it. We want to make the site worthy of the incredible place it will be representing which is why we're asking for your help. 

The new website will provide a place for people to find out more information, to donate, to arrange a visit, to connect with similar organisations and to help with expansion projects.

Computer Education for over 500 children 

The centre has partnered with Intel Corporation to pilot a computer program specially designed for children. The centre is fully equipped with mini laptops which the children get to use every day. For children who live in tin houses with no electricity, this is a unique and incredible opportunity. The computer program was so successful at the centre that it has now expanded into the local public schools. The government are very interested in extending the program all across Kenya.

Nutrition & Knowledge
The educational day program provides two nutritious meals and early childhood education for the poorest of children age 2-7 from the nearby slum communities.

Rescuing Vulnerable Mothers and Babies
The abandoned baby centre provides rescue care for starving, neglected, and medically fragile babies - including HIV positive infants. The babies are loved and nurtured until they can be resettled back into their birth families or placed with a family for adoption.

The pregnancy support centre is a residential program supporting teenage girls who do not have family support during their pregnancies. Many of these girls have been thrown out of school or sent away from their families as a result of their pregnancy. 

All of this amazing work and hardly anybody has heard of The Karibu Centre. We want this to change. We want to provide a new website to help them achieve the development, funding and expansion they so deserve.

We need to raise $4000 (£2,500) to cover the costs of the web design and film editing.
 

All you Brits donating out there-I know the site requires you to pay in dollars but please don't let that stop you donating. Here is a rough guide using the current exchange rate.

$25-£15

$50-£30

$100-£62

$500-£307

 

 If you don't have any spare cash to give, don't worry you can still help.
  1. You can like our facebook page https://www.facebook.com/karibucentre.
  2. Better still you can share this page with people who you think might be interested and able to help us so please do use the links and share away.
  3. You can donate clothing and books to the centre-get in touch at info@orphansoverseas.org to find out more.

 

                      Thank you so much for your support

story:
About Us

We are the Church for the Unchurched and we are committed and dedicated to reaching the lost, the forgotten, the abandoned and the abused. We want to show our community, our nation and our world that everyone belongs and everyone deserves to feel and experience the love of Jesus Christ.

How You Can Help


We are actively raising funds to purchase this building in cash. Your contribution will not only help our church grow, you will also be helping us help others in the Galveston County area. We plan to use this building not only to have our weekly worship experience, we also have a wide variety of classes to help create better individuals such as Celebrate Recovery, which helps people overcome various addictions, to Wednesday Night Life which is designed to help people look in the mirror and see who God truly wants us to be, along with a long list of other classes including business and finance classes.

story: Thank you all for your kind help!
story_txt: Thank you all for your kind help!

story:
Help us meet our stretch goals!

Anything over and above the goal can only benefit this venture further! Let's move some goalposts and see if we can get enough support to help cover some of these additional anticipated costs:

  1. We have enough for ten ISBNs at the $250 price point. But, we could also purchase 100 ISBNs for $575! Here's a link to the pricing, in case you're wondering where that number comes from: https://www.myidentifiers.com/isbn/main. 10 ISBNs would cover us for a year; 100 would cover us for a looooooooong time!
  2. Adobe's Creative Suite, which contains everything that I'd need to do some awesome layouts, costs a lot of money. But, as a UW staff member, I can purchase a discounted license for a mere $250. Wow! 
  3. IndieGoGo's fee. It's 4% of what I raise, so any little bit helps cover that fee.
  4. Business training. I plan to take some classes and seminars, which will cost anywhere from $100-$500.
  5. Professional memberships and conference fees. We'll be joining as many small press/publishing organizations as possible, and covering fees, dues and conference registrations will of course cost, as well.
  6. Author advances. Once we start publishing your work, we'll need some funds for advances.
  7. Goodies and treats. I'd like to make regular give-aways part of our publishing plan!

Yes, all of this is gravy, but the more seed funds we raise, the more we can do, and the more successful we'll ultimately be. Any amount you can contribute will help us meet these goals!

Regardless, I anticipate having my first title available by the end of April!

Thanks so much-- let's KEEP THIS BALL ROLLING!

Let's Start Indie Publishing!

My name is Jeremy Puma, and I write. Now, I'd like to publish.

I've registered as a sole proprietor business owner under the name Strange Animal Publications!

I’ve had some success in the self-publishing and blogging arenas, enough to have a fairly decent readership established, and sales on Amazon in print and Kindle platforms are pretty darned good.

During the process of self-publishing, I discovered that I love the art of putting out books. I enjoy the writing, but also the editing, the interior design, the cover design, etc. It’s all fun! So, why not see if I can supplement the ol’ income ever so slightly (without, of course, quitting the day job) while doing something I enjoy.

So, what will Strange Animal produce? 

Strange Animal Publications will be offering works in multiple platforms– print, electronic (Kindle, etc.) and online. Our catalog will include unique and interesting works in the following categories:

  • Religion/Spirituality/Philosophy – Our focus will primarily be commentary, essays and instructional work, rigorously sourced and informed by current scholarship.
  • Speculative/Science/Weird Fiction - Interesting and unique novels and stories outside of the mainstream.
  • Magirology - Cooking and culinary commentary, including unusual food writing and recipe collections.
  • Reprints in all of the above - We will be scouring the public domain to bring you readable editions of fascinating and long-overlooked works from various sources.

There’s always a market for unique and interesting voices in the genres we’re focusing on. Not only do I plan on writing works in all of the above, I also want to offer other authors the opportunity to have their work produced and published. 

But, there are some drawbacks in moving from ‘just some guy’ to ‘oh shit an actual business.’ The most obvious is capital. To say I have less than a shoestring budget would be an understatement– it would be more accurate to say that my bank account is a big, sucking hole.

And that's why I need your help.

WHAT I NEED:

I'd like to raise $1000. 

  • $250 wil be used to purchase a block of ten ISBNs (from the awful monopoly that sells them).
  • $250 will cover the costs of the business licenses and the website.
  • $300 should get the ball rolling on business-related expenses like insurance and any legal fees I haven't yet anticipated.
  • The remaining $200 will be used for the fees associated with Print-on-Demand publishing, including distribution costs and proof orders.

Obviously, there'll be additional expenses as I go, but this $1000 will get the ball rolling. If I do manage to raise more than the goal, it'll go towards desktop publishing software and the cumulative costs of running a business.

IF I DON'T REACH MY GOAL

Oh, I'm still doing this. It might take a little longer, but Strange Animal Publications will still happen. Before you contribute, please keep in mind that IndieGoGo will award funds even if the goal isn't met, so any little bit will help, and although it may take a little longer if I don't make the $1000, you'll still receive your perk as soon as it happens. Heck, even if I can raise $250, that'll get me those ISBNs.

WHAT YOU GET:

There are a number of donor perks described here, all of which are mighty cool, but you also get Books! Literature! You get the satisfaction of knowing that quality, interesting and unique material will be out there in the world, put out there by a guy who loves books and who loves to write.

THE PLAN:

1. For the next year, work on generating revenue through self-publishing a couple of my own books. I know how to do this, but now I’ll be doing it as an ‘official business,’ instead of  ’a guy with a website.’ I also plan to find some really cool work in the public domain that would benefit from a dusting-off and repackaging in readable format. Add some value (intros, footnotes, etc.) and publish that as well. 

While working on item #1,

2. Learn the ins and outs of basic business skills via books, classes, seminars, etc.

3. Learn the ins and outs of basic publishing skills by doing it.

4. Since, for the first year, I will be the only original author I publish, and the remainder will be work from the public domain (yes I know about the rigors of proper copyright investigation etc.), I won’t have to worry about ruining anyone’s reputation but my own, and my uber-supportive family (shout-out to Emily, the best wife in the universe) will also be safe from risk.

5. Beginning in 2014, when I’ve honed my skills and upgraded my business/publishing acumen, start soliciting work from authors and publishing.

My plan is long-term. If I want this business to succeed, I want to do it right. No rushing, no putting out shoddy material just to get it out there.

That's why a lot of the perks you see for signing up have award dates in 2014-- you'll have to wait for some titles, but you can trust that they'll be quality.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Even if you can't contribute, please help get the word out! We have a website and a Facebook page-- please share with friends, family, pets, interested parties.

Our Website: http://www.strangeanimal.net

On Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/StrangeAnimalPublications

Thanks just for reading, and you rock!

Please join our Phase III campaign which is currently running through October 9, 2012.  So you can still support this amazing and powerful film.

story:
Help 2 soulmates be together!!

Monica and Jeff are in love and separated by a border.  Help us so we can be together again and live happily ever after!

 

The love of my life and my future wife Monica was removed from the U.S. back in 2008 by immigration.  You can see the picture of us above during happier times in 2007.  Due to the nature of her removal and the vagueness of the law written for our situation, the only way she can obtain her Visa to return to the US is to apply for an I-601 waiver.  Its a very difficult and time consuming process as well as very expensive.  We applied once and after an entire year of waiting for our answer we received a letter in the mail that we were denied.  After speaking with my attorney I was told that according to her review of the denial, the consulate made an error in the review of our documentation but to submit for an appeal would take up to several years and that the best way to proceed was to just re-apply.  The process we went through the first time cost me in lawyer fees, immigration fees, travel, etc over $12,000 which was my entire savings.  I spent everything I had because we want to be together so much. 

So since the denial letter, I have been in contact with the US Consulate and we have been given the opportunity to re-apply immediately and I have found a great new immigration attorney who specializes in the waiver for which we are applying and has great success in these particular cases.  I am unable to start with the new application until I raise $4,000 to pay our new attorney to prepare the new paperwork.  This amount is just for the attorney fees.  It does not include the additional amounts that we will ultimately have to pay for filing the applications as well as the cost of travelling and staying in Juarez Mexico during our visit to the US Consulate.

I am hoping there are others out there who have been through what we are going through or just someone who knows what its like to be so in love and be separated from that loved one, and is willing to help out 2 hearts who are so in love with each other and want to be together forever. 

Monica is a sweet, caring and loving person.  She is an aunt to 4 wonderful nephews and 1 niece, she is a school teacher in the town of Hermosillo Mexico and she is a very religious person as well.  Myself, I am American born.  I have run my own business for the last 7 years and due to the tough economic times, I don't have the finances to start the process again.  I am a very giving person, and in fact I have gone overseas into war zones in Iraq and Afghanistan to play music for our troops on several occasions.  I am hoping there are other giving people out there who understand what we are going through and would be willing to help out 2 wonderful people who only want to be together again and love each other so very much.  

Thank You!

story:
Do you or someone you know eat gluten free? Whether it is a medical necessity (like me) or a personl health choice, you know that eating gluten free is not easy, especially when it comes to desserts. But this Indiegogo campagin will change your mind.

Gluten free desserts almost always fall flat when it comes to flavor. People who eat GF know how difficult it is to find tasty desserts. The time has come to stop settling for "okay" and start experiencing incredible tasting "gluten freelicious" desserts.                                                 

                                             

Our desserts sell out daily and not a day goes by that someone doesn't ask us if ANY of our desserts are gluten free (GF). The demand to accommodate our fellow GF customers is fierce, and I have made it my personal mission to help fufill their requests. By 2014, the sales of gluten free food will top 4 billion dollars and you can help us be a part of one of the fastest growing segments in the food industry.

 
Our next project for Southern Fried Country Market is to take our most popular desserts and make them GLUTEN FREE! Can you imagine Apple Crumb Pecan Bread Pudding, Chocolate Ganache Brownies and Almond Joy Macaroons all GLUTEN FREE? It...can...happen! We have run out of room at our Country Market for a dedicated GF kitchen. So, we need to aquire a space. We also need to outfit this space with all the supplies, equipment and ingredients needed to crank out our super delicious treats.
 
 
Apple Crumb Pecan Bread Pudding
 
                                                     
 
                                                      Chocolate Ganache Brownies
 
 
Almond Joy Macaroons
 
 
WHAT WE NEED
 
We have the recipes and we have the chef, now all we need is a little help. This is where you come in...we need your support to make this dream a reality. We need to raise at least $8,995.00 to cover equipment, baking supplies, and ingredients. Here is a breakdown of where your contributions will go:
 
$6000.00 Commercial Equipment (which we will purchase refurbished when available to help keep costs down: oven, freezer, refridgerator, mixer and food processor)
 
$1000.00 Baking Supplies (mixing bowls, spatulas, measuring cups, measuring spoons, baking dishes, sheet pans & liners, cupcake liners, bakery boxes, mixer, etc.)
 
$1000.00 Ingredients (flour, sugar, eggs, chocolate chips, vanilla bean, coconut, etc.)
 
$1000.00 Computer (with Cash Flow and Inventory Management software)
 
 
Your contributions will help us take our business to the next level. More importantly, your contributions will help change people's lives. People who eat gluten free are used to eating so-so tasting food. Let's give them what they deserve--delicious desserts that don't taste gluten free!
 

Want more information about the PERKS offered for our Indiegogo Campaign? Just click the link below.

http://southernfriedinpungo.com/blog/gluten-free-from-the-south-indiegogo-perks/
 
WILL YOU MAKE A DIFFERENCE? You already have! Just clicking on our Indiegogo campaign helps. The more people who click & read, the more "popular" our campaign gets and the closer we get to the front page of Indiegogo.com. If you can't donate, we completely understand. You can still help. Please share this link with your friends...by e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Reddit, etc.
                                                                   

                       Thanks for making our dream come true!

 

Click The Link Below To Visit Our Facebook Page!

http://www.facebook.com/southernfriedinpungo

 

 About Us                                           

Hi Y'all...My name is April Habit. My husband Al and I are owners of Southern Fried Country Market. We are a small mom & pop cafe, bakery and old-fashioned Hershey's ice cream parlor in Virginia Beach, VA. We renovated an old brick building that dates back to 1929 that once held a grocery store & lunch counter. We make delicious sandwiches, homemade soups and tasty desserts. Customers love "our throwback scene with southern cuisine."

 

"Gluten Free From The South" has a brand new Facebook Page! Click the link below and make sure to "like" us while you are there!

 http://www.facebook.com/pages/Gluten-Free-From-The-South/151402738356569

If you would like to learn a little bit more about why I wanted to create an Indiegogo Campagin and start my new company Gluten Free From The South, please click the link below.

http://southernfriedinpungo.com/blog/big-announcement-from-april-of-southern-fried-country-market/click the link below.

The time has come to stop settling for "okay" and start experiencing incredible tasting "gluten freelicious" desserts.                                                 
                                              
Our desserts sell out daily and not a day goes by that someone doesn't ask us if ANY of our desserts are gluten free (GF). The demand to accommodate our fellow GF customers is fierce, and I have made it my personal mission to help fufill their requests. By 2014, the sales of gluten free food will top 4 billion dollars and you can help us be a part of one of the fastest growing segments in the food industry.
 

Our next project for Southern Fried Country Market is to take our most popular desserts and make them GLUTEN FREE! Can you imagine Apple Crumb Pecan Bread Pudding, Chocolate Ganache Brownies and Almond Joy Macaroons all GLUTEN FREE? It...can...happen! We have run out of room at our Country Market for a dedicated GF kitchen. So, we need to aquire a space. We also need to outfit this space with all the supplies, equipment and ingredients needed to crank out our super delicious treats.
 

 
Apple Crumb Pecan Bread Pudding
 
                                                      

 
                                                      Chocolate Ganache Brownies
 

  
Almond Joy Macaroons
 
 
WHAT WE NEED
 
We have the recipes and we have the chef, now all we need is a little help. This is where you come in...we need your support to make this dream a reality. We need to raise at least $8,995.00 to cover equipment, baking supplies, and ingredients. Here is a breakdown of where your contributions will go:
 
$6000.00 Commercial Equipment (which we will purchase refurbished when available to help keep costs down: oven, freezer, refridgerator, mixer and food processor)
 
$1000.00 Baking Supplies (mixing bowls, spatulas, measuring cups, measuring spoons, baking dishes, sheet pans & liners, cupcake liners, bakery boxes, mixer, etc.)
 
$1000.00 Ingredients (flour, sugar, eggs, chocolate chips, vanilla bean, coconut, etc.)
 
$1000.00 Computer (with Cash Flow and Inventory Management software)
 
 
Your contributions will help us take our business to the next level. More importantly, your contributions will help change people's lives. People who eat gluten free are used to eating so-so tasting food. Let's give them what they deserve--delicious desserts that don't taste gluten free!
 
Want more information about the PERKS offered for our Indiegogo Campaign? Just click the link below.
http://southernfriedinpungo.com/blog/gluten-free-from-the-south-indiegogo-perks/
 
WILL YOU MAKE A DIFFERENCE? You already have! Just clicking on our Indiegogo campaign helps. The more people who click & read, the more "popular" our campaign gets and the closer we get to the front page of Indiegogo.com. If you can't donate, we completely understand. You can still help. Please share this link with your friends...by e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Reddit, etc.
                                                                    
                       Thanks for making our dream come true!
 
Click The Link Below To Visit Our Facebook Page!

http://www.facebook.com/southernfriedinpungo
 
 About Us                                            
Hi Y'all...My name is April Habit. My husband Al and I are owners of Southern Fried Country Market. We are a small mom & pop cafe, bakery and old-fashioned Hershey's ice cream parlor in Virginia Beach, VA. We renovated an old brick building that dates back to 1929 that once held a grocery store & lunch counter. We make delicious sandwiches, homemade soups and tasty desserts. Customers love "our throwback scene with southern cuisine."
 
"Gluten Free From The South" has a brand new Facebook Page! Click the link below and make sure to "like" us while you are there!

 http://www.facebook.com/pages/Gluten-Free-From-The-South/151402738356569
If you would like to learn a little bit more about why I wanted to create an Indiegogo Campagin and start my new company Gluten Free From The South, please click the link below.
 http://southernfriedinpungo.com/blog/big-announcement-from-april-of-southern-fried-country-market/click the link below.

story:
Tina's Fund for Domestic Violence Awareness is a 501(c)3 which was founded in 2006.  Our mission is to bring awareness to our community about the effects of domestic violence with an emphasis on educating our children,  We believe that our children are the ones who can break the chain of domestic violence.

Through this campaign we are hoping to raise the monies necessary to build the Memorial Garden.  Contained in the garden will be a black granite monument etched with the names of those victims who have died as a result of domestic violence, two black granite benches, two weeping cherry trees and a section for purple flowers.  We will invite local groups to get involved through all phases of construction.  Local churches have offered their services to not only plant the garden but also to maintain it.

Your contribution will assist us to not only make this project a reality but also to help us bring awareness to our community.  We realize from past events that though you may have your attendees in the "moment" during the event, most will forget your message a week later,  This Memorial Garden will be a living reminder of the devastating effects of domestic violence.

We have asked for $10,000 as that will cover the cost of the monument, benches, cherry trees and flowers.  Your contribution will ensure that future generations will be able to see what an impact domestic violence makes on a community.

This Memorial Garden will be a place to hold annual events to include annual etching of names on the monument followed by a Memorial Service.  State and local dignitaries will be invited as well as the media and the general public.  This Memorial Service will be held during the month of October which is National Domestic Violence Awareness month.  We are also planning a Run/Walk for the following day to make this a weekend event.  These events will allow us to get our message out through the media and also by handing out materials.

This Memorial Garden is a benchmark in New Jersey as there are none like it.  We are hoping that upon our successful completion of this project that we will be able to go into other communities and do the same.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that sme people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can't help.  You can lend an ear or a shoulder to someone who is in a domestic violence situation.  You can speak with your Legislators or School Advisors about bringing education into our schools at the ages of 7-8.  If you are a victim realize that there are people and organizations out there to help you,  Do not carry this burden alone.  Seek help and protect your loved ones from having to sit in a Memorial Garden and remember you,

NOTE:  The Indiegogo tools are there for you to use.

story:
Overview

Cities across the country such as Washington, DC and Philadelphia are making big moves toward gender neutral bathrooms.  And Detroit is next!



Equality Michigan and Connect2Protect - Detroit know that gender neutral bathrooms promote the health and well being of trans* people in our communities.  A 2013 report from the Williams Institute at UCLA showed the following: 

  • 70% of trans* people surveyed had experienced harassment when using gender-segregated bathrooms
  • 18% were denied access to gender-segregated bathrooms
  • 9% had been physically assaulted when using gender-segregated bathrooms


This needs to end.   We are working to help local businesses in Detroit upgrade their bathroom signage and expand the number of safe spaces for trans* people in the city.

We are targeting businesses with single stall, gender-segregated restrooms and will be offering business owners the opportunity to upgrade to gender neutral restroom signs at no charge to them.  We have a number of designs available already, but will also allow business owners the opportunity to custom design gender-neutral signs as an incentive for them to participate.

That's where you come in.

What We Need 

We'll take care of reaching out to businesses and installing the signs.  But first we need to purchase them.   We're hoping to upgrade the signage at 10 businesses in neighborhoods across Detroit, and we'll need a sign or two for each business that participates.

A big step in the right direction is to move from gender segregated bathrooms to ones that are unisex or gender neutral.  The average cost for these signs is $10.

However, the ideal bathroom signage is gender irrelevant! For businesses that are willing we intend to create customized signs that move beyond gender and simply focus on function.  These signs cost a bit more with an average price of $40.

100% of contributions will go toward the purchase of signs.  If we raise more than what we need to upgrade our initial goal of ten local businesses, then we'll set out to upgrade ten more!  

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We know that gender neutral bathrooms are important to many people in our community regardless of whether now is a good time for you to make a donation.

    If you know of a business in the City of Detroit with single stall, gender-segregated restrooms that you'd like to see upgraded, then tell us about them!

    E-mail the name of the business and address to Leah Taraskiewicz at leah@equalitymi.org.

story:
Short Summary

Shara Bagby was 22 years old when she died in a fatal and tragic car crash on April 16, 2014. To remember her on her 23rd birthday (January 1st), her family would like to erect a sign in her memory at the site of her crash, reminding other drivers to drive safely. To keep others from suffering this tragic fate, her family wants to begin saving money and petitioning the state to put a fence up around the cemetery where the crash occurred. There are many different styles of headstones in this area and it is the largest cemetery in the city of Petersburg, making it a roadside hazard, as proved with this exact fatality.

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign is almost a test-run to see if we can make it to a full-blown fence for Rose Hill Cemetery. As we save money, we are talking to the Illinois Department of Transportation, the city council in Petersburg, Illinois, and the owners of Rose Hill Cemetery to see how a fence could be erected to protect others from this kind of fatality.

  • This is not going to be cheap, if the fence becomes a clear possibility. Quotes from companies such as Ameristar Fencing have been only as cheap as $160,200. The minimum $500 is to build a memorial sign and to kick start the fence fund.
  • You don't have to be anonymous! If you knew Shara and you want everyone to know that you loved her, you can tell the town in the paper! Want to know how grateful her family is that you're helping this cause? You can get a personal letter delivered to your door! Want to see the end product of what you helped create? How about a glossy photo of the memorial sign to hang on the wall?
  • Of course we're not going to raise all the money for the fence with this one campaign, so if we make all of the goal, get ready for another campaign! Funds will go to a private savings account at Petefish Skiles & Co. in Petersburg, Illinois, called "The Rose Hill Safety Fence."

Risks & Challenges

Since April 16, 2014, we have been trying to get the state and city of Petersburg to work with us on getting Rose Hill to become a safer place. Just because it's not a high accident site, doesn't mean precautions shouldn't be taken to prevent more deaths like Shara's.

Since the accident, Trisha (sister) and Michelle (mother) have worked in tandem to write papers and presentations on why and how the fence should be erected in Shara's memory and for others' safety. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't afford to donate? No worries! 

  • Share this with your friends who can! Making some noise about this is just as valuable as donating money because it tells IDOT, the city of Petersburg, and Rose Hill Cemetery that one death because of this failure to take precaution is one too many and we will not stand for it!
  • Please share this on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr - anywhere you can! The more people we get in on this, the sooner Rose Hill Cemetery will be a safe place for people to visit the dead instead of become the dead. 
If $500 is raised before the end of the 60 day mark, Indiegogo will keep this campaign running to earn even MORE money for Shara's fence! Keep it alive!! #KeepSharaAlive!!

story:
We are committed to assisting Korean Canadian seniors and their caregivers who are not able to access mainstream resources and social services in community due to their language barriers and lack of support in the Korean language.

Many Korean seniors who have language barriers and live alone in their homes are constantly increasing. These seniors are isolated and in desperate need of a Korean social work program to help them to stay safe and healthy in their homes as long as possible.

Better Living for Korean Canadian Seniors Inc, aims to help this isolated population to identify these clients' various needs to improve quality of life comparable to those who are non-immigrant seniors. These seniors immigrated to Canada and resident status are either Canadian citizenship or permanent residency; however, the major community separate these seniors from the society due to their ethnic, culture and language.

Everyone should be treated equally and have the same access to health and social services and support.

Please show your support to these seniors to help them to live safe and healthy in their homes!

The power to help these seniors is in your hand.

베터 리빙 복지센터는 사회복지사들이 모여 이루어진 비영리 단체로 토론토 서쪽과 이토비코 지역내 정부 운영 아파트에 도움없이 홀로 거주하시는 한인 어르신들께 전문적인 사회복지 사례관리 서비스를 지원해드리고 있습니다.
많은 수의 한인 어르신들께서 홀로 정부아파트에 거주하시는 경우가 점점 증가하고 있음에도 불구하고, 이분들이 생활하시는 도중 위기 상황이 오거나 어려움이 있을때 도움을 요청할 한국어로 도와드리는 사회복지 서비스가 많이 부족한 실정입니다. 더불어, 언어 장벽으로 인하여 캐나다의 좋은 건강 및 사회복지 서비스를 이용하시지 못하고 있습니다.
베터 리빙 복지센터는 지역사회에서 생활하면서 어려움 혹은 불편함을 겪는 한인 어르신들께 필요한 서비스를 제공함으로서 지역사회내에서 건강하고 존엄성 있게 생활하시도록 지원합니다.
베터 리빙 복지센터는 현재 정부와 지역사회내 다양한 경로로 grant를 신청하고 있으나 grant를 받기까지 많은 어려움을 겪고 있으며, 현재 센터 운영에도 많은 어려움이 있습니다.
비영린 단체인 베터 리빙 복지센터가 지속적으로 한인 어르신들께 사회복지 서비스를 제공해드릴 수 있도록 많은 후원 부탁 드립니다.

story:
Attached is a link to a story that was written about Aidan in our local food pantry news letter.  When friends and family saw it they were interested in helping Aidan in the future.  So Aidan and I talked and I said I would set up a fundraising site for him and post it on my facebook page.  He and I talked about a goal for this year, and we are hoping that we have so many diapers to deliver that we will need more than our car to deliver them.  We have a family friend with a pick up truck and we discussed how great it would be if we needed his help with our shopping trip and delivery! 

One more thing...I shared an article with Aidan about what food pantries need and he was sad to know that the children may not get any chocolate during the holiday season as chocolate is rarely donated.  So we are going to take a little of our money and buy some chocolate bars too!

Proud Mom 

12/5 update - I asked Indiegogo to change our goal, since our original goal was met in 24 hours!  Aidan and his Aunt Mary wanted $1200 for a new goal so I went for it .  Aidan is now hoping we will need to rent a UHaul for the diaper delivery!  Thanks again for helping, the lessons we learn through giving are truly special.


http://oprffoodpantry.org/images/uploads/Pantry...
story_txt: Attached is a link to a story that was written about Aidan in our local food pantry news letter.  When friends and family saw it they were interested in helping Aidan in the future.  So Aidan and I talked and I said I would set up a fundraising site for him and post it on my facebook page.  He and I talked about a goal for this year, and we are hoping that we have so many diapers to deliver that we will need more than our car to deliver them.  We have a family friend with a pick up truck and we discussed how great it would be if we needed his help with our shopping trip and delivery!  One more thing...I shared an article with Aidan about what food pantries need and he was sad to know that the children may not get any chocolate during the holiday season as chocolate is rarely donated.  So we are going to take a little of our money and buy some chocolate bars too!Proud Mom 12/5 update - I asked Indiegogo to change our goal, since our original goal was met in 24 hours!  Aidan and his Aunt Mary wanted $1200 for a new goal so I went for it .  Aidan is now hoping we will need to rent a UHaul for the diaper delivery!  Thanks again for helping, the lessons we learn through giving are truly special.http://oprffoodpantry.org/images/uploads/Pantry...

story:
Short Summary

UPDATE: Starting to have vision problems. Seeing three black spots through my left eye this time. The disability may be harder to get than I thought. I don't understand why it has to be so difficult to get disabilty when it is so clearly necessary.

My name is Anthony Glover, I am 38 years old and was diagnosed with MS when I was 16. One morning I woke up and was blind in my right eye and couldn't feel my right side of my body. Since then I have been in a sort of remission due to my weekly Anvonex shots, but for the last few months, I have taken a turn for the worse and am starting to feel the burden of this chronic disease. Because of this I have decided to apply for disability, but need help taking care of my wife and 4 children in the meantime. I have never asked anyone for help, and it was my wife that talked me into this. I am not sure why people would give to strangers, but since she is so adamant about it, here I am.

What We Need & What You Get

Here is what I am hoping for...since I have decided to apply for disability I am going to be hopeful that I will find out some good news in the next 6 months. I know that is not realistic but I try to stay on the positive side as much as possible. What I am asking for help with is paying our rent for the next 6 months since my legs and back are in constant pain making it impossible for me to even do handy work around the house like I am used to. It honestly kills me inside not to be able to provide for my family. I have never been the type of person to sit back and let this beat me, but I am running out of choices and have to start facing reality. Our rent is $1200 per month and the amount I am asking to raise is for 6 months rent. The only way I can think of to be transparent about this is by sharing the rent receipts with those, if any, that choose to help me and my family.

    The Impact

    I cannot even describe what this would do for me. Even though I didn't earn the money with my own hands like I have all my life, at least I know I took a step to help care for my family. They are the most important things in my life and knowing I can at least keep a roof over their heads means more than I can express.

story:
Loloma Home is in Nadi, Fiji. It is run by two women who started it in 2009. It is a home where women who have suffered abuse, and find themselves pregnant and alone can get shelter, learn skills and be integrated back into the community. Loloma Home also takes care of orphans, some as young as three days old. There are currently 24 women and children at Loloma Home.

This is our second fundraising campaign for the home. Last time we raised $1000 Fiji Dollars! Please help us continue to support them. 

 My husband and I visited this home in August this 2013. We were recommended it by our hotel, because it often gets missed on the tourist trail. We took school supplies, food and a laptop. There are hundreds of soft toys hanging from the ceiling - a sign that while people are keen to help, it is not always things they need that are gifted. Thats why I want to raise them money, so they can control what they get. Buy what they need, when they need it. 

  • It only takes $150FJD to feed everyone for a month! That is just over $100NZD.
  • 100% of what you donate will go directly to Loloma Home even if we do not reach our goal! 
  • Every dollar counts so please contribute anything you can! No amount is too small. 

I want to help raise money for this centre because they survive purely on donations. They do not receive any funding that the larger orphanages do in Fiji. They need food, clothes, and school supplies. These women have devoted their entire lives to these women and children, the least I can try to do is to help them out financially. 

Please like the Loloma Home Fundraiser facebook page as well to help spread the word about this amazing home! https://www.facebook.com/pages/Loloma-Home-Fund...

Email me if you want to contact the home directly and I can provide you with an email address

story:
Show Your Support And Help Our Dream To Come True

Hello, my name is Quintonio Blakney, a veteran window film installer with over 12 years experience in the automotive and residential window film/tint industry. I need your help with bringing this business to life. With my experience in the window film/tint industry there is a lack of great customer service and high quality products at an affordable price. I would like to give my clients the ultimate customer experience where both male and female could come and feel comfortable to know that they will receive the best service and quality product at an affordable rate with no worries.

About Us

Tinter’s Elite Automotive & Residential Window Film is a startup specialty window tinting shop that will be launched in the coming months. We will sell and install premium high quality automotive and residential window film. 

How Will The Funds Be Used?

Total start-up funding needed is $11K, which all funds will go towards:

  • ·    Company Location 
  • ·    Inventory
  • ·    Legal Fees
  • ·    Building Signs
  • ·    Stationery
  • ·    Location Renovations
  • ·    Marketing
  • ·    Uniforms
  • ·    Indiegogo Fees
  • ·    And other related expenses

What Happens To The Funds If Goal Not Reached?

If goal is not reached, all funds will still go toward the business, until business is fully up and running.

What Makes Us Different?


Tinter’s Elite Automotive & Residential Window Film will set itself apart from other window film/tint service facilities that may offer only one or two types of services. While talking to several people, they are frustrated with going to different businesses to accomplish their goals.

However, I am proposing to make this window tint/film shop a "one stop shop" business. The focus of Tinter’s Elite Automotive & Residential Window Film is high quality premium window film/tint, affordability, and overall customer experience. The services we are going to provide will be above and beyond what our competition can offer.

Our business atmosphere will be clean, friendly and upscale where customers will be comfortable leaving their vehicles. We will offer a personal touch, such as customer care packages and customer loyalty incentives rewards for those that registered with Tinter’s Elite Automotive & Residential Window Film.

Why Invest In Automotive and Residential Window Film/Tint?

Automotive window film/tinting creates a cool, custom look for your vehicle, but not many people know there are many other functional benefits of window film/tint your automobile or home.

Automotive and Residential window film/tint blocks up to 99% of the sun’s harmful UV rays, If you are in the car for extended periods, car window tinting is important for protecting you and loved ones from cancer-causing UV rays. UV protection comes in various grades, and you do not need to have windows significantly darkened to block UV.

In addition to UV, the sun also tends to create uncomfortable heat inside your car. Window tinting also blocks up to 71% of solar energy, which allows a person to stay comfortable and prevent expensive, overuse of the AC.

Car and home windows are designed to reduce injury when broken, but automotive and residential window film/tint brings window security to a new level. Since window tint covers entire panes, broken glass stays in one piece, greatly reducing chances of injury from glass shards. An added benefit is that cleanup is much easier after breakage.

Automotive window tinting also protects from car theft. Security tint makes car windows more durable, and, since broken glass is held together, even a thief that succeeds in breaking a window is still faced with a solid panel of glass and film.

This is your chance to make Tinter’s Elite Automotive & Residential Window Film/Tint a reality by adding your contribution to it…

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share and help us reach our goal. Thank You!

story:
Couth Buzzard Books

Building Community. One Book... One Cup at a time

Who We Are

Couth Buzzard books is a bookstore & communty space in Seattle, Washington.  For over 25 years, we've been serving North Seattle and the surrounding  communities. Since moving to our current location five years ago  we've expanded to include a cafe, and performance space where local musicians, poets, writers, comedians, dancers, artists, & other performers come to share their talents and passions.   With your support, we plan on purchasing a selection of high quality microphones, an audio interface, and video equipment so that we can share our regular events with the rest of the world.

What We Need

Our goal is $2,500 towards audio/video gear, including:

  • A selection of quality microphones and cables
  • Audio interface & recorder
  • Video Camera

Expanding Our Community into the Digital Realm

With your help we can produce:

  • Regular online videos for those who can't be here in person
  • A future series of "Live at the Couth" albums
  • Streaming video for the masses

The Challenge

With this modest sum, we know we can achieve quite a lot. The video above was produced with only a webcam and a single microphone. With your help , we know we can achieve MUCH MORE!

Other Ways You Can Help

For those without the ability to help out financially, you can:

  • Share our campaign with your friends and family on Facebook and other social media sites. We REALLY appreciate your help!
  • Spread the word any other way you can.

And that's the plan. Wish us luck,
Your friends at the Couth
