story:
Die erste Investment-Genossenschaft zur Finanzierung von Startups ohne Kredite.
YMALA soll für Unternehmensgründer nicht nur Geldgeber sondern auch Partner sein. Dafür wird mit ihnen ein Unternehmen gegründet, wobei YMALA einen Großteil der Anteile hält. Diese Unternehmen verpflichten sich zum einen zu den YMALA-Standards und zum anderen dazu, einen Teil ihres Umsatzes an YMALA zu zahlen, um wiederum neue Startups unterstützen zu können.

Worum geht es in diesem Projekt?

Die Gründung einer Genossenschaft zur Förderung von Geschäftsideen und Innovation.

Ziel ist es nicht, dass YMALA als Unternehmen wirtschaftet, sondern Menschen mit Geschäftsideen das nötige Kapital zur Verfügung stellt und ihnen mit Rat und Tat zur Seite steht.

Diese Genossenschaft soll Dachgesellschaft unterschiedlicher Unternehmungen sein. Sie gründet für Menschen mit einer perspektivischen Geschäftsidee ein Unternehmen.

Warum sollte man dieses Projekt unterstützen?

Es ermöglicht Euch die Mitgliedschaft in einer Genossenschaft, welche Innovation nicht nur finanziell fördert, sondern auch langfristig inhaltlich unterstützt.
Dabei sind die gegründeten Unternehmen nicht abhängig von Investoren, die auf hohe Gewinne und Renditen aus sind oder Banken, welche hohe Sicherheiten fordern.

Außerdem erhaltet Ihr, wenn Ihr der Genossenschaft beitretet, bei allen angegliederten Unternehmen einen Rabatt.
YMALA fördert Innovation ohne die Verpflichtung zu hohen Renditen.

Vorteile für Unternehmensgründer:
-geringes Risiko
-Werbung für ihre Idee durch die YMALA-Community
-Freier Handlungsspielraum
-Beratung und Förderung
-Keine Verpflichtung zu Gewinnausschüttung

Vorteile der Mitglieder der Genossenschaft:
-Mitspracherecht auf der Hauptversammlung
-5% Rabatt bei allen Tochterunternehmen
-Unterstützung von Geschäftsideen und gerechten Arbeitsbedingungen

Das sind die YMALA-Standards:
-Keine aggressiven Werbemaßnahmen sowie keine Fremdwerbung auf eigenen Medien
-Die Unternehmen sind auf langfristiges Bestehen und Arbeitsplatzsicherheit ausgerichtet.
-Förderung sozialer Arbeitsbedingungen
-35 h / Woche
-15€ Mindestlohn
-Höchster Lohn soll maximal das 5-fache vom niedrigsten Lohn betragen
-Umweltschonendes Arbeiten
-Es sollte eine „cradle-to-cradle“-Zertifizierung anvisiert werden
-Non-Profit-Orientierung

Die Standards sollen ein gesellschaftliches Zeichen setzen, in dem sie Nachhaltigkeit und Wirtschaft verbinden. Außerdem sollen Menschen von ihrem Einkommen leben können, ohne auf öffentliche Gelder angewiesen zu sein. Dafür steht der Slogan "Zukunft mit Innovation".
So soll eine Unternehmenskultur geschaffen werden, welche auf langfristiges Bestehen, Innovation und soziale Arbeitsbedingungen ausgerichtet ist.

Über die Umsetzung von Geschäftsideen entscheidet die Genossenschaft. Aber es soll auch den Genossenschaftsmitgliedern möglich sein, sich für ein Projekt auszusprechen.

Was sind die Ziele und wer die Zielgruppe?

Ziel ist es, sichere und gerechte Arbeitsbedingungen zu schaffen.

Unsere Zielgruppen sind Menschen wie Sie mit innovativen Geschäftsideen und Menschen wie Ihnen, die diese unterstützen wollen.

Was passiert mit dem Geld bei erfolgreicher Finanzierung?

Bei erfolgreicher Finanzierung fließt das Geld in die Gründung einer Genossenschaft, Schaffung einer Organisation sowie in die Finanzierung der ersten Projekte.
Zusätzlich muss eine Internetseite konzipiert, das Marketingkonzept entwickelt und ein Logo gestaltet werden.
Nach dieser Finanzierung ist es jedem möglich, Genossenschaftsanteile zu erwerben. Bisher ist geplant, dass diese für 50€ zzgl. 50€ Eintrittsgeld und einem jährlichen Beitrag von 24€ zu erhalten sind.

Als erstes Projekt soll ein Jabber Server eingerichtet werden, der kostenfrei genutzt werden kann. Jabber ermöglicht eine sichere und kostenfreie Kommunikation. Ein weiterer Vorteil ist, dass Jabber eine plattformunabhängige Kommunikation bietet und Ihr dadurch auch mit Freunden schreiben könnt, die bei einem anderen Anbieter sind.
Die kontinuierliche Finanzierung soll über die Genossenschaft laufen.


English Version

YMALA wants to be a partner for entrepreneurs not only a financier. For this purpose, a new company will be founded for a start-up where YMALA will hold the majority of shares. The new company will commit itself to the YMALA standards and will pay a part of its sales to YMALA in order to support new start-ups.

What is the Project about?

The establishment of a cooperative to promote business ideas and innovation.

The objective does not consists of being a profit-orientated enterprise but rather aiming at providing people with business ideas with the necessary capital as well as professional advice and assistance.

This cooperative is supposed to be the holding companies of different activities. It is founding a GmbH (company) for people like you with a perspectival business idea.

Why should you support this Project?

It allows you to be a member in an innovative cooperative, which promotes not only financial, but also technical innovation.

The established companies are not dependent on neither investors, who aim at high profits and returns nor on banks, which require high securities.

In addition, you will receive a discount on all products of affiliates companies by joining the cooperative.

YMALA encourages innovation without the commitment to high returns.

Benefits for Company Founders:

-General low risk
-Advertisement of their idea provided by the community of YMALA
-Free scope
-Consulting and promotion
-Support of business ideas as well as just and reasonable working condition

Benefits for Members:
-A say at every shareholders' meeting
-5% discount on all products of every subsidiary company
-Support of innovative business ideas as well as fair working conditions

For the Companies apply the YMALA Standards:

-No aggressive advertising and no foreign advertise on its own media
-companies should focuse on long-term existence and job security
-15€/h minimum wage
-The highest wage is maximally five times higher than the lowest wage
-Environmentally friendly work
-It should be aimed at a “cradle-to-cradle” certification
-Renewable energy and materials should be preferred

The standards should represent and develop a social character in which they combine sustainability and business. In addition, people should be able to live on their income without having to rely on public funding. This also shows the slogan of YMALA “Future with Innovation“. This is why a corporate culture should be created which insists on long-term existence, innovation and social working conditions.

On the implementation of business ideas decides the cooperative, but it should also be possible to speak out for a project by the members.

What are the Aims and who is the Target Group?

The goal is to create safe and equitable working conditions.

Our target groups are people with innovative business ideas and people supporting them.

What happens with the Funding?

Upon successful financing, the money goes into the funding of a cooperative, creation of the organisation as well as in the financing of the first projects.

In addition, YMALA needs a website, the developing of the marketing concept and a logo design. After the funding, everybody is able to acquire any shares of the cooperative. So far it is planned that this will cost 50€ plus 50€ entrance fee and an annual contribution of 24€.

The first project will be setting up a Jabber server, which can be used free of charge. Jabber allows secure and free communication. The platform-independent communication of Jabber is another advantage of YMALA.

The continued funding will run on the cooperative.

Die Standards sollen ein gesellschaftliches Zeichen setzen, in dem
sie Nachhaltigkeit und Wirtschaft verbinden. Außerdem sollen
Menschen von ihrem Einkommen leben können, ohne auf öffentliche
Gelder angewiesen zu sein. Dafür steht der Slogan "Zukunft mit
Innovation".So soll eine Unternehmenskultur geschaffen
werden, welche auf langfristiges Bestehen, Innovation und soziale
Arbeitsbedingungen ausgerichtet ist.
Über die Umsetzung von Geschäftsideen entscheidet die
Genossenschaft. Aber es soll auch den Genossenschaftsmitgliedern
möglich sein, sich für ein Projekt auszusprechen.
Was sind die Ziele und wer die Zielgruppe?
Ziel ist es, sichere und gerechte Arbeitsbedingungen zu schaffen.
Unsere Zielgruppen sind Menschen wie Sie mit innovativen
Geschäftsideen und Menschen wie Ihnen, die diese unterstützen
wollen.
Was passiert mit dem Geld bei erfolgreicher
Finanzierung?
Bei erfolgreicher Finanzierung fließt das Geld in die Gründung
einer Genossenschaft, Schaffung einer Organisation sowie in die
Finanzierung der ersten Projekte.Zusätzlich muss eine
Internetseite konzipiert, das Marketingkonzept entwickelt und ein
Logo gestaltet werden.Nach dieser Finanzierung ist es jedem
möglich, Genossenschaftsanteile zu erwerben. Bisher ist geplant,
dass diese für 50€ zzgl. 50€ Eintrittsgeld und einem jährlichen
Beitrag von 24€ zu erhalten sind.
Als erstes Projekt soll ein Jabber Server eingerichtet werden, der
kostenfrei genutzt werden kann. Jabber ermöglicht eine sichere und
kostenfreie Kommunikation. Ein weiterer Vorteil ist, dass Jabber eine
plattformunabhängige Kommunikation bietet und Ihr dadurch auch mit
Freunden schreiben könnt, die bei einem anderen Anbieter sind.Die
kontinuierliche Finanzierung soll über die Genossenschaft laufen.


English Version



YMALA wants to be a
partner for entrepreneurs not only a financier. For this purpose, a
new company will be founded for a start-up where YMALA will hold the
majority of shares. The new company will commit itself to the YMALA
standards and will pay a part of its sales to YMALA in order to
support new start-ups.


What is the Project about?
The establishment of a
cooperative to promote business ideas and innovation.
The objective does not
consists of being a profit-orientated enterprise but rather aiming at
providing people with business ideas with the necessary capital as
well as professional advice and assistance.
This cooperative is
supposed to be the holding companies of different activities. It is
founding a GmbH (company) for people like you with a perspectival
business idea.


Why should you support this Project?
It allows you to be a
member in an innovative cooperative, which promotes not only
financial, but also technical innovation.
The established companies
are not dependent on neither investors, who aim at high profits and
returns nor on banks, which require high securities.
In addition, you will
receive a discount on all products of affiliates companies by joining
the cooperative.
YMALA encourages
innovation without the commitment to high returns.


Benefits for Company Founders:
-General low risk
-Advertisement of their
idea provided by the community of YMALA
-Free scope
-Consulting and promotion
-Support of business ideas
as well as just and reasonable working condition


Benefits for Members:-A
say at every shareholders' meeting-5% discount on all products of
every subsidiary company-Support of innovative business ideas as
well as fair working conditions
For the Companies apply the YMALA
Standards:
-No aggressive advertising
and no foreign advertise on its own media
-companies should focuse
on long-term existence and job security
-15€/h minimum wage
-The highest wage is
	maximally five times higher than the lowest wage
-Environmentally
	friendly work
-It should be aimed at
	a “cradle-to-cradle” certification
-Renewable energy and
	materials should be preferred
The standards should
represent and develop a social character in which they combine
sustainability and business. In addition, people should be able to
live on their income without having to rely on public funding. This
also shows the slogan of YMALA  “Future with Innovation“. This is
why a corporate culture should be created which insists on long-term
existence, innovation and social working conditions.
On the implementation of
business ideas decides the cooperative, but it should also be
possible to speak out for a project by the members.
What are the Aims and who is the
Target Group?
The goal is to create safe
and equitable working conditions.
Our target groups are
people with innovative business ideas and people supporting them.


What happens with the Funding?
Upon successful financing,
the money goes into the funding of a cooperative, creation of the
organisation as well as in the financing of the first projects.
In addition, YMALA needs a
website, the developing of the marketing concept and a logo design.
After the funding, everybody is able to acquire any shares of the
cooperative. So far it is planned that this will cost 50€ plus 50€
entrance fee and an annual contribution of 24€.


The first project will be
setting up a Jabber server, which can be used free of charge. Jabber
allows secure and free communication. The platform-independent
communication of Jabber is another advantage of YMALA.
The continued funding will
run on the cooperative.

story:
Short Summary

Europa Power Yoga is a unique yoga studio in Florence, Italy.  We have found a beautiful space in the center of town to bring the practice of yoga to our community as well as creating a new and fresh space for the community to use for art projects, music and especially YOGA!

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need 8000 Euros to remodel the space so we can make it accesible and comfortable for our students and the community.  Our vision is to put down new flooring, buy furniture for our lounging area, buy a sound system for the space, build changing rooms for men and women.  We want our community to feel that there is a space where they can come practice yoga as well as explore creativity.  
  • In exchange for your generous contribution, we are offering free yoga classes and a cool Europa Power Yoga T-shirt 

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Yoga is a powerful practice that creates in increase in positive vibrations.  The more people come together the higher the vibration of the world will become.  We are on a mission to create a community based on positivity and peace.

story:
You can still give! Thanks to everyone who donated to help us reach our goal! There is still some time left to our campaign so if you are interested in one of our awesome perks, feel free to continue to donate. If we hit $2,000 we'll give all the contributors a free Avenue 209 bumper sticker. 

Who We Are

  • Avenue 209 Coffee House serves the best in coffee and tea the Lock Haven area has to offer.
  • We provide a sit-down space for the community, inviting you into our living-room atmosphere.
  • We embrace the arts through live music, poetry and book readings and graphic art expositions.

What We Need & What You Get

A Double Coffee Brewer! 

  • Check out our perks to see the classy stuff we're offering!

The Impact

  • If we've run out of coffee because we're busy (or get caught slacking) it can take up to FIVE MINUTES to brew another carafe of coffee!
  • The campaign to buy a double brewer saves you time!
  • We would love the opportunity to serve our product at special catering events such as weddings, parties and business functions.

Looking Forward

  • We've been on the local business scene for five years now, and are committed to serving the community through good coffee and the arts.
  • And we won't stop there! Furthering this project will pave the way for the purchase of a on-site coffee roaster as well as many more tools to help serve you better.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
As part of this year`s Genworth Office2Office charity cycling we support "Salt Academy" in Cambodia.

A team of 22 sport- enthusiastic Genworth employees contribution will be a 4 days cycling event starting from London HQ office and ending at our French office in Paris getting over around 500km in 4 days (June 6 - June 9/10 2014). 

Apart from the roads we need YOUR support!

From my network I know the Swiss representative of "Salt Academy" personally and they do great work in Cambodia already since a couple of years. A combination of education and sports "Salt Academy" gives sense & hope to street children's future  in Battambang, Cambodia.

 

Check out for more information on "Salt Academy":

http://saltacademy.net/

http://saltacademy.ch/

 

All money from donations will have a direct impact to realize a current, local project to build their own pitch for SALT Academy education.

story:
Our grandfather was in hospital for an extended stay and we visited him almost daily. The cost of parking and food got to be very expensive and as a tribute to him, we would like to raise money to give to other families that have to make frequent trips to the hospital in London, Ontario. Just one less thing to worry about.

We loved him very much and wanted to keep his kindness and memory alive by creating this campaign.

Just one less thing to worry about. We loved him very much and wanted to keep his kindness and memory alive by creating this campaign.

story:
Overthrow New York is to boxing what soul cycle is to cycling, creating a cult-like training experience and filling a need for a functional, efficient, and group oriented boxing workout in the fitness world.


Overthrow New York accomplishes this at 9 Bleecker street, “The Nine”, the former counterculture home of Abbie Hoffman and the Yippies.


Why We Need You to Join the Fight!


Overthrow New York will create a brand and a flagship location, which offers a high intensity anaerobic workout based on classes using boxing as a foundation.  overthrow nyc provides a base for those in need of a high intensity work out in an equally cool and historical venue.


Stemming off of the neighborhood’s long history, Overthrow New York will take cues from CBGBs, the Bowery, underground boxing fight club Friday Night Throwdown, and 9 Bleecker street’s own rich counterculture history.



"THE NINE"

Overthrow New York is located at 9 Bleecker directly off the Bowery. The club's front will feature refurbished signage from the Yippies(created in the 1960s), a neon Overthrow boxing sign, and a roll up garage door to create more demand.

THE OVERTHROW EXPERIENCE

"THE CLUB"

The main level at Overthrow is the first impression for both the fascinated taste-maker and the intrigued passerby. The walls are adorned with framed counterculture and underground posters celebrating the activist history of 9 Bleecker and the punk scene on the Bowery. The main floor will feature the boxing club which will include a branded ring, unique heavy bags and one of a kind speed bags. This area will allow members to check in for group class, shop the Overthrow New York retail concept, grab a juice, or workout with a private trainer.

Overthrow's "Sex and Violence"

“Sex & Violence” is a forty-eight minute high octane anaerobic group boxing workout that will give participants a shot of adrenaline, a sweat they will not soon forget, and euphoric high comparable to only one other "thing".

"THE LOCKER ROOM"

Overthrow New York's locker rooms allow members to change and shower before or after their workout. The steamed glass wall dividing the men's locker room from the women's locker room makes for one of the cities sexiest yet grittiest bathrooms.

"THE UPSIDE"

  • Scale-able workout and retail concept in major cities
  • Complete building 10 year lease
  • Group Workouts Trending like Fly Wheel, Soul Cycle, and Barry's Boot Camp
  • Location Location Location-Bowery hotel, Standard East, Ace Hostel all within several block radius
  • Home of Rock star Charlie and Friday Night Throw Down
  • Off the Bowery, a television show about the building, concept and team is currently being pitched to production companies.

story:
Hello,

My name is Patricia. I am Mother, Grandmother and Matriarch of our extended family. "The glue that holds the family together", this is what any family member will proclaim about me. I pride myself on family and faith. I am to be found at the heart of our family's triumphs just as often as I am there to help when things aren't going so well.  We have a huge amount of ideas that come from the bright minds of my family. I love my children, grandchildren and great-granddaughter. In this family we stick together like glue. If you would like to help me continue to secure the financial future of this family-donate now!

What We Need:

We need to obtain a commercial production facility, equipment and delivery vehicles. Demand for our product has outgrown our kitchen. We have a high demand for our sauce and are unable to fill orders because of the small amount of product that we are able to create, bottle label and package in a day. Therefore we are never able to get ahead of our production. We need a facility which would give us the freedom to be able to create multiple batches daily.

What We Do:

Mamma Bianco's Pasta Sauce and the family that created it needs your help. We have been successful at producing small batches of quality product from a kitchen. We have attracted lots of customers at gourmet food stores in, DE and PA. Select supermarket chains are carrying or are considering carrying our product. Handling this explosion of interest requires larger production, packaging, storage facilities and delivery vehicles. To secure a commercial production facility as well as equipment and delivery vehicles will cost about $500,000. With your help, the time frame that we could get this accomplished in will be about 6 months.

story:
Hi! I'm Mary

I am a 24 year old college graduate from Raleigh, North Carolina. I currently live in Stuart, Virginia where I have been working as a barista and a traveling saleswoman of musical instruments. My dream is to be fluent in Chinese, have at least one goat, be embedded in a community, and someday be employed with a living wage.

Synopsis for the impatient reader ;)

-I live with my ex boyfriend in a small town with no jobs in Virginia.

-I work but I have no money because of college loans and other expenses.

-I am moving to Tucson, Arizona because I have friends there, I have a lot of job opportunities, and I want to go to school there.

-I need your help funding my move

-The money will go towards car rental expenses, places to sleep each night of the move, feeding me, and first month's rent at my new home (which is very reasonably priced).

Why I am in Stuart

Stuart, Virginia is a small but gorgeous town of 1400 friendly people. The locals often refer to Stuart as a retirement town because there are no jobs here and an enormous retired population. I came to Stuart with my boyfriend (at the time) to transition between teaching stints in China and also to stake out our future dream commune (goats included) on his grandmother's magically beautiful 30 acres. What was supposed to be a handful of months spent here has quickly turned into a year as I have watched my savings disappear to college loan payments, pet expenses, and other bills. My now ex-boyfriend's family is well-rooted in Stuart and have been an amazing support network for us but, unfortunately, we recently made an amicable decision to end our relationship, which leaves me with no future commune, no imminent trip to China, and basically no options.

Why the future looks bright

I have a plan.

For years now my application to the University of Arizona (U of A) has been completed and sitting idly in a computer file. I have always planned on moving to Tucson to get in-state tuition before applying. With the financial support of friends I have visited Tucson, Arizona five years in a row to spend time with my best friend in the universe Rodin and to correspond with Chinese professors at the U of A. In my five visits I have even made new friends, some of whom I foresee being lifelong best friends. When my relationship ended I knew right away that I wanted to be in Tucson. This vagabond has been aching for Tucson since visit one. 

So on the seventh of August my friend Geri and I will be packing up a rental car and on the eighth we will be setting out on a four day journey to my new life. My friends have been amazingly supportive to me both emotionally and logistically. Geri will be flying back to NC with her own money and the ticket is already bought. I already have a house, a job interview, and some odd jobs lined up to get me on the ground running. I'll be working with kids, which I love and I'll be embedded in a community of people I love. 

Why I need your help/ How your money will be used

Simply put I am broke and moving cross-country is insanely expensive. I guarantee I'm doing it the cheapest way possible. I've gotten rid of most of my belongings so I  am only taking my dog, my diabetic cat, my clothes, and my art supplies. The money you donate will go towards renting a car for the move (~$800), a place to stay each night of the journey (~$200), and the first month of rent and living expenses (~$500). On a more meaningful level the money you donate will be used to help a struggling person thrive and eventually give back wherever possible. 

Spread the word! Claim your prizes!

If you know me or you know what it's like to be in this kind of position please help spread the word! I have a very limited time to raise the money and I am counting on your support. I cannot express how much I appreciate your donations and I know that in the future I will be a force of aid for others in need. Also note that the first people to donate will be awarded with some amazing perks! Each of them is different so be sure to check them out!
